story:
The Show - Nancy Clench: Down Right Dirty

I've wanted to take a show to the Edinburgh Fringe for quite some time, but after my recent successes in the comedy world - including my nomination for Best New Comedian at The Scottish Variety Awards - I finally set out to organise my show. 

Taking a show costs a lot of money - the fees for the Fringe alone stand in over £200. Add in the venue hire, box office charges, publicity, materials, travel, accommodation as well as putting on previews to ensure the best media coverage - it all adds up. 

I'm looking for some help to make this show the best I can put on, to a full audience each night - and I want to give you back something to say thanks and show my appreciation.

There is a bunch of perks to donating, along with my eternal gratitude! Check them out to the right >>>>

The show will run Wed 20th - Sun 24th of August at 10:30pm in Spotlites @ The Merchants' Hall which is just up from the National Gallery! 

My target is £500 - this would cover my publicity budget to ensure maximum coverage for the show. It would be great if I could cover other aspects, but I'm just so appreciative of your support that any little help will help make this show a reality. 

Everyone who donates will get a special thank you - but for now in advance - thank you! Please share with your friends, colleagues or anyone who you think might be up for donating. 

Much love,

Nancy x

story:
Update: THANKYOU!  Website is live again, comics are printed.  Campaign = success.  You'll get your comics and books in due course!


A bit about me.

Hi I'm Josh Clarke.  In the last year I've taken up becoming a comic artist.  I've completed my first comic and am getting it self-published.  I'm now working on other comics too.


Why IndieGogo?

As I push forward in the comic world I'm going to need a lot of support.  I've seen success and received a lot of praise online with  what I've done, now I need to get it into people's hands.

The success of this campaign guarantees my work will reach the hands of those who've offered me so much support with my work over the last few months and years, and meets many new eyes as well.  

Target

Set what I beleive is a very real target of £300/$500. This will go someway towards what is needed to get my work seen by the right people in the coming months, and if I can pass my goal it'd be very much appreciated.  The money raised will go towards these costs:

Comic event exhibition costs for KaPow! Comic Convention in April, London MCM Expo and Bristol International Comics and Small Press Expo in May (approx. £137 / $220)

Production costs for the second larger print run of my comic, itsjustjoshdotcom, which is going up to 32 pages rather than 28 to allow for more content.  Plus production costs for the book @youcantweetjosh: Year One (approx. £150/$240)

Promotional materials, such as business cards and banners (approx. £60/$100)

Web hosting towards my portfolio and webcomic, itsjustjoshdotcom, and its follow-up, The Elemals.  (approx. £90/$145)
Recently itsjustjosh.com and elemals.net have been disabled due to lack of funds and I've had to move everything to deviantART/facebook, which are great sharing platforms but ultimately my own presence is best.

Misc costs (such as travel and shipping)

Much more than the target I've set on IndieGogoso hopefully I hit or even exceed the goal.

The Good bit - what you'll get!


So, it's only fair you receive something for your kind, kind contributions.  Check the table to the right to see what's in it for you.  :)


- Josh*

story:
How far is too far?
How much is too much?

The Lengths.

In 2007, the Arts Council funded me to conduct a research project interviewing men who sell sex to men in London. The results of the interviews have formed the basis for the comic I’ve been working on over the last couple of months.

The comic will tell the story of Eddie, a young man who moves to London to art school, but in his quest to find himself, he finds Nelson, a muscled prostitute who he becomes infatuated with and follows into a world of drugs and vice and then his quest for absolution once he finds that it’s a life he’s not cut out for.

I’m currently drawing the artwork for the first issue, but I have a story planned across eight issues that takes us through quite a ride with Eddie and his clients, lovers and friends and it’s this first issue that I’m asking for help with at the moment.

It’s a story I want to reach as wide an audience as possible, so I’m looking for your help to cover printing and marketing costs to help this happen as it’s an ambitious project that I believe will get a lot of attention. Once the first print run is out, I will be promoting the comic heavily and trying to secure a distribution deal for a wider release early next year.

As you can imagine, it’s a lot of work for one person, but it’s a labour of love for me to go down this path.

Join me – I’m quite certain it’ll be an exciting journey.

story:
Thanks for supporting our Batman We Can Be Heroes campaign. We’re at it again – this time featuring the whole Justice League. Check it out at fighthun.gr/JusticeLeague. 

It’s time to walk the walk.

For every hero, there comes a day. A day when they step forward. A day when talk turns to action. Over 8 million people have had their lives affected by the hunger crisis in the Horn of Africa. It’s bad. And it hasn’t been this bad in over 60 years.

All of us at DC Entertainment are joining with Batman and the Justice League and making a stand. Today is the day we fight. 

Hey everyone, just a few updates: 

  • We can only fulfill perks within the United States
  • The $25 Batman/Superman #1 WCBH variant cover delivery date has been delayed to October 2013. 
  • For any questions please email us at wecanbeheroes@lapromo.com. 

You want some of this?

In the fight against the hunger crisis, we’re not backing down. We're just getting started. Together, we hit our goal and raised $50,000 in two days after the campaign's launch. And now, we're working towards a new goal of raising $100,000 for our nonprofit partners so that we can bring more support to this fight.

Check out the amazing stuff designed for you by the creative community that brings Batman to life in comic books, video games, animated series, movies and more. From one-of-a-kind items, to once-in-a-lifetime fan experiences you’ll never forget, our guys have come together to create exclusive Batman stuff just for you.

This stuff is only available until May 10, 2013, so check out the latest perks. (And scroll down to see how you can get something good and do something great, just for visiting the campaign!)

Batman/Superman #1 WCBH Variant Cover

Heads up, collectors. This is your only chance to get this exclusive, limited edition cover by the legendary Jim Lee!

Batman/Superman #1 WCBH Shirt

Original design from creative genius Jim Lee, available only through the We Can Be Heroes campaign. 

DC Entertainment VIP Event

Be one of the first fans to attend the DC Entertainment VIP event and meet your favorite DC Entertainment artists and writers.

It’s all only available here.

Now, it can all be yours—and you can only get it right here. Because when you join Batman and the Justice League in taking on the hunger crisis, the real hero is you.

This fight can be won. 

That’s why our We Can Be Heroes campaign is partnering with leading organizations who are already on the ground in Africa making a difference. The funds we raise will go to our league of super-committed hunger crisis fighters:

Save the Children—Tirelessly committed to improving the lives of children and families whose lives have been changed by the hunger crisis.

International Rescue Committee—delivering life-changing aid to the world’s most vulnerable people.

Mercy Corps—Unfailingly dedicated to making life more livable in the world’s toughest places.

Join your heroes - and be one yourself. 

It’s not just a message. It’s a reality. When you join in our campaign, you’re making a REAL difference for REAL people. It doesn’t take much. But it does take something, however big or small, from each and every one of us. Give today. It’s that simple. It’s that powerful. 

Download Your Free Campaign Badge

This campaign badge is only available right here. Right-click the image and select Save As, or just drag it to your desktop.

Post it to Facebook, your blog or anywhere you'd like to let the world know you've joined forces with Batman and the rest of the Justice League to fight the hunger crisis.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Is it true that these perks can’t be shipped internationally?

A: Unfortunately, yes. We cannot ship any of these perks internationally for legal reasons. We sincerely appreciate our international fans interest and we encourage them to still donate to We Can Be Heroes.

Q: What T-Shirt size should I order?

A: Our t-shirt sizes are all unisex. Women typically buy a size smaller than usual, while men generally buy the same size or one size larger. We’ve included the chart below to help you out.

Unisex Size Chart

 

S

M

L

XL

XXL

Chest

36 – 38

39 – 41

42 – 44

45 – 47

48 – 50

Waist

29 – 31

32 – 34

35 – 37

38 – 40

41 – 43

Hip

34 – 39

37 – 42

40 – 45

43 – 48

46 – 51

Q:  How often are the perks updated?

A: We usually refresh our perks one a weekly basis; but make sure to check back often because sometimes we can be unpredictable and you don’t want to miss out on some of the amazing perks this time around. Best way to know when new perks are out is to follow us @DCComics on Twitter and DC Comics on Facebook.  

Q:  Where does my donation go?

A: All donations are divided between our three nonprofit partners: International Rescue Committee, Mercy Corps and Save the Children to help fund their efforts on the ground in the Horn of Africa. Every donation, no matter how small, helps.

Q:  Can I donate more than once?

A: Yes. You can donate a thousand times. Not only will you get a cool new perk each time but you will be helping the men, women and children struggling with the hunger crisis in the Horn of Africa.

Q:  What if I have more questions?

A: We would love to hear from you. If you have questions related to the perks or a donation please feel free to email us at wecanbeheroes@lapromo.com. If you just have a general comment on the campaign please feel free to express yourself on our Indiegogo comment page

Rules & Restrictions

ALL PERKS: The perks above are subject to availability on indiegogo.com/at/wecanbeheroes from Tuesday, 4/2/13 at 9:00 a.m. ET/6:00 a.m. PT through Friday, 5/10/13 at 11:59:59 p.m. ET/ 8:59:59 p.m PT and are available only to residents of the 50 United States and the District of Columbia. All applicable Warner Bros. rules and regulations apply.

5 DIGITAL COMICS: This perk requires the donor to be registered (or to register) with comiXology. Redemption is subject to comiXology's Terms of Use. Downloads must be completed by 7/31/13.

1-YEAR PRINT SUBSCRIPTION: This perk requires the donor to be registered (or register) with DCComics.com. Subscription is subject to DC Comics Terms of Use. Titles subject to availability. If the subscription title is cancelled, the remainder of the subscription will be fulfilled with an age appropriate title to be selected by DC Comics in its sole good faith discretion. Redemption must be completed by 7/31/13.

DC ENTERTAINMENT VIP EVENT: This perk is valid for the donor and one companion and is subject to Warner Bros. Rules & regulations. The event will take place between Thursday, 7/18/13 and Saturday, 7/20/13 in San Diego, CA. Redemption of this perk does not include travel, accommodations or badges to 2013 Comic-Con: International. DC Entertainment talent appearance at the event is subject to their availability.

MEET GEOFF JOHNS & GARY FRANK: This perk includes roundtrip economy transportation for donor and one travel companion from a major gateway airport near the donor's residence (final determination of the departure airport is at the sole discretion of Warner Bros.) to the actual destination city airport (final determination of the destination city and airport is at the sole discretion of Warner Bros. The trip must originate from within the 50 United States or the District of Columbia, with a destination of San Diego, CA. Also included is roundtrip destination ground transportation from airport to hotel in San Diego area (airport-hotel-airport); mode of transportation to be determined by Warner Bros. In addition, two nights hotel accommodations at a hotel of Warner Bros.' choosing (includes costs for one room, double occupancy, room and tax only for two night to be determined by Warner Bros., between Thursday, 7/18/13 and Sunday, 7/21/13) and two badges to 2013 Comic-Con: International (4-day without preview badge) in San Diego, CA will also be provided. Date, time and location of lunch with Geoff Johns and Gary Frank is subject to their availabilities between Thursday, 7/18/13 and Sunday, 7/21/13.

™ & © 2013 DC Comics. All rights reserved.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Mike Syfritt. I'm one of the founding member to the Arizona Steampunk Society. My passion is to build the coolest and most elaborate costumes I can make. I have won awards for many of my costumes and props that I have made over the last few years.

Just like most people I work full time and live on a fixed income so coming up with the funds to finish a new project can become quite dificult at times.

This new costume is no exception to what I can do. Everything I make gets better for each new challenge I take on. With the Joker i'm taking a very different route. Based on the image I posted from odingraphics on Devient art I will be using some of the elements for his artwork and adding quite the twist.

The Back story for the Joker goes like this. Back in the late 1800s when Tesla and Jefferson were duking it out in the ellectric war they came up with the ellectric chair for criminals to face instead of a hanging. As this was a shure death factor they backed up their cames by statin that any criminal to survive the chair would be released to the public. Joke of course as crazy as he is survived. The process however scorthced his haed and burned off his hair. 

So what does the Joker do? He uses the ellectrofied helmet as a hat and adds his own green flair to it. Since they didn;t want hime talking they also used the face and chin cover which I will make look like the Hanibal style face and chin gaurd but in the shape of the Jokers smile.

This is where you come in. I will need several expensive materials to make this happen.

What We Need & What You Get

I will be molding Leather, Skulpting and casting parts along with having the outfit made for me. This is the most I have ever had to put into a costume before. I will need to get Scilicone and casting materials as well as fabric for my coat and pants. All this costs money that I just can't come up with in the short time I have to finish this costume.

I figured I can get everything I need with about $600. I'm still working on coming up with my own money so what ever I can get to help me get this finish on time would be great.

In return for the funding I will get each person an autographed professional photo of me in costume. I can also include for the big spenders a chance to sit in on one of the panels I will be hosting at Comicon.

The Impact

The main things I will be working on with be The Electric Chair Headpiece, the Brass Flower that squrts toxic SmileX and the Tesla Cole powered hand shocker. 

You can see some of the things I have made on my Deviant art page and Facebook.

http://aestheticreations.deviantart.com/

This is the Joker I'm refrencing.

I have some of the components for these items already but the one thing I need the most is Scilicone and Casting resin. I will be making the hand buzzer from clay and then making a cast of that. As you can see in the image he has copper coils inside the buzzer as well as Tesla type coils on the outside of the arm. The arm coils I will be using EL wire.

What this image does not show is the headpiece. It will be a traditional Electricchair headpiece but I will be adding Jokers "Hair" to the leather with EL wire mixed in as well. The hair is going to be Dreadlocks.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don;t have funds to help then please help spread the word. I only have 3 weeks to finish this project so every little bit counts. 

Don;t forget you can just share this directly to your friends on FB and Twitter so go now and spread the word! :D

The main things I will be working on with be The Electric Chair Headpiece, the Brass Flower that squrts toxic SmileX and the Tesla Cole powered hand shocker. 
You can see some of the things I have made on my Deviant art page and Facebook.
http://aestheticreations.deviantart.com/
This is the Joker I'm refrencing.

I have some of the components for these items already but the one thing I need the most is Scilicone and Casting resin. I will be making the hand buzzer from clay and then making a cast of that. As you can see in the image he has copper coils inside the buzzer as well as Tesla type coils on the outside of the arm. The arm coils I will be using EL wire.
What this image does not show is the headpiece. It will be a traditional Electricchair headpiece but I will be adding Jokers "Hair" to the leather with EL wire mixed in as well. The hair is going to be Dreadlocks.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you don;t have funds to help then please help spread the word. I only have 3 weeks to finish this project so every little bit counts. 
Don;t forget you can just share this directly to your friends on FB and Twitter so go now and spread the word! :D

story:
Short Summary

Most people know me as Will Franken, and for 15 years I carved out a comedy career which took me from the United States to the UK.  I've gotten excellent reviews for my work over the years, from accolades by Robin Williams to gaining the elusive 5-star review from Kate Copstick of the Scotsman for my Fringe show last year, The Stuff They Put in Sleep.

This year my show is at the greatest Comedy Club in the UK- The Stand.  This is a tremendous opportunity.

This show still bears the hallmark comedic traits that I have come to be known for over the years of surrealist one-person sketches, high-speed character changes, and politically incorrect skewering of postmodern sacred cows. The major difference is that instead of performing as Will, I will be performing as Sarah.

Additionally, the first fifteen minutes of pieces will allude, either directly or indirectly, to my transgenderism. Even though I will be remaining in character throughout this introit, the opening nevertheless will showcase more honesty than I have ever revealed onstage. At least on this topic, of which I have remained largely closeted throughout my professional career. As a satirist in the Peter Cook/Chris Morris style and a mimic who changes voices as frenetically as the late Robin Williams, the fourth wall is firmly erected throughout my shows, leaving punters often guessing as to what my true accent and my true beliefs are. That fourth wall will still be in place for that's my creative niche. Although through certain bits and, of course, my performance outfit, a window will be opened – albeit briefly – onto an aspect of myself I had long kept hidden. Finally, though the volume of satirical characters will remain as massive as ever, there won't be the razzle-dazzle sound cues of last year as I am preferring to approach this show, with the exception of my public outing, on a simpler, grittier comedic plane.

I had lived as a woman briefly in San Francisco nearly fifteen years earlier for a span of about four to five months, only putting that side of me back in the closet when I began to get a name as the comedian Will Franken. I was more obsessed with my career at that point and felt being out as a transgender would limit me, especially in the leftist climate of San Francisco. Instead, I remained a blank slate of blazer, T-shirt, and blue jeans in order to give my manifold characters room to roam. In Edinburgh of 2013, I spent nearly every evening dressed as Sarah after my show had finished. But this marks the first time where I have consistently lived as Sarah. Until a month ago, I had maintained the rule I had set for myself where I would live as Sarah and only perform as Will. But I've since had a few shows as Sarah which have received fairly positive reactions and I am now attempting my first Edinburgh as her. I have been largely happier during this time in ways I sometimes can't quite comprehend. I seem to have garnered deeper and more significant relationships with females, both platonic and intimate, and have somehow managed to stay funny in the process, incorporating my humour into my female personality. Thus defying my two major fears when it came to outing myself – a) that I would be alone for the rest of my life and b) by being happy, I wouldn't be funny anymore.

This is my chance to do something groundbreaking.  Something very, very different.  I want to show the world I can be just as funny and critically acclaimed as Sarah as I was as Will.  I want to break the stereotype that an artist must be miserable in order to create.  Yes, there are transgender comedians.   From what I know of other transgender performers' career trajectories, mine is different in three distinct ways. Firstly, because I'm known for high-speed character comedy, there is an assumption among many in my fan base that Sarah is simply another character in my portfolio. If I was doing regular stand-up comedy (or any regular job, for that matter) the transition might be easier because there wouldn't be an assumption that Sarah was simply another layer in an already multi-layered performance. Secondly, I don't believe there are many comedians who are attempting to transition while their career is currently happening. For instance, I know some post-op transsexuals who either began performing after they transitioned or used to perform as a male, took time off to transition, and then started performing again after the transition. There are transvestite performers (that is to say, cross-dressers) like Eddie Izzard.  But to go from character comedian Will Franken to character comedienne Sarah Franken in mid-career has so far proven interesting, exciting and challenging; particularly when it comes to questions of publicity photos and compere introductions. Thirdly, defying expectations most punters might have of a transgender in the performing arts, my politics don't always veer toward the expected. 

What We Need & What You Get

Anyone who has been to the Edinburgh Fringe knows it is incredibly expensive.  Like constantly-hemmorhaging-money-out-of-all-orifices expensive.  It would be amazing to get help from people who believe in what I am doing- finding yourself, and being yourself no matter how challenging it may be.  There aren't a lot of transgender comedians out there- and there certainly aren't many who have come out as transgender in the middle of an already established career!

This fundraising goal will help me with the everyday expenses of living in Edinburgh, which basically breaks down into rent for the month, and food.  This isn't beer money- I don't drink.  This is just money for living.

Even if I don't reach my goal, every little bit helps- every penny will go toward my expenses.

    The Impact

    I can't express enough what a positive impact raising this money would have on me.  Anyone who has done a really meaningful project, no matter what the nature, will understand how invested you get in it - you breathe it, you sleep it, you need it to be successful.

    Sarah is being given the most amazing opportunity as a standup comedian- a prime slot at the Stand.  The pressure is ON.  I know with my proven track record  I can succeed- I just need the support to do it.

    Here are a few links to reviews of my previous shows:

    The Five-Star Scotsman review from last year: http://www.wow247.co.uk/2014/08/19/will-franken-the-stuff-they-put-in-sleep/

    The Scotsman: http://www.scotsman.com/what-s-on/theatre-comedy-dance/comedy-reviews-chris-dangerfield-alan-francis-milo-mccabe-mike-workman-al-pitcher-wil-hodgson-will-franken-1-2476302

    The Guardian: http://www.theguardian.com/stage/2012/aug/09/will-franken-edinburgh-festival-review

    And here are non-Fringe reviews and accolades from the New York Times, San Francisco Chronicle, etc. : http://willfranken.com/will-press.html

    And here is my Chortle Page with review:  http://www.chortle.co.uk/comics/w/34057/will_franken

    Risks & Challenges

    There aren't a lot of risks and challenges as the show is booked, I know what I am doing and know my way around the Fringe.  The only challenge I have is staying alive before and during Edinburgh!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if you can't contribute financially, I would appreciate any word-of-mouth help. 

    Please help by tweeting about me (@WillFranken) or get in touch on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/will.franken.1?fref=ts and tell your friends and any organisations about my campaign and show.

story:
WELCOME TO THE WORLD OF ANTARCTIC PRESS...SHOWCASE OF INDY CREATORS THAT WERE CAUGHT WITHOUT RELEASE...with many local comic stores challenged by the COVID -19 virus we wanted to start a program where you can get your favorite creator owned AP books that were released or about to be released but at the time many stores were shuttered by the impact of the virus.  Many of these books were stuck in limbo due to suspension in shipping and distribution so we wanted to get them into your hands and start a new way to get your weekly fix of comics. 

If you're not familiar with Antarctic Press, my name is Ben Dunn, and I started Antarctic Press, a small, independent comic company started in 1984. I have personally collected comics of almost every type and genre since the early seventies, and I can say that during the past 30 years, we have published some of the greatest and best independent comics out there. Our publishing history includes titles like Gold Digger and my own creations Ninja High School and Warrior Nun Areala.

We realize that we are releasing this request in the midst of COVID-19. as elaborated below, this is causing some turmoil in the comic book industry. This campaign is one of those instruments that will help in these current times and maybe start a new trend in comic distribution which gives you choice of what books you want to try. Now if you are undergoing economic hardship, we completely understand, but maybe give us a shout-out on social media to help promote this campaign. We appreciate any support that you can give.

Over the past several weeks, there were many comics that were supposed to be released via Diamond Comics to your local comic store. Unfortunately, due to this pandemic situation, many stores were locked down and closed and could not receive shipments. This caused a ripple effect that essentially closed Diamond Comics, and as a result, a decision was made by Diamond to not distribute these books leaving many independent creators "stuck."  You can read about this in more detail here. So it is our hope to start a new way to get those books into your hands.

https://www.newsarama.com/49655-diamond-warns-o...

We believe that things will eventually get back to normal but in the meantime if this goes well we have a new indy creator showcase service to get those books into your hands.

While we are not the largest publisher in the industry, we pride ourselves in running a company supporting our many freelance contributors and creators, all of whom have allowed us to publish comics for 35-plus years, and we intend to continue to do so. Even so, with stores and distribution centers locked down resulting in a large quantity of comics put on hold has put a strain on many independent creators.  If this is successful we can offer a new way to showcase and introduce indie creators to the fans of comics. Many creators cannot manage campaigns because of other jobs and unfamiliarity of the process. So we are glad we can help and now those creators have a way to point to their fans a way to get their books. 

We hope any contribution at whatever amount will allow us to continue to follow the vision of creator-owned independent comics.  Since the distribution channels have stopped, we are trying to get one of these books printing bills paid for. Thank you for the time to read through this statement, and please keep safe and healthy.

Here are the covers that are available.  This campaign is to assist us in continuing our commitment to providing the best of creator-owned independent comics to you, the fans.

You can rest assured that all these books are complete and ready to go to the printers (most all have already been printed), and therefore, fulfillment is guaranteed.

Indiegogo funds will be allocated the following way: 

10% to Indiegogo

65% to Printing and Shipping/Postage

15% to Creator Royalties

10% Logistical Support

· MYSTERY BOX - IF YOU ORDER THE $25 or $50 REWARD TIER YOU GET MYSTERY BOOKS.

· With the $25 tier you get 2 extra books from our warehouse (no duplicates) and 1 RARE VARIANT BOOK.

· With the $50 tier you get 3 extra books from our warehouse (no duplicates) and 2 RARE VARIANT BOOKS.

BOOKS OFFERED:

Black Hops Hair Trigger

Coaraptor #1

Crimson Scorpion #1

Cat Shit One v.1 #1

Cat Shit One v.1 #2

Cat Shit One v.1 #3

Dogeaters #6

Exciting Comics #6 (Cover A)

Gold Digger #271

Gold Digger #272

Planet Comics #1 (Cover A)

Punchline #10 (Cover A)

Strongbox Big Bad Book of Boon #7 

V-Card #3

V-Card #4

story:
The sense of being an outcast has been the biggest draw to comics for lifelong fans like me. And now with the marginalizing of X-Men and lack of Doom Patrol, I've been inspired to tell a more contemporary satirical comic starring EntitleMan, Buzz Girl, Know-It-All, Cyber Bully, and Mr. Hideous. Join them as they fight college debt collecting robots, apathy procrastination. the Men's Liberation Front and the Fellowship of the Unaccomplished. 

I want to raise money to produce as good of a book as possible. At this stage I lucked out with having an art team comprised of Tom Griffin and Guillermo Villarreal. I'm looking to pay these guys a fair enough wage, which adds up to at least 2,500. 

Following that,I'd like to bring in a letterer and colorist, this could cost up to $1000. Printing Costs are about $2000

Finally a high profile cover artist, like Skottie Young or Mark Brooks, would be the bee's knees!

I am very thankful for my experience in comics working with gryphonknights.com to get some of my work out like "Greasers in Greece," and "Frankenstein vs Dracula: Throughout the Ages," and now with your help, we can launch a project that you can enjoy and be a part of. Let's meet the group! 

CAST OF CHARACTERS:

EntitleMan- The stylish leader. He absorbs white privilege and redirects it as energy blasts. He's also an Uber driver, the team's main mode of transportation. 


Cyber Bully- A protocol droid, fluent in over six million forms of communication

Mr. Hideous- An anthropomorphic porcupine beast full of self pity, who takes a lot of selfies.

 


Know-It-All- As his name suggests, he is arrogant, But the truth is, he has an app for everything, and if he doesn't he'll build it. 


Buzzgirl- She has a thousand sentient nanobots who can build anything for her, and each has their own social media account.

ID-  The rookie. A young girl finds sanctuary with the team when she finds out she can shape shift. The Millennial who wants to fit in and stand out.

story:
June 3 and 6 @ 9:30 PM

June 7 @ 6:30 PM

LIVE AT THE TREEHOUSE THEATER, NYC!

An affiliate of the People's Improv Theater

THIS PRODUCTION IS NOT AFFILIATED WITH, NOR ENDORSED BY, WARNER BROTHERS OR J.K. ROWLING. OR, FOR THAT MATTER, HARRY HIMSELF.

Everyone loves Harry Potter. Everyone loves to laugh. So, we thought, why not do both? What, we wondered, could possibly be better? Unfortunately for us, making people laugh costs money. We are all artists, performers and writers in the beginning of our career, and your generous funding will allow us to create work that is powerful, irreverent, nerdy, strange, and funny as hell, with many promises of fart jokes and boobies. The money raised will go toward rehearsal space, venue rental, production costs, and feeding our hungry comedy-wizard collaborators. We couldn't do this without your help and thank you sincerely for any contribution you can give, be it large or small. Truly, every cent helps, and is much appreciated by us all, and, we are quite sure, by Harry Potter himself. EXPECTO DONATUM!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt: Short Summary Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:  Introduce yourself and your background. Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you. Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.  Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?   What We Need & What You Get Break it down for folks in more detail:  Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.  Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited! Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.    The Impact Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:  Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world. Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one). Make it real for people and build trust.    Risks & Challenges  People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.  Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles. Describe your plan for solving these challenges.    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
Nyobi is back in her first FULL COLOR story as she defends freedom of choice.

Welcome, comic book fans, to the Nyobi: Birthright campaign. My most ambitious outing to date, this two-part miniseries presents Nyobi in full color from cover to cover for the very first time! 

Nyobi: Birthright takes us on a whirlwind journey through turbulent times as Nyobi defends a young woman from the hostility of a spiteful, ignorant mob looking to strip her of her rights. Tensions heat up in a extremely complex situation of the debates surrounding G-Noms, and it is now up to Nyobi to try and sort it out.    

If you're a longtime Nyobi fan, jump straight into this brand new 24 page full color comic, featuring your choice of five startling covers!

If you're new to Nyobi, try two adventures and save on shipping by bundling the popular 2015 release of Nyobi #1 and the all new Nyobi: Birthright #1 right now! 

Discover all of the incredible perks I've thoughtfully designed so that you can determine which tier of Nyobi: Birthright best suits your long box!

Before developing her powers, Nyobi was performing in all-girl J-pop supergroup The Geisha Dolls. At age 16, during a meet-and-greet at the Mega Plex mall in Tokyo, Nyobi's powers manifested while she was being mobbed by a large group of fans. A ring of light flashed in front of everyone's eyes and she was gone.

She reappeared at the back of the building, and quickly realized her life was about to change forever.

The media ran nuts with the story. Everyone had their theories as to what happened. ICON Entertainment tried to explain it as a special effect; a stunt. However, one week later, Nyobi appeared on My-Tube and exposed her true nature as a G-Nom to the world...

NYOBI: BIRTHRIGHT #1 HAS FIVE INCREDIBLY STUNNING COVERS CELEBRATING NYOBI IN ALL HER GLORY.

Cover A by SAMIR SIMAO - Colors by RUSS CASSEDAY

Cover B by STEF WILSON  - Colors by KERRY ANNE

Cover C by RB WHITE 

Cover D by LUIGI TERUEL ( ARTIST OF RAGS ) 

COVER E by LUIGI TERUEL - Exclusive to Indiegogo 

I'm thrilled to announce that Nyobi: Birthright will be in FULL COLOR. This is a first for me, as all previous issues of Nyobi have been in black and white, so I'm elated to welcome Dan Olvera to the team with open arms. He did a dynamite job coloring Samir Simao's fantastic line art. Check out the work below. It leaps off the page! 

 

Want clothes on your back? Why not deck yourself in style with this epic Paul Green Nyobi Streetware T-shirt. Available Sizes: S-3XL (I'll ask you for your size preference during your backer survey). These high quality shirts are made by POPARTGEAR.COM - the leader in indie comic apparel.

 

All backers in the U.S. and Canada pledged towards a physical reward will receive all of these great incentive items with their rewards shipments in Sept 2020! The first stretch goal will be unlocked at $2500.

LARRY HIGGINS - Larry is a Canadian independent comic book creator and the writer of the hit indie series Nyobi. He has also written Avani: Origins #1 and now brings what he hopes is a ground breaking new installment of Nyobi to the world.  

SAMIR SIMAO - Samir is a comic book artist who has been working in a independent comic scene for 6 years. He have worked with independent comic publishers like free fall comics, never static pictures, and many others.  His specialty is work in Kickstarter campaigns, with several projects done. you can see his work in Instagram : @samirsimao779.

DAN OLVERA - Dan is a freelance colorist who has worked in the comic book industry for several years. His credits include Puppet Master and VampBlade from Action Lab Comics. He has also worked on Zenescope titles and many other indie comics.

LUIGI TERUEL - Luigi is the artist of the hit comic book RAGS and has six issues complete as he works on #7.  He has also worked on such projects as Mega Woman as well Slate and Ash. We are so honored to have Luigi here with us and hope you love his covers as much as we do!! Find his work and contact Luigi here: https://www.facebook.com/luigiteruelart/

JOEL RODRIGUEZ - Joel is the President and lead content developer of Metal Ninja Studios.  He is the co-creator, writer and letterer of the comic book series The Dusk County Chronicles and The Dusk County Chronicles: Nightfall.  When not working on Dusk County or other MNS projects, he also provides writing, lettering, and editorial services, and has contributed to stories such as WTF, Zombies?!; Courtesy Clerk Nightmares (Supercilious Comics); and Avani, Origins #1 (Larry Higgins). He is currently working on titles such as Stake (Scout Comics), Loggerhead, and The Goode Girls and the Ghost of Lockeridge Academy.

RB WHITE - RB is a Canadian illustrator and comic artist. He has worked on projects for Universal Studios, Hasbro, and Nickelodeon, and has been published in magazines such as Imagine FX and Fantasy Artist.

STEF WILSON - Stef began drawing covers in May of 2019, and has had twenty-five published covers and works since then. His credits include Penny For Your Soul, Patriotika, Hardlee Thinn, Notti & Nyce, Siria Underground Pimp Hustla, Into The Suck, Scorpiana, Naughty Faeries, The Totally Rad Life of Violet, and Lili the Demoness.

NICOLE RAYMONDE -  Nicole in an invaluable asset to the team. Without her watchful eyes, no one would understand what Larry is writing. She has been the editor on Nyobi beginning with issue two, and has provided her skill to comicsbooks all throughout Eastern Canada. 

With a proven track record with 7 successful campaigns, we do not foresee any issues with our production or shipping. Should there be any issues I will come on here and provide updates and answer any questions you may have. The PDF file links will be emailed upon completion of the funding period

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please share the project on all your social media, help get the word out! 
  • Also remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it. Thanks for taking a look and I hope you consider backing Nyobi today!

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Please share the project on all your social media, help get the word out! 
Also remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The COVERS for Issue #2

SOMETHING exists -- but is it REAL? 

A small town family is being haunted. The monster from underneath your bed wants their kid. Its mission is simple: craft a new world from the imaginations of brilliantly gifted children. The kid in question, a young boy named Phillip Hasten, is the ultimate example of an extraordinary young mind. Phillip's untested mental capabilities have made him the boogeyman's prime target since conception...

The events that follow will change the Hasten family forever. Will they end the boogeyman's reign and finally break the curse -- or will it's hunger for power result in our ultimate demise?

Books, prints, commissions & more -- check out our sweet REWARDS below!

*DOMESTIC SHIPPING INCLUDED*

Issue #2 (Cover A) - Ian Miller (inks) & M. Wayne Miller (colors)

Issue #2 (Cover B) - Kristian Rossi

Print Artists - Joseph Schmalke (#1), Ian Ashcroft (#2) & Daniel Whitfield (#3)

Commissions & Original Art - Ian Miller

See what bundle suits you best -- 10 different REWARD TIERS to choose from!

*DOMESTIC SHIPPING INCLUDED*

Our 1st campaign went quite smoothly with only minimal bumps in the road. We've learned a lot from our experience on Kickstarter and will work tirelessly in fulfilling this one even more efficiently. Backers make these books possible and for that we are extremely appreciative.

Thank you for giving our boogeyman a chance!

story:
Unigans! A beloved species of gorgeous femboys created by the one and only Onta, creator of the classic comic "Badge of Pride", published by Image Comics. The outcome of this project will be a big anthology book of short and fun comics by the artists at Hardblush. With at least 70 pages and stretch goals to make even more possible, you can look forward to plenty of content, bound to contain something to cater to your taste.

We want to make the release of the second Unigan caravan as high quality as possible!

If we're able to get enough support we'll be able to not only create physical prints, but also add more content and increase the print quality!

Click the tiers on the right to see more info and details about what's included. <3 Next to receiving a copy of the book, you can even get your own character made into a unigan by one of our artists, or if you want to go all out, get your character featured in a full pinup to be featured in the publication!

 

ARTISTS FEATURED IN THE UNIGAN & YOU TIER!!
Onta (x1) 
Tokifuji (x2) 
Miri (x1) 
Pokyuii (x1) 
FsMaverick (x2)
DrawPanther (x2) 
Momoshi (x1)
Frenk_HW (x2)

story:
hi there

My names is James Mitchell (YouTube Sensation) and I'm hosting an online fundraiser on May 23rd in aid of the YES EQUALITY campaign, here in Ireland. There's a referendum in May, and we need your help.


€£$¥?

All we ask is that you give what you can. There is an incredible fight for progress happening in Ireland right now, but not without resistance from 'No' campaigners.


it's not in the bag

It's so important to note that we have not won this referendum. The people and organisations who don't want Marriage Equality in Ireland have a lot more money than those who do.


no money

That's ok! There are so many other ways you can help:

  • If you live in Ireland, please make sure to VOTE YES!
  • If you're not old enough to vote, make sure you speak to your parents, guardians, siblings, cousins, extended family, friends, etc. Here's what to say, if you're feeling rusty.
  • no matter where you are, please come along on May 23rd and join us in talking trash about the Eurovision live: here!


against gay marriage?

That's fine. Just remember that when one of your Grandchildren tells you they're not straight, that you'll be the one who feels awful. Make sure you tell them exactly how you felt and what you did (or didn't do) when you had the change to make the change.

story:
Short Summary

CBA (formerly known as C’est Bon Anthology) has been around for more than a decade, publishing lots of great comics that move far outside of the commercial mainstream.  Over the years, CBA has featured comics by great artists like Anke Feuchtenberger, Olivier Schrauwen, David Mack, Mari Ahokoivu, Kolbeinn Karlsson and many more.

Since the beginning, the people behind CBA are C'est Bon Kultur (CBK), an association of art comics enthusiasts and creators based in Malmö, Sweden. We strive to publish comics that otherwise would be hard to find. Comics that bring something more than what appeals to the lowest common denominator, that challenge the notion of what comics storytelling can or should be.

Now the anthology has fallen on hard times (long story, which you will soon be able to read at our website), but that shouldn’t stop us from publishing fantastic art comics, right? That is why we’re asking for your help!

We’re looking for donations to cover the costs of printing and distribution of our upcoming anthology, CBA vol 36: In the Pits of Madness.

 

What's in the Pits of Madness?

The volume features a 43-page comic done in oil paintings by Spyros Verykios, as well as mind altering comics by Akab, Elena Guidolin and Serena Schinaia. The cover is by Radovan Popović. The volume is going to be 84 pages in total, and is edited by Mattias Elftorp, creator of various post apocalypse/dystopic comics and one of the founders of CBK.

Spyros Verykios

Akab

Elena Guidolin

Serena Schinaia

All the comics in the volume are already finished. We only need to put the whole volume together and do some final editing before sending it to print.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need € 2300 to cover the costs of printing and distribution of 500 copies of CBA vol 36: In the Pits of Madness.

If you support the anthology, we have a plethora of goodies for you!

  • OrnaMental (€ 20)

You get a copy of CBA vol 36: In the pits of madness

+ a pin or a patch

  • Official donor (€ 50)

CBA vol 36: In the pits of madness

pin/patch

+ you get a subscription of CBA for 4 volumes (starting with vol 37) + a surprise treat from our archives

+ your name (or crowdfunder alias) in the next volume being sent to the printer after your donation

  • Archivist (€ 65)

CBA vol 36: In the pits of madness

pin/patch

4 volume subscription

your name in the next volume

+ 5 anthology back issues (choose any 5 that are still in print)

  • Storyteller's delight (€ 100)

CBA vol 36: In the pits of madness

pin/patch

4 volume subscription

your name in the next volume

5 anthologies of your choice

+ one copy each of When the last story is told + Creation of a god

+ 1 of our "CBK Presents" hardcover graphic novel issues

  • Model (€ 150)

CBA vol 36: In the pits of madness

pin/patch

4 volume subscription

your name in the next volume

5 anthologies of your choice

When the last story is told + Creation of a god

+ 2 "CBK Presents" hardcover graphic novel issues

+ a portrait drawn by one of our artists, to be published on the CBK website, that you can also use as profile picture on Facebook etc.

  • Sugar parent (€ 500)

CBA vol 36: In the pits of madness

pin/patch

4 volume subscription

Your name in the next volume

When the last story is told + Creation of a god

digital portrait

+ all our available back issues, including "CBK Presents"

  • Sugar parent+ (€ 1000)

CBA vol 36: In the pits of madness

pin/patch

4 volume subscription

your name in the next volume

When the last story is told + Creation of a god

digital portrait

+ all our available back issues, signed by all current crew members

+ our eternal love (this one is actually more or less included in all levels)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute you can always help by spreading the word about our campaign!

  • Share the link to this Indiegogo campaign. Use the #cbavol36 hash tag!
  • Follow us on Facebook and Instagram @cbkcomics, and check out our website!
  • Tell your loved ones about all the great comics in our wonderful web shop!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who we are?/¿Quienes somos?

We are Caperuza, a group of young graphic artist who want leak out at the comic industry. We love draw, we love music and imagine stories. We started this project one year ago and we really want consolidate our comic studio. The band is made up by:

Frontwoman, Franny. I’m graphic designer from UNAM (The National University of Mexico). I wrote the story and help with the inker process.


Our master draw or first pencil is Miyo. She’s is the most expert on the group for drawing. With more than fifteen years of experience on the comic industry, she can presume she worked for the best on Japan like the legendary SNK Corporation. But now, we convinced her to take long holydays on the Indie way production environment.


Ana María González is our music expert. Few years ago she has her own rock band (she plays the drums and bass) and also love experiment with sound production. Additionally, she love draw and design.


Milla is a graphic designer too, but she loves the fashion design. So, for Ana Zeppelin, she helps us to create the wardrobe for the characters. Sometimes she helps also to ink.


Daniel is our inker, one of the most important phases on the comic book process. Daniel, is enthusiastic, sometimes he draw the backgrounds and is the masculine character of the band, ja ja ja.


Any. She helps us with the digital edition and corrections of the scanning pages.  Her work is important for get a detailed quality on the final pages.



Nosotros somos Caperuza, un grupo de jóvenes artistas gráficos que queremos dejar huella en el mundo del comic. Nos encanta dibujar, nos encanta la música e imaginar historias. Empezamos este proyecto hace un año y realmente queremos que crezca para consolidar nuestro estudio de comic. La banda está integrada por:

Frontwoman, Franny. Yo soy diseñadora gráfica por la UNAM. Escribí la historia y ayudo a entintar las páginas.

Nuestra experta dibujante es Miyo. Ella es la mejor del grupo en cuanto a dibujo se refiere. Con más de quince años de experiencia en la industria del comic, ella puede presumir de haber trabajado con los mejores en Japón, como la prestigiosa empresa SNK. Pero ahora, la convencimos de que tomara unas largas vacaciones y probara la forma de producción de comic independiente.

Ana María González es nuestra experta en música. Hasta hace no mucho, ella tenía su propia banda (toca la batería y el bajo) y también experimentaba con la producción digital de sonido. Adicionalmente, ella ama dibujar y diseñar.

Milla es diseñadora gráfica también, pero está enfocada en el diseño de modas. Para Ana Zeppelin ella se encarga de crear el vestuario de los personajes. A veces, también, ayuda a entintar.

Daniel es nuestro entintador, se encarga de uno de los procesos más importantes en la producción del comic. Daniel es entusiasta, también a veces se pone a fondear y es el lado masculino del grupo, ja ja ja.

Any nos ayuda con la edición digital y correcciones luego de que las páginas son escaneadas. Su trabajo es importante para definir la calidad y detalle de las páginas finales.



______________________________________________________________________

What is Ana Zeppelin / ¿de Qué es Ana Zeppelin?


Is our first graphic novel. Ana Zeppelin is the story about a 13 years old girl who lives in Mexico City in the beginning of the nineteen’s. Her traditional and childish life style changes when she listens for first time the rock grunge music. Since then, she tries to learn to play rock music and starting to make her own songs in the middle of bullying and classist teenager environment.

Rock music is one of the central topics of the novel. We mention, literal or with graphic tributes, mostly of our favorite bands like Nirvana, Pearl Jam, Pixies, Sonic Youth, Led Zeppelin, The Doors, David Bowie, The Beatles, Rolling Stones, Elvis and many more.

The novel has 21 chapters. We already finish, in a complete way, the number 1. The aim is that the first chapters will go out on sale on March of 2014. Then, finish the complete book before 2015 at Spanish an English version. We estimate the total number of pages on more than 350. Like you could see is a huge work, but is fun. The novel is made by traditional techniques: pencil, ink and paper. But also, we try to use the new technologies like sophisticate software for comic manufacturing and draw edition.

The process is as follows: We adapt the original text to a comic format, and then we generate the storyboard. Since here, we design or define the backgrounds, the clothes and the other stuffs like the musical instruments. The next step is Miyo, who draw with pencils the original pages. These pages go to the draw light desk for the ink process with conventional black ink and paper. The ink work is scan and saves as digital format, in special software the handwork is detailed and we put the text on this phase. The final job is give format to the comic book, the final layout.



Ana Zeppelin es nuestra primera novela gráfica. Trata de una niña de trece años que vive en la Ciudad de México en los primeros años de la década de los noventa. Su estilo de vida tradicional e infantil cambia radicalmente cuando se topa con la música rock grunge. A partir de entonces, ella trata de aprender a tocar música rock y empieza a crear sus propias canciones en medio de un ambiente adolescente hostil y clasista.

La música rock es uno de los temas centrales de la historia. De hecho, hacemos mención, directamente o a través de un homenaje gráfico, de nuestras bandas favoritas como Nirvana, Pearl Jam, Pixies, Sonic Youth, Led Zeppelin, The Doors, David Bowie, The Beatles, Rolling Stones, Elvis y más.

La novela tiene 21 capítulos. Hasta el día hoy tenemos completo el capítulo 1. El objetivo es que los primeros capítulos salgan a la venta en marzo de 2014 y el libro completo debería estar terminado antes del año 2015 en versión en español e inglés. Estimamos que el número total de páginas de la novela constará de más de 350 páginas. Como pueden ver es un enorme trabajo el que resta por hacer; pero también, vaya que es divertido. La novela está realizada con técnicas tradicionales del comic: lápices y tinta sobre papel. Pero también nos ayudamos con la incorporación de las nuevas tecnologías como software especial para el armado de comics y programas de edición gráfica.

El proceso es como sigue: Primero adaptamos el texto original a las viñetas de comic y generamos el storyboard. Después, definimos los fondos, las ropas y otros aspectos como los instrumentos musicales. El siguiente paso lo da Miyo quien dibuja a lápiz las páginas originales. Estas páginas pasan después a la mesa de luz para el proceso de entintado que se realiza con plumillas y tinta sobre papel. El trabajo ya entintado se escanea y se guarda en formato digital donde con ayuda de un software especializado el dibujo a mano es corregido y además se colocan los textos. El trabajo final consiste en formar el libro.

_________________________________________________________

¿Por qué necesitamos la ayuda y dónde va el dinero? / ¿Por Qué requerimos Ayuda ya DÓNDE Iría el Dinero?

Until now, draw graphic novels on Mexico is very hard because comic art is consider as a non-serious activity. Too much of the production in our country is based on individual efforts and the tenacity of the independent authors. The big editorial companies are skeptical with the new products and ideas.

This is garage comic production; we draw with what we have. And this is not too much, not the best quality. For example, we build our own draw light desk, is goobut we need more for work two or three pages at the same time. Also we need nice paper, pencils and ink. Further we need actualize our computer hardware and software (is old and obsolete), and acquire official licenses software.

For these reasons, we need help from you to finish and publish “The Ana Zeppelin Story” and also to continue drawing new stories. We will use the money for buy material and pay the graphic novel print, many part of that material is essential and, at the same time, expensive. We always say, this project is a like a rock band: of course we want make a LP, of course we want be a successful and play at the major leagues, but essentially we do this because we love do it. But we need your help, because with your help is more easy, and we could do it on less time.



Hasta el día de hoy, realizar novelas gráficas en México es bastante difícil debido a que se considera al comic como una actividad poco seria. Mucha de la producción está basada en esfuerzos individuales de los autores independientes pues las grandes compañías editoriales son escépticas con los nuevos proyectos.

Esto es básicamente producir nuestro comic en un garaje: es decir, dibujamos con lo que tenemos. Lamentablemente, lo que tenemos no es mucho ni es de la mejor calidad. Por ejemplo, construimos nuestra propia mesa de luz, es buena pero necesitamos construir o comprar otras para poder trabajar varias páginas al mismo tiempo. También necesitamos buen papel, lápices y tinta. También requerimos actualizar nuestro equipo de cómputo (que es viejo y obsoleto) y adquirir licencias oficiales de los programas que utilizamos.

Por estas razones, necesitamos de su ayuda para poder terminar y publicar la novela y para poder continuar dibujando nuevas historias. Usaremos el dinero para comparar material y pagar las ediciones impresas del libro, muchos de los materiales son esenciales y, al mismo tiempo, caros. Siempre hemos dicho que nuestro proyecto es como una banda de rock: queremos grabar un disco, queremos tener éxito y tocar con los grandes, pero todo esto lo hacemos, esencialmente porque nos gusta hacerlo. Pero requerimos de tu ayuda para lograr esto en menos tiempo, tú sabes que algunas veces ese es el problema de los comics, su publicación se hace eterna

_______________________________________________________________________

¿Qué se obtiene? / ¿ de Qué obtendrías?

All the people who make contribution for this project will have him/her name at the credit page in the final edition of the novel. Our rewards system is as follows:

If you give us $10 USD you will get the pdf on low resolution of the book. 

For $15 you will receive the pdf on low resolution and 1 desktop wallpaper. 

For $20 USD the pdf low resolution and 2 desktop wallpapers. 

For $50 USD the pdf high resolution and 3 desktop wallpapers. 

For $100 USD the pdf high resolution, one sketch signed, 3 desktop wallpapers and we send you by mail a 90X60 cm poster. 

For $200 USD you will receive the pdf on high resolution, 2 sketches signed, 3 desktop wallpapers, 1 90X60 cm poster, the Ana Zeppelin soft cover book and T-shirt. 

For $300 USD the pdf on high resolution, 2 sketches signed, 3 desktop wallpaper, 1 60X90 poster, the Ana zeppelin soft cover book, a T-shirt and you can appear in the comic like cameo or your OC. 

For $500 USD you will receive the pdf on high resolution, 2 sketches signed, 3 desktop wallpapers, 1 poster, the Ana zeppelin HARD cover book, a T-shirt and you can appear in the comic like casual character or your OC, additionally we give you an original page signed with pencils. 

For $1000 USD you will receive the pdf on high resolution, 2 sketches signed, 3 desktop wallpapers, 1 60X90 cm posters, Ana zeppelin hard cover book, a T-shirt, you can appear in the comic like casual character or your OC, an original page signed with pencils, and only one person gets the original cover of the book. Additionally, we will give you two tickets for the “27 rockstars club concert” at the hell on the Apocalypses final day… well the last thing is an exaggeration but remember ROCK never dies!!!


Todo aquel que haga una contribución para este proyecto tiene su nombre asegurado en la página de créditos de la edición final de la novela. Nuestro sistema de recompensas es el siguiente:

Si das $10 USD recives el pdf del libro en baja resolución.

Por $15 USD recibes el pdf en baja resolución y 1 wallpaper de escritorio. 
Por $20 USD recives el pdf en baja resolución y 2 wallpapers de escritorio. Por $50 USD recibes el pdf en alta resolución y 3 wallpapers de escritorio. 
Por $100 USD recives el pdf en alta resolución, un boceto firmado, 3 wallpapers de escritorio y además, te enviamos por paquetería un poster de 90X60 cm. 
Por $200 USD recives el pdf en alta resolución, 2 bocetos firmados, 3 wallpapers de escritorio, 1 póster de 90X60 cm, el libro de Ana Zeppelin en pasta blanda y una camiseta. 
Por $300 USD recives el pdf en alta resolución, 2 bocetos firmados, 3 wallpapers de escritorio, 1 póster de 60X90, el libro de Ana zeppelin en pasta blanda, una camiseta y podemos dibujarte en comic como extra. 
Por $500 USD recives el pdf en alta resolución, 2 bocetos firmados, 3 wallpapers de escritorio, 1 póster, el libro de Ana Zeppelin en pasta dura, una camiseta y podemos dibujarte en el comic como un personaje casual. Adicionalmente, te damos una página original en papel ya entintada y autografiada. 
Por $1000 USD recives el pdf en alta resolución, 3 bocetos firmados, 3 wallpapers de escritorio, 1 póster, el libro de Ana Zeppelin en pasta dura, una camiseta, podemos dibujarte como un personaje casual, una página original autografiada y solo la primera persona que de $1000 USD tendrá la portada original del libro autografiada. 
Adicionalmente, daremos dos boletos para el concierto del “club de los 27” a realizarse en el infierno el día del juicio final… Bueno, eso último ya fue exagerado pero recuerden que ¡¡¡el rock nunca muere!!! 


Nuestra esperanza / Lo Que QUEREMOS

We are enthusiastic about this novel because here, in Mexico, graphic novels are strange things. While in other countries as France, USA or Japan, long comic stories are made with frequently and high quality, here we are a little stuck. So, we really hope make the difference and inspire other young artist on Mexico and Latinamerica..


Realmente estamos muy entusiasmados con esta novela gráfica porque aquí en México no se leen y se elaboran muy pocas. Mientras que en países como Francia, Estados Unidos o Japón la novela gráfica representan una publicación rentable y de calidad, aquí en México estamos un poco estancados. Por eso, esperamos hacer alguna diferencia e inspirar a otros artistas jóvenes de México para que sigan creando y creyendo.

_____________________________________________________________________

Otras maneras de ayudar / Ayudar de Otra forma


You can distribute this link to your friends and social networks or if you prefer you can help us on the novel elaboration: drawing, design, inker, etc.

Puedes difundir este link entre tus amigos y redes sociales o si lo prefieres, ayudarnos en la elaboración de la novela dibujando, diseñando, entintando, etc.

USA or Japan, long comic stories are made with frequently and high quality,
here we are a little stuck. So, we really hope make the difference and inspire
other young artist on Mexico and Latinamerica..



Realmente
estamos muy entusiasmados con esta novela gráfica porque aquí en México no se
leen y se elaboran muy pocas. Mientras que en países como Francia, Estados
Unidos o Japón la novela gráfica representan una publicación rentable y de
calidad, aquí en México estamos un poco estancados. Por eso, esperamos hacer
alguna diferencia e inspirar a otros artistas jóvenes de México para que sigan
creando y creyendo.

_____________________________________________________________________


Otras maneras de ayudar / Ayudar de Otra forma




You can distribute this link to your friends and social
networks or if you prefer you can help us on the novel elaboration: drawing,
design, inker, etc.
Puedes
difundir este link entre tus amigos y redes sociales o si lo prefieres,
ayudarnos en la elaboración de la novela dibujando, diseñando, entintando, etc.

story:
Short Summary

  • my name is Michael D Hall  I write and draw my own comics. I also write and produce music under the moniker SPECSWIZARD. in over 30 years of producing work in the Northwest, I have yet to present my work to a wider audience.
  • this campaign is to help me print up my new comic: ACHIEVER - Demon Mountain On Mars as well as reprint issues of the previous series: Achiever Takes Down The Man
  • your contributions will help me keep this title relevant as well as introduce my work to new readers around the world.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • $5,000.00 will help me keep my comics in production in 2021 and give me the boost I need to produce new titles in 2022
  • your contribution of $20 and up automatically sign you up for a preorder of Demon Mountain On Mars which I will ship to you in 2021
  • if my goal is not reached I will use what funds I have available to print as many books as I can

The Impact

  • my product will be valuable to you because of it's scarcity and the fact that this has been a dream of mine since I was eight years of age. I'm now 53 years old and my voice has yet to be heard by the greater populace.
  • 21 contributors helped me to put out a great comic series in 2020. just think what I could with 100 contributors. or 200. I just want to tell stories.
  • I just want to tell stories. I need you to read them. I am nothing without a readership. thank you in advance.
  •  
  • Risks & Challenges

 

        the work is already done. the only challenge now is raising funds.

  • my plan is to stay productive.

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • if you can't contribute, please help get the word out.
  • remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Our Story
It's 1943 and a top World War Two B-17 Bomber crew is given a secret mission to destroy Hitlerâ€™s Eagles Nest compound in the German Black Forest.  Unimaginable terrors await them as the operation unravels and the crew discovers a hidden land of medieval knights and undead monsters dislodged in time...

About Flying Fortress Volume One
Flying Fortress is published in a bimonthly comic book format by Eric Weathers and Andy Moore.  

Flying Fortress Volume One arrives in March 2012.  It collects the material from our first five comic books: Issue #0 through Issue #4, and also includes the premiere of our first Reader Compendium and a gallery of selected art from the Flying Fortress studios!

Volume One is over 140 pages long and includes:
  • Flying Fortress #1
  • Flying Fortress #2
  • Flying Fortress #3
  • Flying Fortress #4

As well as:
  • Flying Fortress #0
  • Flying Fortress Reader's Compendium #1
  • A Pinup, Covers, and sketch art Gallery
  • and much more!

This first edition of the book is a hand-numbered limited edition, signed by the artists.

The Impact
This project is the most direct way to get our books you, and we are so thankful for your support!  

As indie comic book publishers, the direct connection to our readers is everything to us. Itâ€™s amazing to see the support and culture that has grown around creator-owner indie comics, and your order helps us reach new readers, publish more awesome books and meet fans across the nation at conventions.

What We Need, and What You Get!
We are self-publishing Flying Fortress Volume One, and are offering a first (and limited edition!) printing to our loyal fans, friends and families here through a donation model.  We are embarking on a comic book convention tour again in 2012, and all support we get will go towards the production of volume one and the convention circuit.

For all levels of donation, we have compiled awesome perks to reward you for your support of the project.





Thanks For Your Support- Here's Some Awesome Stuff!
Everyone who donates will be included in the â€˜Thank Youâ€™ pages in Flying Fortress Volume One, and our perks range from merchandise like comic books to custom bomber jackets, and exclusive items from original comic art to including YOU drawn into in our comics!  (Thatâ€™s right- you can be in Flying Fortress!)

Other Ways You Can Help
You can help spread the word about our campaign! Our dream is to have as many readers as possible experience Flying Fortress, so by telling anyone who would be interested in our crazy little adventure comic book project, you are helping us make the dream a reality.

Weâ€™ve got a facebook fan page, an official twitter account, and a website where you can connect, get involved, win prizes and keep your finger on the pulse of Flying Fortress.  IndieGoGo has also incorporated awesome sharing tools here on the campaign, and weâ€™d be honored if youâ€™d share our project with your friends (especially anyone who loves WWII, knights or zombies!)

â€¢ What about international shipping?

Please add an additional $7 to all orders going overseas. Add an additional $15 for the Ammo Can collection

story:
A full-color, ten-page action-packed first mini-issue, exceptional art and sharp story telling.

Fully, inked and colored comic book pages are quite expensive ($150-$200 each) to create. With me financing the first five pages, the cover and logo, I am in desperate need of outside investors in order to complete this project. I've put as much of my own money as possible at this point and hope that Omega can interest enough people to bring him into reality.


Why contribute to a ten page comic?

This mini sets the stage for the first issue of Omega; Issue 1, Escape; Issue 2, Rogue; and Issue 3, Hero.

And will be a good introcution to the world of Omega, the alien\human hybrid bred from the remains of the 1947 Roswell UFO crash and trained by elite military forces.

 

Read on for the story:

A UFO did, in fact, crash land in the New Mexico desert in the summer of 1947. Quickly intercepted by the US military, the unidentified flying object and its occupants, several humanoid extraterrestrials either already dead or in the final throes of death, were whisked away to secret installations.


In 1985, after almost forty years of research, finally, a successful splice of alien and human DNA is achieved. 


Raised as a lab experiment that the military hoped to be a “super-soldier,” Omega, trained in combat, educated strenuously, and becomes the main component in General “Anvil” Hendricks elite military unit assigned to Phantom Base in Adaven, New Mexico. General Hendricks, a three-star general, believes the Omega Project will be the key to his elusive fourth star.

 

After a perilous first mission that results in the daring rescue of the First Lady of the United States, but in which all but the commanding officer and Omega are decimated, the program is suspended, the plug pulled.


Omega must escape from the secret base and brave his way through the isolated desert with specially trained soldiers in deadly pursuit. With the full focus of one of the most determined men in the US military, it will be an impossible task, one that may just prove fatal for a mere human, but Omega is something quite different.

While Omega is pursued, the Earth falls prey to a new type of predator, one that has no qualms about total destruction of everything we hold dear. Will Omega, half-alien, half-human be our one hope?

 
 
The Team
 

Keith Latch

I am the creator and the writer of this story. I have novel and novella publishing credits in the small press and have had several science fiction and fantasy stories published in anthologies, magazines and online venues. Self-publishing has been my newest and most rewarding venture. While this is my first comic script to have produced, Omega has existed in one form or the other for many years. While the superhero market is getting quite crowded, I really do think there’s a unique flair in the science fiction/superhero aspects of Omega to set him apart from the rest.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

Mike Fiorentino

Mike Fiorentino, who has graciously signed on to pencil the entire issue, is truly an artist. He’s has done an outstanding job bringing the text story to life on the page. With an amazing ability to transfer human emotion to paper and an almost uncanny knack for creating scenes, I cannot think of a better artist to make Omega a living, breathing hero ready to take on the world. I’d like to give Mike a huge thanks for taking the time out of his busy life to aid us in the creation of this issue.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gabriel Cassata

Gabriel Cassata is a professional colorist from Central Pennsylvania. He has worked for BOOM! Studios, Image Comics, Zenescope and Bluewater Productions among others. Prior to his career in comics, Gabriel lived in Los Angeles, California where he was a visual effects artist in the film and television industry. His credits include work on 'LOST' (ABC), '24' (FOX), 'Pushing Daisies' (ABC), 'Brothers & Sisters' (ABC) and 'Californication' (Showtime).

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Steve Wands

STEVE WANDS, the letterer, and logo designer, for Omega, Earth’s Hero lives in New Jersey with his wife and son. Usually he's lettering Comic Books and Graphic Novels for DC Comics, BOOM! Studios, Random House, and a few others, but sometimes he’s just drinking coffee and reading comics.

Websites

gabriel-cassata.deviantart.com

stevewands.blogspot.com

 

For the $500 goal, we get to produce the additional 5 pages needed for the 10 page mini.

For a stretch goal of $1,000, we can produce another 5 completed pages. making it a 15 page sample...the more you can deliver completed to a publisher the better.

If $1,500 is raised, we will be able to bring you 20 pages of fully drawn, inked, colored, and lettered pages-That's the size of most common comic books you can pick up on the shelf at your local shop.

If $2,000 is raised, a lofty but attainable goal, we can produce the complete 26-page first issue of Omega: Issue 1, Escape!!!
