story:
INDEMAND STORE IS CLOSED! From Doug TenNapel who created a COMIC BOOK follow up to Earthworm Jim that funded for over $197k!




I'm Doug TenNapel, a comic book author and artist of over 16 graphic novels such as GEAR, CREATURE TECH, IRON WEST, GHOSTOPOLIS and CARDBOARD! I've created video game characters like EARTHWORM JIM, The NEVERHOOD and ARMIKROG and television shows like NICKELODEON'S CATSCRATCH and PROJECT GEEKER. I'm known for quirky humor, broad characters and plots full of character and heart.

As a big thank you to fans of my work I created BIGFOOT BILL, a childish, hairy, legend who stole the KRAKEN from POSEIDON and wears it as a super suit! I'm forgoing my usual studio work to work directly with my readers to independently fund an all-ages, blockbuster graphic novel!

Are you tired of humor comics that are more gross than funny? Me too! Do you like characters drawn with more skill and impact than ugly ca-ca that is made these days? Me too! Are you frustrated that I can't touch any of my big studio characters yet the big studios won't do anything with them? This is how I'm going to maintain control of BIGFOOT BILL, by making him independently with no studio involvement. That means I need you to help me make this graphic novel. It's time to release the Kraken!

Take a look at these MEATY stretch goals:
$40K STRETCH GOAL - Unlocked! Extend BIGFOOT BILL from 48 pages to 64 pages!

$45K STRETCH GOAL - Unlocked! 2 Trading Cards: BIGFOOT BILL and MOTHMAN!

$50k STRETCH GOAL - Unlocked! Upgrade Interior Paper for comic & sketchbook!

$55k STRETCH GOAL - Unlocked! Ben Hennessy gets Bigfoot Bill/Earthworm Jim tattoo LIVE!

$60k STRETCH GOAL! - Unlocked! Hideous Art-So-Bad-It's-Good Bookmark by Nerkish!

$65k STRETCH GOAL! - Unlocked! Bigfoot Bill LOW CARB 3" x 3" Embroidered BOMBER PATCH!                                                               
$70k STRETCH GOAL! - UNLOCKED! Downloadable: Doug T. will read it to you & provide audio commentary! 

$75k STRETCH GOAL! - UNLOCKED! Bigfoot Bill PLAYABLE DEMO GAME

$80k STRETCH GOAL! UNLOCKED! Bigfoot Bill desktop image to look like classic Earthworm Jim cartridge art! Here's a live demo of me inking the cartridge art: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Rw6Q_qlmT4Q

$90k STRETCH GOAL! - UNLOCKED! Every Bigfoot Bill Book Goes HARDBOUND! (Yeah, you read that right!)

$100k STRETCH GOAL! - UGH! UNLOCKED! Pie to the face.

$115k STRETCH - UNLOCKED! + All Perks from Campaign Unlocked for INDEMAND store!
$116k STRETCH  UNLOCKED! + Endsheet color papers with printed designs!
$117k STRETCH  UNLOCKED! + BIGGER 9" x 12" size! This book is huge!
$118k STRETCH  UNLOCKED! + Add ANOTHER 16 pages to make an 80 page book for ALL!
$119k STRETCH  UNLOCKED! + Super Matte "soft-touch" film laminate with spot gloss UV cover!
$120k STRETCH UNLOCKED! + "One hit" Foil Stamped Cover and Spine!
$121k - STRETCH UNLOCKED! + Upgrade Hard Cover Stock to thicker 98 pt board. BURLY!

$122k STRETCH  UNLOCKED! + Add ANOTHER 16 pages to make a 96 page book!
$124k STRETCH  UNLOCKED! + "2nd hit" Foil Stamped Cover and Spine!!
$128k STRETCH  UNLOCKED! + everyone at the $500 and up gets an original sketch of Bigfoot Bill ripped out of my sketchbook!
$130k STRETCH  UNLOCKED! + ADD 16 pages to Sketchbook/Ashcan from 32 to a 48 page book!
$132k STRETCH UNLOCKED! + Make SketchbookAshcan BIGGER 9" x 12" size! Huge!

$134k STRETCH UNLOCKED! + Make SketchbookAshcan FULL COLOR!
$136k STRETCH UNLOCKED! + Add 16 pgs to SketchbookAshcan from 48 to 64 pages!
$138k STRETCH UNLOCKED! + Add CLOTH COVER to Comic Book (w/ color inset image)!
$140k STRETCH  UNLOCKED! + Add cool embossing under foil and on cloth cover!

$141k STRETCH UNLOCKED! + Add SketchbookAshcan goes HARDCOVER! 

$142k STRETCH UNLOCKED!+ SketchbookAshcan printed 4 color end sheets!
$144k STRETCH  UNLOCKED! + SketchbookAshcan Supermatte Film + Spot GLOSS on cover!
$145k STRETCH UNLOCKED! + Comic & SketchbookAshcan get thicker cover stock from 98 PT to 120PT!
$146k STRETCH UNLOCKED! + Sketchbook Ashcan gets 1 hit foil stamp on cover!
$147k STRETCH  UNLOCKED! + Comic has embossing (inset), now add DEBOSSING (raised letters)!

$150k STRETCH UNLOCKED! + I'll die my hair hot-pink. ):
$180k STRETCH UNLOCKED! + Doug gets a BLUE BEARD

$190k STRETCH  UNLOCKED! + Self portrait with my foot Livestream!

$196K STRETCH  UNLOCKED! + (+ personal 5k donation to Special Olympics of Tennessee)
$200k STRETCH + Pink MOHAWK 

Specifics on the Bigfoot Bill playable DEMO GAME: it will be exclusively available to Indiegogo backers only! Not for sale! This is the closest any of us will come to playing a new Earthworm Jim in the next 6 months! Click here to see the first idle animation:  https://youtu.be/SaiZKIx6zDg



What I Need is $15,000 to Cover the Basics
This goes primarily to paying my colorist Dirk Erik Schultz/Kelsey Shannon, funds the print run and some of the cost of stuffing envelopes and packaging to get the book to you. If the funding raises beyond what I need, I'll add pages to the graphic novel and add stretch goals so that for the same donation you will get more book, more fun and more entertainment!


What You Get Starts Good and Gets Better!
I'm starting with a perfect bound, prestige format (better quality paper, card stock cover), 64 page book. ALL BIGFOOT BILL COMICS ON ANY TIER WILL BE SIGNED! This is just a starter perk, with other perks that include original art from the book, head drawings and a sketchbook! 

Past Success
I've launched and completed three Kickstarter campaigns, finished 16 graphic novels and won an Eisner, worked on 12 video games, got a Daytime Emmy nomination for my work as a Showrunner for Dreamworks/Netflix and know how to make stuff happen. My goal is always to give more than I get and I'm well known for doing quality work that is on time and on budget!



Risks & Challenges

Making the actual book is as easy as drinking a beer. The toughest part of the job is dealing with shipping. If this project funds I'll consider using a fulfillment house or even hire a staffer to help stuff envelopes and manage mailing lists.

I'd like to thank Mike Glendenning for the punk rock BFB campaign song, Dirk Erik Schultz for the colors and John Soares for editing the video.

SKETCHBOOK/ASHCAN SAMPLES:

$122k STRETCH  UNLOCKED! + Add ANOTHER 16 pages to make a 96 page book!$124k STRETCH  UNLOCKED! + "2nd hit" Foil Stamped Cover and Spine!!$128k STRETCH  UNLOCKED! + everyone at the $500 and up gets an original sketch of Bigfoot Bill ripped out of my sketchbook!$130k STRETCH  UNLOCKED! + ADD 16 pages to Sketchbook/Ashcan from 32 to a 48 page book!$132k STRETCH UNLOCKED! + Make SketchbookAshcan BIGGER 9" x 12" size! Huge!
$134k STRETCH UNLOCKED! + Make SketchbookAshcan FULL COLOR!$136k STRETCH UNLOCKED! + Add 16 pgs to SketchbookAshcan from 48 to 64 pages!$138k STRETCH UNLOCKED! + Add CLOTH COVER to Comic Book (w/ color inset image)!$140k STRETCH  UNLOCKED! + Add cool embossing under foil and on cloth cover!
$141k STRETCH UNLOCKED! + Add SketchbookAshcan goes HARDCOVER! 
$142k STRETCH UNLOCKED!+ SketchbookAshcan printed 4 color end sheets!$144k STRETCH  UNLOCKED! + SketchbookAshcan Supermatte Film + Spot GLOSS on cover!$145k STRETCH UNLOCKED! + Comic & SketchbookAshcan get thicker cover stock from 98 PT to 120PT!$146k STRETCH UNLOCKED! + Sketchbook Ashcan gets 1 hit foil stamp on cover!$147k STRETCH  UNLOCKED! + Comic has embossing (inset), now add DEBOSSING (raised letters)!
$150k STRETCH UNLOCKED! + I'll die my hair hot-pink. ):$180k STRETCH UNLOCKED! + Doug gets a BLUE BEARD
$190k STRETCH  UNLOCKED! + Self portrait with my foot Livestream!
$196K STRETCH  UNLOCKED! + (+ personal 5k donation to Special Olympics of Tennessee)$200k STRETCH + Pink MOHAWK Specifics on the Bigfoot Bill playable DEMO GAME: it will be exclusively available to Indiegogo backers only! Not for sale! This is the closest any of us will come to playing a new Earthworm Jim in the next 6 months! Click here to see the first idle animation:  https://youtu.be/SaiZKIx6zDg
What I Need is $15,000 to Cover the BasicsThis goes primarily to paying my colorist Dirk Erik Schultz/Kelsey Shannon, funds the print run and some of the cost of stuffing envelopes and packaging to get the book to you. If the funding raises beyond what I need, I'll add pages to the graphic novel and add stretch goals so that for the same donation you will get more book, more fun and more entertainment!What You Get Starts Good and Gets Better!I'm starting with a perfect bound, prestige format (better quality paper, card stock cover), 64 page book. ALL BIGFOOT BILL COMICS ON ANY TIER WILL BE SIGNED! This is just a starter perk, with other perks that include original art from the book, head drawings and a sketchbook! 
Past SuccessI've launched and completed three Kickstarter campaigns, finished 16 graphic novels and won an Eisner, worked on 12 video games, got a Daytime Emmy nomination for my work as a Showrunner for Dreamworks/Netflix and know how to make stuff happen. My goal is always to give more than I get and I'm well known for doing quality work that is on time and on budget!


Risks & Challenges
Making the actual book is as easy as drinking a beer. The toughest part of the job is dealing with shipping. If this project funds I'll consider using a fulfillment house or even hire a staffer to help stuff envelopes and manage mailing lists.I'd like to thank Mike Glendenning for the punk rock BFB campaign song, Dirk Erik Schultz for the colors and John Soares for editing the video.SKETCHBOOK/ASHCAN SAMPLES:

story:
This project will be the first in a series of 120 page, full color graphic novels to be published by IDW Publishing in 2013.

                       

            Joe Pratt is seventeen and in his last year of living in a foster home before moving on to the rest of his life. He’s delivering pizzas now but has no clue as to what he wants to do about his future.

           

            All of that changes when he’s attacked by a houseful of vampires and rescued by none other than Frankenstein’s Monster. The Monster reveals to Joe that he is the descendent of Baron Victor vonFrankenstein . The most famous undead creation the world has ever known has been watching over Joe since birth; staying to the shadows to protect him from… The Bride.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • Although we have a publisher to handle the printing and distribution of the book, there is no page rate or monetary advance. To create 120 pages at this quality level requires a lot of time so your contribution to this project will supply Graham and Chuck with the funds necessary to create an exciting new property, and even more important...the ability to keep the lights on in the process.

     Lots of goodies and perks and even a personal visit from the artist and writer are available in exchange for your donation.

  •  The project is already in the creative process. Graham and Chuck have begun work on the first volume for publication by IDW in 2013. Visit joefrankenstein.com to see more artwork, model sheets and other updates.

The Impact

Comics have really changed in the last 20 years. They've gotten darker and humorless. We want our project to reflect a time when comics were not only exciting, but fun to read. JOE FRANKENSTEIN is an all ages graphic novel in the same vein that Harry Potter was an all ages book. Kids and adults can read it and enjoy it on different levels.

•JOE FRANKENSTEIN is the kind of stuff that Marvel and DC are no longer publishing so we have taken it upon ourselves to do the kind of comics story that we, and a large part of the reading public are clammoring for.

•Your kind and generous support of this project will enable us to produce the art and story in a reasonable amount of time. Our goal, if fullly funded, is to have the books in your hands by Halloween of 2013.

•Nolan and Dixon have produced comics and graphic novels for all the major comic publishers for over 25 years so you can be assured this will get done and it will be really cool!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute this time then please alert the countryside that the Monster is coming. Visit the Joe Frankenstein page on Facebook and share it on your own page. Mention it in blogs, message boards and use the Indiegogo share tools right here on this page!

For Our Supporters

Welcome to TEAM JOE! As an added thanks, you will receive e-mail updates with exclusive content that no one else will see!

Check out the website for more images: www.joefrankenstein.com

 

THE 10 DAY SPRINT!

Anybody that donates at the $200 level will also receive an original layout page hand drawn by Graham Nolan! These are 1 of 120 original layouts which is the first and, arguably, the most important stage in the production of a graphic novel. This is where all the thought goes into the visual storytelling of the book! Compare these with the finished pages to see the creative process unfold!

story:
Book figure

  • A5 Left binding
  • paper - mojo 80g
  • full color pages
  • 311 page

book Contents

  • main story
  • lore sketch
  • extra story - The Origin

What is the'Recall the Time of No Return'?

<Recall the Time of No Return> is a collaboration between Doctor Who and my little pony. it was serialized from 2015 to 2018 In Deviantart.com (Link)

To understand this story, you should have to take <MLP: Fim season 1-5> and <The Day of the Doctor>

What is in the Extra Story named 'The Origin'?

The story explains the origins of Gold Lily and Sterling, which are not entirely clear in <Recall the Time of No Return>.

본편에서 완벽하게 밝혀지지 않은 골드릴리와 스털링의 기원에 대해 다룹니다.

Is There Other Language for Comic?

Obviously, RTNR has supported various languages with the help of volunteers in the series. However, since no one has completed the translation at this time and the translation is from the translator, So I have to ask for permission. but Korean is an exception.

한국인은 이 캠페인에 투자했을 때 한국어판을 따로 받게 될 것입니다만, 좀 더 긴 시간이 걸릴 수도 있습니다.

If We fail to achieve goals, will I not receive my books?

No, this project can get the book even if it does not reach the goal.

이 캠페인은 목표액 도달에 실패해도 책을 받을 수 있습니다.

story:
Remember those amazing horror comics you read as a kid?

Well, working together, we can bring back those wildly imaginative and wonderfully creepy stories that all we loved.

"Evil Jester Presents" is a gorgeously rendered graphic novel featuring stories from some of the biggest names and most exciting talent working in horror today. 

SNEAK PEEKS

“Polaroids" by horror legend Jack Ketchum. Adapted by accomplished writer David C. Hayes, pencilled by the brilliant Kurt Belcher, inked and colored by rising star Mike Gallagher.
 
 
 
Artwork-in-progress by the incredible Jason Whitley for our story "Observation Effect" by award-winning writer Jim Chambers.
 

TERRIFYING TALES FROM SOME OF THE BIGGEST NAMES AND RISING STARS IN HORROR!

JACK KETCHUM. Multiple award-winning author who Stephen King calls "The Scariest Guy in America."

WILLIAM F. NOLAN. Legendary author of the Logan's Run series with over 80 books to his credit.

JONATHAN MABERRY. New York Times Bestselling author and renowned comic book writer for Marvel comics.

RAMSEY CAMPBELL. The most honored writer in the horror industry and often called "Britain's most respected living horror writer."

JOE McKINNEY. Bram Stoker Award-winning author of the critically and commercially successful Dead World series.

GARY BRAUNBECK. Horror icon and winner of both the Bram Stoker and International Horror Guild Award.

And that's just for starters!

WHY INDIEGOGO?

The Evil Little Jester

EVIL JESTER PRESS is a successful publisher of award-winning horror novels. But many of our fans have talked about their love of the comics medium and the lack of quality horror comics being published today.  

We decided to do something about it. 

These days most of the major comic publishers are focused on superheroes, so we thought it would be a good idea to put the power in YOUR hands and let all of the horror/comics fans and EVIL JESTER COMICS staff, work together to create something we all want...

Kick ass horror comics! 

ARTISTS GALLERY

Below are just a few of the artists we've lined up for "Evil Jester Presents." We will add new artists and their work throughout this campaign. 

Richard P. Clark has worked for Marvel, DC, Image, and Dark Horse Comics among many others. He has collaborated with some of the best talent in the business, such as Grant Morrison on "Happy" from Image Comics and Garth Ennis in "The Boys" from Dynamite Comics. 

Check out Richard's online portfolio here: http://www.zippystudio.com/

Next up is Gary McClusky, who has made quite a name for himself in the horror industry, and has become the "go to" artist for original book covers. He also designed the cover of our premiere issue. Check out some of his stunning work below. 

Another fantastic artist we've lined up is multi-talented author/artist Greg Chapman, whose graphic novel "Witch Hunts: A Graphic History of the Burning Times" is currently nominated for Bram Stoker Award. See some of his terrific artwork below.

Check back often this month as we will add new artists to this gallery.

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

Producing a graphic novel is both expensive and labor intensive--particularly a book with multiple stories and different creative teams. 

While this is a passion project, we think it's important to pay everyone fairly for their hard work. That includes the original authors, the writers adapting the stories into scripts, the pencillers, inkers, colorists, letterers, and of course, our printing and marketing costs. 

We are a lean operation and we're not asking for more money than we absolutely need. (Remember, we have to pay Indiegogo right off the top). Every penny has been accounted for. Our profits will come from sales.

We've already put an enormous amount of time and effort into this project...from the professionally produced video, to the website, to the hundreds of stories we read through, to seeking out and negotiating with all of the talent. We look forward to seeing this project through to completion in all its full-color glory.

We hope you'll join us!

Here is a list of FREE things that will get added to your pledge the higher we go! We need your help to PROMOTE THIS INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN! So in return, we wanna GIVE AWAY FREE STUFF  to everyone who's pledged!! So share with anyone and everyone! Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Blogs, Websites... EVERYWHERE!! The more you share the quicker you will get to UNLOCKING more stuff.

Here's what's up for grabs so far:

  • $5,000 - LOCKED - Free postcard-sized collectibles from some of the characters in the stories, including the evil Jester himself
  • $10,000 - LOCKED- TBA
  • $15,000 -LOCKED - TBA
  • $20,000- LOCKED- TBA
  • 25,000- LOCKED- HUGE SURPRISE!!!

We'll add more if we reach this stage! 'Free Stuff' is only available to pledges of $10 and more.

MAKE SURE TO VISIT OUR WEBSITE: http://www.eviljestercomics.com and sign up on our email list for a chance to win exclusive prizes from Evil Jester Press and be the first to get updates on our upcoming comic projects.

story:
Cat and Meringue's latest storybook adventure!

'The Curse of Sir Thermidor' is a silly, pun-filled, fantastical adventure story about our heroes Cat and Meringue, a feline and a pudding who sail around in a Catamaran (get it?). They find an abandoned desolate reef and a melancholic lobster Knight called Sir Thermidor and end up swept up into an adventure involving monstrous yet delicious sea creatures, cursed black gold and lots of crabs!

Who are Cat and Meringue?

Welcome to the silly, adventurous, nautical, nutritional, quantum, metaphysical and sometimes downright ridiculous world of a feline and a pudding at sea in a twin-hulled boat. If you haven't seen them before Cat and Meringue are regulars on the UK comics scene appearing at many conventions year round, selling books, plushies and all sorts of other merch!

They started life as a successful daily webcomic, where I the artist, drew 1000 strips (nearly 3 years) of daily comics! They have since moved into the world of illustrated storybooks. Their first book 'The Saga of Starboy' came out earlier this year, and now I'm following it up with this one, 'The Curse of Sir Thermidor'

My name is Nich and I am the artist and writer of all things Cat and Meringue. I have been drawing comics for over 14 years, and am a part of the comics and games production company 'Big Punch Studios'. I create all sorts of stuff other than Cat and Meringue, such as 7STRING, the comic with the guitar-sword, and Sandwich Masters, the card game about making disgusting sandwiches!

What is this campaign for?

I am raising money for the printing of this colourful new adventure as a beautiful paperback book. The book will be a square format, 21x21cm perfect bound book with over 60 pages and over 30 full colour illustrations! Printing a book like this costs a bit of a chunk of dosh up front so I'm here today asking for your help with this! But if you support this book there will be a reward for you! See below for the rewards.

If I don't make my goal, the book will still get made, it will just take a little longer. In that situation, I will keep you updated and then get in contact with all of you who pledged and get your reward out to you as soon as I can!

What are the rewards?

This campaign is a small one so I'm keeping the rewards simple. That said, if it flies beyond my intended goal then I do have some pretty cool stretch goals in mind. We'll talk about those, as and when we get there!

The main reward is a copy of the book. If you pledge at the lowest tier you get yourself a digital PDF copy of the book! Next tier up gets you a glorious printed copy in the post (and the PDF). Topmost tier bags you a super limited-edition shiny enamel pin badge of Sir Thermidor the lobster knight himself, (along with the printed book and PDF)! I only have a mockup of the Sir Thermidor pin at this stage, but this will be the design and it will be a hard enamel pin, in silver!

Risks & Challenges

The book is done, written and illustrated so the risks and challenges are few. I have printed a book just like this (The Saga of Starboy), with the exact same printer and they have never let me down. They are quick, reliable and their standard is excellent.

The badge will take a little longer than the books, so those who pledge at the badge tier will have to wait a little longer for their rewards. But I'll keep you updated every step of the way!

I have run many crowdfunding campaigns, most recently a very successful campaign for the creation of Cat and Meringue plushies (which now fill my house, floor to ceiling). So I foresee no issues at all. If there are any, you will be the first to know and I will immediately tell you how I intend to fix them. I believe in keeping my backers up to date with everything.

THANK YOU!

I really hope you consider supporting this little campaign and helping me add yet more silliness to the world of Cat and Meringue and our real world too! 

See you out on the Secret Sea!

Nich x

So I foresee no issues at all. If there are any, you will be the first to know and I will immediately tell you how I intend to fix them. I believe in keeping my backers up to date with everything.
THANK YOU!
I really hope you consider supporting this little campaign and helping me add yet more silliness to the world of Cat and Meringue and our real world too! 
See you out on the Secret Sea!
Nich x

story:
Introduction:

My name is John O. Nelson better known as John O. I have been in the
entertainment business for 15 years. I have created a niche and gained an impressive following online.
My lateest project is a new web series that I am producing
called "Everybody Knows John O."

“Everybody Knows John O. Overview”:

“Everybody Knows John O.” is a web series about once a guy called, John O. who is known to most as a washed up, once famous, child actor.
As he grew up, John O. experienced everything a young man in
Hollywood could; clubs, women, and drugs. It all ended, when he had a nervous breakdown on a national television
show talk show. From there, his life spiraled downward into a self-destructive
pool of despair. Soon after his public collapse, his hit television show “Momma
You Crazy” was canceled. His agent decided to not represent him anymore, and
finding work became equivalent to finding Bigfoot.

With no prospects of work, John took the last of his money and moved
back home to Iowa, where he feels that no one will judge him and he can have a
new lease on life.

With nothing else to lose, John decides to invest in an Organic Cow Manure
farm, which later becomes a big hit among the Mother Earth crowd.
Some time passes and John O’s new life is working out great for him. He is in a
loving relationship with a beautiful local woman named Angie. His supportive
younger brother Carl moves to Iowa to help him on the farm. To top it off, John
O. also has his loyal dog Bumpers ?; life couldn’t be better.

One day John O. receives a phone call from his former agent who gives him the
news; one of his former co-stars has passed away after being in a huge
accident involving a truck full of rabbit squirrel. John O. returns to Los
Angeles, against his better judgment, to pay his respect to the friend. During
the funeral, his former agent and manager convinces him to make a comeback.
Although not very interested in living the celebrity life again, his star struck
girlfriend and little brother talk him into going back into listening to his agent/manager.

After a few weeks of being back on the audition grind, John O. is told by his
girlfriend Angie that she is leaving him for his archenemy “Kel Mitchell” (Of
Keenan & Kel) who is now a “C” list actor himself and is trying to make a
comeback as well.

John believes that not only will he find true love but also that he will rise
back to the top of the television actor totem pole, well that is if “Everybody
didn’t know John O.”

The Impact

If financing is not secured the film can't be produced. Unlike many other
campaigns on the site, I have the means and capabilities to edit and do color
correction, but I don't have the capital to upkeep a set for 4 days. I want to
be able to have a set where the actors and crew are happy, motivated, and well
taken care of. In order for me to do this I need to be able to get the equipment
that they need to do a great job, I need to be able to have safe and reliable
transportation for everyone, and most importantly I need everyone to be well
fed. This will be the first project that I have written to be entered into film
festivals around the country.

What We Need & How you can benefit:

We are looking for $4000. This money will allow us to secure the following
equipment and services; Director of Photography with a Canon 5D kit, Lighting
Kit Rental, Location Rental (3 Different Areas), Sound Equipment Rental,
Insurance For 3 days, Catering For 3 Days, LA Permits, Wardrobe For a Total of 5
Actors, Photographer, Poster and Promotional Designer, and Film Festival Fees.
We appreciate any amount that you donate and to show you how much we do
appreciate you support we plan on giving everyone a ticket to the private
screening of the finished film in Los Angeles The screening will be done before
we enter it into the festivals.

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you are not financially able to help it's OK; we just ask that you share this
page with friends and family. We understand that times are hard for some and I
really do thank you for taking the time to view and read this campaign. It has
been a very long road for me to get to this point in my life and I am humble and
thankful for any and all support that I receive. Thank you again and be well.

story:
Project Summary

It has always been a passion of mine to write a book. With that in mind I would like to cross the word book with, comic. Perhaps the term, graphic novel would be more accurate. For years authors and directors have depicted a zombie apocalypse to be something of a Rambo affair. Let's pick up a hammer and see how many we can clobber! I see it differently. If an undead nightmare happened right now, what would you do? Would you run out into the street and take out as many as you could? Neither would I. I'd hide just like the rest of humanity.

In this "graphic novel" I'll take you on a fresh look around the panic stricken zombie apocalypse, with stories from believable characters. To accompany the book I would also like to make a YouTube series that would support some of the characters back stories. This would be presented as a radio show as the apocalypse breaks out. To achieve this I would need to hire a few voice actors as I would like the series to be on par with the novel. In addition to the novel and web series I would need to launch a website for promotional reasons. This would allow all fans & future fans of the series to receive regular updates on the series.

The funds would be dispersed thus:

£0-350 / Processor
£351-2000 / Illustrator, editor, self publishing
£2001-2450 /  Web Series
£2451-2500 / Web Hosting

The processor is required for my computer. My PC at the moment is running at maximum capacity and I require a new processor in order to further the project and continue in my career. 

Concept Art

This is potentially what a typical page may look like. This is obviously subject to change.


What I Need & What You Get

Of course if it were as simple as to sit down and type, I would of had 3 books written by now. The truth is, writing a book isn't as easy or as "free" as you may think. I won't be rushing to a publisher after completion as I plan to self publish. This requires a lot of funding as nothing is free.

There are a selection of perks available to chose from and more may be added if the others sell out. If you have any questions regarding the project, please feel free to contact me.

    The Impact

    Your contribution will go a long way in my quest to self publish. Even the smallest of donations will be appreciated. The proceeds of the book will go towards another in the instalment. Your generosity will go a long way to making this dream a reality.

    Additional Project

    If the novel is a success and there is a small amount of the budget left, I would like to adapt the novel into a YouTube series. Although this is not the main goal of the project, I have it in mind. There is a small amount of the fund that is strictly to get the series off the ground. This is an "after thought" should the novel get full funding.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Fear not!

    If you cannot contribute for whatever reason, just share the project! Use social media and get the word out there!

    What If The Project Doesn't Meet It's Goal?

    Should such a thing happen I will complete the project under budget. Although I require the whole amount to hire the staff I require to edit, design and self publish the novel. I will attempt to shave off the budget should this happen. Rest assured the novel WILL see the light of day.

    Title is a working progress.

story:
Short Summary

NECROMANTICAL RUST -Cards Set
12 card Set featuring Art by Stefano Cardoselli

 Free Shipping!!!

 

What We Need & What You Get

The funds necessary to complete the hand-painted art and production for this project and a good foundation for future projects. The cards will be a large 6x9 format on glossy paper stock suitable for framing. In addition to the cards I have some very unique and exclusive items to offer to supporters of the project including a Digital Sketchbook, limited hand-painted button sets, original sketches, and original hand-painted art! Everything will be designed and handmade by me , Italian artist Stefano Cardoselli, including hand-painted

colors 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute any money (We all know what it's like to be broke), you can still help me out by spreading the word about this campaign. Tweet about it, post about it on Facebook, mention it to your local comic book stores and 'New Age' or Spiritual shops... Every little bit will help and it will be greatly appreciated!
Follow me at

http://stefanocardoselli.wix.com/stefanocardoselli
and on facebook

https://www.facebook.com/stefanocardoselliartista

story:
Who is Sailor Comics?

Hello, my name is Caleb Manci.  I am an actor, writer and producer living in Los Angeles.  It is my belief that entertainment should be used for the purpose of spreading ideas so when I became aware that the T.gondii virus effects approximately 80% of the population and then discovered that virtually no one knows about it, I knew I had to do something.

The illustration, printing and marketing of the first issue has been completely funded out of pocket.  To date I have spent approximately $10,000 on it and I have made nothing. Which is fine.  My intent is to begin conversations that can lead to a cure, not to become rich.

Since I am a writer and not a scientist, I can't collect data or create studies but I can fuel the imagination of those that can.  That is why I've turned to you and the internet community in order to help spread the word about this harmful disease.  Please watch the video for more information about the wide-spread impact of the virus.  If you can't contribute, please share both the video and this campaign in order to simply make more people aware.

Funding and Perks

In light of what I've already spent, I am asking very little.  In no way do I expect others to fund this entire comic book insanity.  However, I am looking for a little help to raise the necessary cash for the largest expenditure, namely, the branding and printing.  $2500 will take the collection of drawings I've commissioned and turn it into about a 1000 books, complete with ISBNs and barcodes, ready to sell.

What you get for what you donate:

  • $10 - Either Issue 1: Secret Agents or Issue 2: Inside Cat Taffy autographed and sent to you.
  • $15 - Both Issue 1: Secret Agents and Issue 2: Inside Cat Taffy autographed and sent to you.
  • $100 - Original artwork from the comics along with Issue 1: Secret Agents and Issue 2: Inside Cat Taffy sent to you.
  • $250 - Dedication of your choice on the opening page of Issue 2, original artwork from the comics along with Issue 1: Secret Agents and Issue 2: Inside Cat Taffy.
  • $500 - Producers credit in Issue 2, original artwork from the comics along with Issue 1: Secret Agents and Issue 2: Inside Cat Taffy.

In the event that not all the funds are raised by this campaign, the money will still be used to print Issue 2 and I will fund the missing portion myself.

Help Change the World

As explained above and by the video, Toxoplasma Gondii is a very real threat to the mental well-being of humans.

  • Although it was discovered in 1908, it was considered completely harmless until recently. 
  •  It can be contracted by contact with cats, eating unwashed vegetables or by consuming pork.  
  • Great Britain places the number of infections at approximately 35,000 per year.
  • As 2013, 38 studies found a positive correlation between toxoplasmosis and schizophrenia.
  • Numerous studies have shown a positive correlation between a toxoplasmic infection of the frontal lobe and suicidal tendencies in women.
  • Recently the virus has been linked to ADHD and OCD.

To me the real troubling thing is that this may be the first time you've heard of it.  Or if you have heard about it, you thought it was some kind of joke.  It's not.  T.gondii is very real and effects society on a number of levels.  My intent with this comic is to bring attention to the virus so that it can be eradicated.

If you are unable to contribute to this campaign, that's okay.  Share the link, share the video, start conversations about the virus, do research.  Knowledge is power and the more people that know, the more people have the opportunity to stop it.

story:
orz
Hello. If you're here you're most likely my friend or someone that follows me on Twitter. Thank you for clicking on the link and thank you for reading...

What is this?

Basically, I need money because my computer is dead.
Now, usually I would not ask my friends for money, as everyone that has ever known me would tell you. But I recently had to stop working and since then there's been troubles with money and I basically have no current income. Even that would not be a problem I'd bother you with, if my computer wasn't dying at the same time.  I'm starting school after summer break is over, and the school requires a (working) computer.

This campaign ends 2 days after my birthday (because I'm apparently too dumb to calculate when my birthday is, whops). It's good timing and also it makes me feel less bad for essentially begging for money. Just consider it a birthday present, maybe.

Okay, why don't you get work real fast?

There are a lot of personal reasons why I can't at the moment, but the short story is, it's a health problem.

Stuff that will happen if I get a new computer

Now, here's the promises part of this campaign.

A big reason why I have stopped fansubbing with my group naisho is that my computer would freeze up constantly and can't even really handle Aegisub anymore because of death.

Now, we're planning to revive naisho with more Kasumin subs eventually anyway. Me getting a new PC will not be the reason that revives naisho, but what it will do is make me more able to actually work and get releases out much faster.

Another thing that will happen is more drawing, which no one really gains anything from cause my art is bad but maybe it's fun to see me get better. I'm still drawing but at the moment drawing on my computer is impossible cause it will die on me after 2 minutes in Sai.

And also, I won't die. I dunno why anyone would enjoy my company but if you're my friend, odds are you do. So me not dying could be something you'd like. Maybe.


Thank you for reading.

Note: I really only need something that works and doesn't die on me every few hours. For that, I don't actually need 500€, around 300€ would be enough, but 500€ is the minimum that indiegogo allows. Any extra money goes to a faster computer, of course.

story:
What is 'War in the Neighborhood'?

War in the Neighborhood is 320 pages of largely unheard history. First published in 1999, WITN is a story about smashing cinderblocks, filling in the cracks and finding our future in the rubble. It tells the story of New York City's Lower East Side in the late 1980s, when it came under attack by wealthy developers, cynical politicians and that special kind of daring yuppie who thinks that gunshots in the night are a sure sign of a hip 'hood. The panels may be black and white, but the moral questions raised in the comic are anything but. 

 

 

It may be hard to imagine that a story set at the end of the Cold War is relevant to struggle today. The history of social struggle, however, repeats itself. The lessons contained in 'War in the Neighborhood' have echoes in Occupy, Black Lives Matter and other 21st century social movements.

 

 

 

 

 

Ad Astra Comix is a comics publisher focused on social justice. We've previously published comics dealing with feminist and environmental themes, and we'll be publishing works about migrant rights, prisons, and indigenous struggles in the year to come. More about us here.
 

Perks, Get Your Red Hot Perks Fresh From the Internet

'War in the Neighborhood' is the longest book we've ever published. Our printer tells us that it will cost about $11,000 to print 3,000 copies. In order to ensure that our publishing projects are sustainable, we make sure that pre-order campaigns like this one cover the full cost of printing. Our funding levels reflect the cost of laying out, printing and shipping these titles. That's why we're asking for 15 big ones in order to cover costs. *bites nails*

If we don't reach that goal, we can adjust the size of the print run. If for some reason we don't make enough to print even 1,000 copies (the minimum required for offset printing), we will be forced to hold bake sales and swimsuit car washes (male collective members only) until we reach the necessary amount. 
 

(Top): Reward Level "WAR Starter Pack", featuring a copy of 'War in the Neighborhood', plus two extremely rare issues of World War 3 Illustrated including 'The Riot Issue' #11, and Issue #13 featuring a sneak preview of the chapter 'Seige' from War in the Neighborhood First Edition. (Bottom): Reward Level "Tobocman Starter Pack", featuring a copy of 'War in the Neighborhood', plus 'You Don't Have to Fuck People Over to Survive' (AK Press, 2009), 'Disaster and Resistance' (AK Press, 2008), 'LEN: A Lawyer in History' (AK Press, 2016), and 'Portraits of Israelis and Palestinians' (Softskull Press, 2003)

 

 

 

Luckily for anyone who might otherwise fall prey to our sub-par car washing service, we're not worried about coming up short. Why not? Well, check out our awesome perks over on the sidebar and see for yourself.
 

Making a Difference

'War in the Neighborhood' is a classic work of comics history. By contributing to this crowdfunder, you are helping to put it into schools, libraries and universities around North America. You're also ordering yourself a book that is funny, moving and looks great on your coffee table where it will lend an air of cosmopolitan sophistication. 

This is a dream project for us; something we have been pursuing since Ad Astra was founded in 2013. Reading 'War in the Neighborhood' was a transformative experience for all of us and we're sincerely excited to be sharing it with all of you. Seth Tobocman has done so much for radical art and artists since he co-founded 'World War 3 Illustrated' in 1979, the world's longest running English language anthology of political comics. We're frankly honoured to be working with him. 

We also think that WITN is the kind of project that can inspire people to do similar work. Social movements often struggle to retain any kind of institutional memory, and comics history can play that role. Pick up a copy of 'War in the Neighborhood' and you'll see for yourself how much history can fit into 300 pages, and how heart-breakingly beautiful those stories can be.

 

 

 

Risks + Challenges

This is our single biggest crowdfunder to date. Our next biggest, 'Drawing the Line', managed to raise $9,100. Our last crowdfunder, 'Extraction', didn't do as well - it came up $1,800 short and we had to reduce the size of the print run.

Our team has doubled in size since then. We have been doing background work on this project for close to a year: building contact lists, soliciting reviews, pursuing media coverage and otherwise getting ourselves ready.

We've also looked at what went right with past crowdfunders and are building on those successes. Maybe you were led here by one of the feature articles dealing with the themes of WITN? Our numbers tell us that it's an effective way to drive traffic to projects like this one.

We have our concerns about this project, but no doubts that by late September, we'll be printing a few thousand copies of 'War in the Neighborhood'.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

While we're grateful for every contribution, we understand not everyone can afford to order a copy of the book. But there are still plenty of ways that you can help us make the second edition of 'War in the Neighborhood' a reality:

  • Share this page using Indiegogo's share tools
  • Drop by your local book store or comic shop and encourage them to order some copies.
  • Libraries will order books if requested by cardholders. Check yours.
  • If you're a journalist, ask for a review copy.
  • Organize a collective, take over an abandoned building in the urban core of some decaying metropolis, fix it up, then when you get on the news maybe give us a shout out, you know.
     

Thanks for stopping by!
story_txt:
What is 'War in the Neighborhood'?War in the Neighborhood is 320 pages of largely unheard history. First published in 1999, WITN is a story about smashing cinderblocks, filling in the cracks and finding our future in the rubble. It tells the story of New York City's Lower East Side in the late 1980s, when it came under attack by wealthy developers, cynical politicians and that special kind of daring yuppie who thinks that gunshots in the night are a sure sign of a hip 'hood. The panels may be black and white, but the moral questions raised in the comic are anything but.   It may be hard to imagine that a story set at the end of the Cold War is relevant to struggle today. The history of social struggle, however, repeats itself. The lessons contained in 'War in the Neighborhood' have echoes in Occupy, Black Lives Matter and other 21st century social movements.     Ad Astra Comix is a comics publisher focused on social justice. We've previously published comics dealing with feminist and environmental themes, and we'll be publishing works about migrant rights, prisons, and indigenous struggles in the year to come. More about us here. Perks, Get Your Red Hot Perks Fresh From the Internet'War in the Neighborhood' is the longest book we've ever published. Our printer tells us that it will cost about $11,000 to print 3,000 copies. In order to ensure that our publishing projects are sustainable, we make sure that pre-order campaigns like this one cover the full cost of printing. Our funding levels reflect the cost of laying out, printing and shipping these titles. That's why we're asking for 15 big ones in order to cover costs. *bites nails*If we don't reach that goal, we can adjust the size of the print run. If for some reason we don't make enough to print even 1,000 copies (the minimum required for offset printing), we will be forced to hold bake sales and swimsuit car washes (male collective members only) until we reach the necessary amount.  (Top): Reward Level "WAR Starter Pack", featuring a copy of 'War in the Neighborhood', plus two extremely rare issues of World War 3 Illustrated including 'The Riot Issue' #11, and Issue #13 featuring a sneak preview of the chapter 'Seige' from War in the Neighborhood First Edition. story:
Hi, Everybody. I'm Vincent Ferrante, publisher of Monarch Comics as well as the creator and writer of one of our two flagship characters, Witch Hunter. Monarch Comics was founded in 2008 to publish the Witch Hunter comic book and diversify the Witch Hunter brand into toys, animation, TV, and films. Over the last ten years we've expanded our fanbase and online distribution through exhibiting at shows like the New York Comic Con and partnering with companies like DriveThru Comics, ComicsPlus, and Amazon, with all of our titles soon to be available on Comixology. In the course of our expansion, our line has grown to include our other flagship title, The Saga of Evil Monkey Man, plus a supernatural Viking adventure series, The Last, and a cosmic horror series, The Winter Lantern. 

We're currently in the process of securing investment to take our company to the next level, allowing us to advertise and distribute to comic book stores and begin the process of licensing our properties for merchandising and translation into other mediums like animation, TV, and films. While that's going on, we've just been picked up for newsstand distribution in Books-A-Million and similar independent outlets, with Witch Hunter and The Saga of Evil Monkey Man being our launch titles in this new market for us. We will be promoting our new distribution and new titles from a premiere booth at this year's New York Comic Con. This is where we need your help.

Until we secure the major investment we're in the process of negotiating, Monarch Comics is funded by its four principals using their personal finances. While it's taken us a few years to grow the company to where we are now, it's an accomplishment that we're proud of and are grateful to the fans who have validated that with their ongoing support. With the added costs of printing our titles for newsstand distribution, as well as printing new titles and manufacturing promotional items to include with them at the New York Comic Con, it would help us if we could raise an additional $5,000 over the next month.

On our website http://www.monarchcomics.com you can see the origins of Witch Hunter and Evil Monkey Man, pages from those comics as well as our new titles, The Last and The Winter Lantern, to introduce you to a line of comics that delivers a complete story in every issue and a more rewarding experience if you continue to read a series. One of our guiding principles is keeping our line of titles small and accessible to both the casual and serious comic book fans and their wallets. Comic books should be fun, transport you to other worlds, give you some insight on the world you left, and return you to it feeling refreshed, inspired, and excited to read the next issue of your favorite comic. We grew up on fun comics, we love comics, and we want to continue to produce comics that take us, and you, on fantastic adventures.

To the right you'll see Incentive Packages with comics and goodies that we know you'll love and have a lot of fun opening when they arrive at your front door. As this month-long campaign unfolds, we might be adding a stretch goal or two with some other surprise incentives.

story:
Overview

In 2015  I made the first Nandi Bear Tenants book. It was a graphic novel about superheroes and talking cats and all sorts of exciting things. Since then it has become a favourite book of many young people (And old people), Especially at the school where I work. I have had constant requests to make sequels. And here I am at my most ambitious book yet. Number 4.

The Nandi Bear Tenants

Hello, I've been making comics, music and films since I was 7 years old... almost 40 years ago now. It's all very low budget and basically home made. I work at an elementary school with grades 1 through 6 and in class I have been teaching the kids how to make comics and films and other creative things like that for several years, I also teach private art classes and run my own art camps every summer.

Before I made The Nandi Bear Tenants, I got excited about all the old comics I made when I was a kid and decided to make a series of cartoons about one of the old superheroes I made up  who was based on a real cat I had (We're talking 1985...) Anyway, I had such an amazing time bringing Dorriss Doom and her friends to life, that that was another reason I wanted to focus on making comics again for a while. Dorriss Doom premiered at that year's Calgary comic and entertainment expo. It was a huge hit and I had kids asking for my autograph the rest of the weekend. It was bizarre and awesome. Bottom line is, people loved Dorriss Doom, and since then there has been 3 successful books and a cartoon movie based on the Nandi Bear Tenants.

What We Need & What You Get

I am hand drawing every page and colouring it with watercolour paints. I am scanning the finished pages and doing the text on my computer (Using a font I made myself.) The whole story is 104 pages long, and I anticipate it will take me a few more months to make it all.  I  will be going through Amazon Publishing to get it made. The money I am trying to get will go towards the printing of as many copies of the comic as I can get. I will use these copies to give to the people who funded the project and also have some to give away and sell at comic conventions. 

The Story

This chapter in the ongoing story of the Nandi Bear Tenants is a culmination of events over hundreds of pages of comics and a feature length film. The Revenge of Super Punk! Stensor and Naiad's long lost and much talked about mortal enemy is back, and he's looking for revenge! Along with his evil partner in crime, Floyd the illusionist, Super Punk uses dark magic to turn the planet of Animole world against Earth. Not to mention an army of giant robots, huge ants, Armadillos, a insane dream world and even Great Auntie Nandi bear herself!

It is the biggest story I have ever told, and I hope you will love every minute of it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign! 

And go visit my website and watch tons of movies and listen to and download a bunch of music or something.. or follow us on facebook. I do so much stuff all the time and basically give it all away for free.. 

http://scentertainment.ca  

SC Entertainment on Facebook  

It would be lovely if I could print out some more of these comics. They have made such exciting difference in many kids lives, and my own. I have taught kids to read using these books, It's very exciting to me to be doing something like this.

story:
This is the Danger-Squad on IndieGogo!

What is Danger-Squad you ask? Well, Danger-Squad is a comedic science-fiction comic book story that takes place around 300 years in the future, in the furthest reaches of the galaxy. A team of disjointed and neurotic characters take a venturesome journey through the universe led by their fearless and erratic captain named Dirk Domingo.

Who's Dirk?  

At the center of our story is Captain Dirk Domingo. An eccentric, impulsive space captain who ventures the galaxy searching for adventure and the next payday to maintain his ship "The Stallion."

Deep down, he longs to discover the reason, and meaning to his overall existence. In the meantime, he lives from moment-to-moment and teams up with a maladjusted group of space nomads who all have their own personal goals and aspirations.

 
What to Expect

Think of your favorite space story with a twist of retro-futurism. While it has a humorous, light hearted side, it's also a deeper science fiction adventure in the spirit of Robert A. Heinlein, Arthur C. Clark and Phillip K. Dick.

There's a vast cosmos of diverse space villains to venture through. An array of conscious planets, and bizarre deep-space anomalies.

 What's in the Book? 

The content and packaging of the book is as follows: This is the first Danger-Squad graphic novel, which would be the origin story. It would be 50 pages of colorful high quality paper. The softcover measures at 8.5" x 12.5" and features the Danger-Squad origin story followed by vivid splash pages. Looking to have guest artists also contribute to these splash pages with their own creative visual interpretations.

The Budget and Costs 

The budget of this comic book includes the collaboration with a colorist, an inker, and letterer. I'm creating 300 copies of this story to share with readers far and wide. I'm looking to invest an amount on the marketing and promotion to put out there for the public consumption and awareness. (Comic-Con, post cards, and travel to various art related events). 

Over 2 Years in Development

I'm the creator, writer, and the artist of this story. All these years have prepared me for a special opportunity like this. It's all coming together full circle now. I want this project to represent my passion, respect, and appreciation for the comic book, and science-fiction medium.

With your support, I can complete, publish, market and distribute my first major comic. I want to make this a quality work, which represents my passion, respect, and appreciation for the comic book, and science-fiction medium. I would be sincerely grateful for any amount you can contribute to this dream! Let's do this together!

story:
The world known as Thratas is a planet covered by sand, dust and death. What little green there is has been harvested by the lords of the lands to further their wealth and power. The weak die or become slaves, eternally in service to those of means. The lords create weapons and machines of industry in their great cities that cause pollution, making the world even more of a wasteland. Groups of orcs, elves, humans and other races roam the land, scavenging what they can to build their own weapons and ammunition to destroy. Slavery is rampant, both in the wastes and the cities.

"Sample page from Lowlife Issue #2"

In the second installment of Lowlife, the story picks up right where it left off. The Elf Slave, Nis'si, continues to tell our anti-hero how they met and this begins to open up more doors to those memories that have been somehow locked to him. We also learn more of her backstory as well. How she became a slave, why she didn't want him to become her owner, yet even though he did, why she doesn't resist. 

"Sample page from Lowlife Issue #2"

Lowlife Issue #2 promises to be even more action packed, just as sexy and have more individual character development than its predecessor.

NOTE: Lowlife contains graphic violence, nudity, adult language and some sexual content. Reader discretion advised.

Broken follows A'tal, a woman raised as a warrior and earning her coin as a wasteland mercenary. More important to her than the money, is the honor she finds in the constant battle for survival in the harsh wastes. The story begins with our Heroine returning to her home years after she left her family behind in search of her glory. While there, she will learn of  great threats against her remaining family and the shanty-town she once called home. Join A'tal and her companions; a gruff, dwarven mechanic, a foul-mouthed human and even an enchantingly beautiful, yet equally deadly half-elf as they face off against the greatest threat they have known.

"Sample Page from Broken #1"

Broken is an action packed story of redemption, violent, haunted pasts and survival against overwhelming odds. It features the likenesses of Atalee Judy, Aelflaed, Jade Crystal and Steve Hornbek to name a few. It is beautifully drawn by Jose Jaro and colored by Lowlife artist Ewelina Mroczkowska.

NOTE: Though not as explicit as Lowlife, Broken does contain graphic violence, adult language and adult content. Reader discretion advised.

"Sample page from Broken #1"

What We Need & What You Get!

All of the funds contributed go toward the production of the comic.  From the art, coloring and lettering as well as shipping and printing costs for all of the physical rewards.

You can get anything from original inked pages from Broken by Jose Jaro, digital copies of the books, digital speed paintings of your choice from Lowlife artist Ewelina Mroczkowska, as well as sketch cards from Jose.  We have post-apocalyptic cards and even a commission available. You can even help design some of the characters in the story or see your likeness on the page! Check out the list and be sure to read all of the items and what they have that you can get for your contribution to help us make these books! In the meantime, check out just a few sample images of what you could get below.

"Jose Jaro's original inked page sample. Drawn on 11 x 17 comic paper."

"Sample digital speed painting from Ewelina Mroczkowska"

 

"Jose Jaro commission sample"

"Sketch card samples from Jose Jaro."

 

Meet the team:

Kenny Groom is the co-creator and writer of "Upstarts," published by Ink Forged Studios.  He has also recently worked with Identity Comics Studio on their Anthology "The Blueprint 2," to which he wrote two of the four stores found in the book.  He has spent many years learning how to write comics and tell wonderful stories and will continue to write until the day he is given to the sands.

"Kenny"

Jason Humm has enjoyed a public-sector career focused on writing and editing. His self-published, autobiographical book of poetry, Dodged, sheds light on depression and thoughts of suicide. This will be Jason's second time working on comics and has found that he loves the medium.

"Jason"

Ewelina Mroczkowska is an accomplished freelance artist who has done the illustrations on titles such as; "Legends of Steragos: Damsels of Distress" by Kevin M. Scott and "Princess Lucinda: Book One: Black Rose of the Empire" by Malcolm Harris.

"Ewelina"

Jose Jaro is a University of the Arts graduate who has worked on Grimm Fairytales from Zenescope, Outlaw Territory Volume 2 for Image, Upper Deck Sketch Cards and recently he co-created and drew Upstarts with Lowlife/Broken creator Kenny Groom.

"Jose"

"Print sample from Ewelina"

"Print sample from Jose"

Risks and Challenges:

Every production has obstacles to overcome.  From printing and shipping to cost of the artwork. If we make our goal, we will have no problems bringing this comic to life however and put it in your hands!

Our biggest challenge with Lowlife #1 was caused by trouble with the company we used for poster prints. This time around, we have a print company lined up that is fantastic and we foresee no problems getting all the perk rewards out in a timely fashion!

Thank you all so much from all of us!

Be sure and help us spread the word! Search @LowlifeComic on FB and @olddogdigital on IG to keep up to date!

We also learn more of her backstory as well. How she became a slave, why she didn't want him to become her owner, yet even though he did, why she doesn't resist. 

"Sample page from Lowlife Issue #2"
Lowlife Issue #2 promises to be even more action packed, just as sexy and have more individual character development than its predecessor.
NOTE: Lowlife contains graphic violence, nudity, adult language and some sexual content. Reader discretion advised.

Broken follows A'tal, a woman raised as a warrior and earning her coin as a wasteland mercenary. More important to her than the money, is the honor she finds in the constant battle for survival in the harsh wastes. The story begins with our Heroine returning to her home years after she left her family behind in search of her glory. While there, she will learn of  great threats against her remaining family and the shanty-town she once called home. Join A'tal and her companions; a gruff, dwarven mechanic, a foul-mouthed human and even an enchantingly beautiful, yet equally deadly half-elf as they face off against the greatest threat they have known.

"Sample Page from Broken #1"
Broken is an action packed story of redemption, violent, haunted pasts and survival against overwhelming odds. It features the likenesses of Atalee Judy, Aelflaed, Jade Crystal and Steve Hornbek to name a few. It is beautifully drawn by Jose Jaro and colored by Lowlife artist Ewelina Mroczkowska.
NOTE: Though not as explicit as Lowlife, Broken does contain graphic violence, adult language and adult content. Reader discretion advised.

"Sample page from Broken #1"
What We Need & What You Get!
All of the funds contributed go toward the production of the comic.  From the art, coloring and lettering as well as shipping and printing costs for all of the physical rewards.
You can get anything from original inked pages from Broken by Jose Jaro, digital copies of the books, digital speed paintings of your choice from Lowlife artist Ewelina Mroczkowska, as well as sketch cards from Jose.  We have post-apocalyptic cards and even a commission available. You can even help design some of the characters in the story or see your likeness on the page! Check out the list and be sure to read all of the items and what they have that you can get for your contribution to help us make these books! In the meantime, check out just a few sample images of what you could get below.


"Jose Jaro's original inked page sample. Drawn on 11 x 17 comic paper."

"Sample digital speed painting from Ewelina Mroczkowska"
 

"Jose Jaro commission sample"

"Sketch card samples from Jose Jaro."
 
Meet the team:
Kenny Groom is the co-creator and writer of "Upstarts," published by Ink Forged Studios.  He has also recently worked with Identity Comics Studio on their Anthology "The Blueprint 2," to which he wrote two of the four stores found in the book.  He has spent many years learning how to write comics and tell wonderful stories and will continue to write until the day he is given to the sands.

"Kenny"
Jason Humm has enjoyed a public-sector career focused on writing and editing. His self-published, autobiographical book of poetry, Dodged, sheds light on depression and thoughts of suicide. This will be Jason's second time working on comics and has found that he loves the medium.

"Jason"
Ewelina Mroczkowska is an accomplished freelance artist who has done the illustrations on titles such as; "Legends of Steragos: Damsels of Distress" by Kevin M. Scott and "Princess Lucinda: Book One: Black Rose of the Empire" by Malcolm Harris.

"Ewelina"
Jose Jaro is a University of the Arts graduate who has worked on Grimm Fairytales from Zenescope, Outlaw Territory Volume 2 for Image, Upper Deck Sketch Cards and recently he co-created and drew Upstarts with Lowlife/Broken creator Kenny Groom.

"Jose"

"Print sample from Ewelina"

"Print sample from Jose"
Risks and Challenges:
Every production has obstacles to overcome.  From printing and shipping to cost of the artwork. If we make our goal, we will have no problems bringing this comic to life however and put it in your hands!
Our biggest challenge with Lowlife #1 was caused by trouble with the company we used for poster prints. This time around, we have a print company lined up that is fantastic and we foresee no problems getting all the perk rewards out in a timely fashion!
Thank you all so much from all of us!
Be sure and help us spread the word! Search @LowlifeComic on FB and @olddogdigital on IG to keep up to date!

story:
CHECK OUT MY WEBSITE AT: http://ianjay.net


VIEW OUR PROGRESS BLOGS AT: http://twitter.com/ianjay and http://ianjay.tumblr.com


LIKE US ON FACEBOOK: Ian Jay Super Comics


Our Story

Hi, I'm Ian Jay! I've been making comics seriously since 2005. I have a B.F.A. in Sequential Art from the Savannah College of Art and Design, and I currently split my time between working on a graphic novel (Epiphany) and several short-story comic projects. My ultimate career goal is to support myself off my comic work, and I feel that creating this book will bring me one step closer to achieving that dream.


The Impact

Ian Jay Super Comics: Volume One is a book that includes significant comic I've done since I started college (not including Epiphany, which will get its own book release later this year). It can be viewed multiple ways: 

  • As a document of an artist's improvement over several years of practice and refinement.
  • As a portfolio of the wide variety of different styles and subject matter that I can cover.
  • As a durable, portable and comprehensive replacement for readers' minicomic collections.
  • As a big book full of really weird comics.

It will give fans something cool to hang onto and share for years, it will give people who have never heard of me a starting point to understanding the kind of work I do, and it will give me a professional edge with potential employers. By printing this book, I hope to take my skills and reputation to a higher level. 


What We Need & What You Get

I need a bare minimum of nine hundred dollars to get the books printed and shipped out. I'm doing this fundraiser through Indiegogo's Flexible Funding system, so if you pre-order the book, you're going to get a copy, even if we don't manage to raise enough money in time. You should be getting your hard or digital copy of the book, as well as any extra goodies you might have ordered, on April 6th. Drop me an e-mail at ianjaycomics [at] gmail [dot] com if you have any questions!


A Really Important Thing You Need To Remember To Do

Be sure to tell me your address if you order a hard copy so I know where to send it!


Other Ways You Can Help

Link to this on social networking! Blog about it! Tell your "IRL" friends! Stick flyers up all over town! I can use all the help I can get right now to make this happen, so any effort on your part-- even non-monetary-- is super appreciated.

story:
About Solipsistic Pop

Solipsistic Pop is an anthology designed to spotlight the best in alternative comic art from the UK. The anthology was created by Tom Humberstone who edits and publishes the series.


It features diverse, beautiful, twisted and peculiar comics that you won’t be able to find anywhere else. Comic artists old and new are encouraged to contribute. The book provides a support structure and outlet for UK alternative comic artists.


Each book of Solipsistic Pop is a boutique, tactile product with a specific theme. A bespoke, unique artefact designed to suit the content of each edition with a limited printrun.


There are currently three volumes of Solipsistic Pop. Every copy of the book has been printed with environmentally sustainable inks and paperstock by Calverts.


  


“Solipsistic Pop continues to set the bar high for other British comics anthologies, and it seems as though this community of artists is committed to the anthology’s future success.  It’s the rare anthology where I wanted to see more work from virtually everyone included, and that sort of quality and effort reflects the commitment it took to make this such an engaging read” - The Comics Journal


“This is a carefully considered, lovingly crafted and utterly covetable compendium, a confirmation of the pleasure of comics in printed inks on quality paper stock [...] Don’t have any second thoughts about purchasing this” - Paul Gravett


“A good collection of people who seem on the verge of really hitting their stride with comics, kinda like the early Kramers Ergot books” - Jeffrey Brown


“I’m a lover of anthologies, and will be the first to admit, most of ‘em are more miss than hit. This puppy is almost all hit” - Top Shelf


“It’s sumptuous, beautiful, stirring, optimistic stuff, an anthology to move the British self-published/small press scene into the next decade” - Forbidden Planet International




Book Four

Solipsistic Pop returns this November with Book Four: Maps – featuring, as always, the finest new and established comic artists based in the UK.


Book Four will be the largest and most ambitious volume yet – with 80 pages, 30 artists, a larger print-run of 1,000, and extensive interactive material that makes full use of the joy of the printed artefact.


This will be the first volume of Solipsistic Pop to come with an ISBN to allow schools, libraries, colleges and bookstores to order copies.


There will be a book launch in London in early November featuring live bands and performances, with a wider launch taking place at Leeds Thought Bubble later that month. Additionally, an exhibition of original artwork from the book will begin in December.


Each copy ordered online will receive the book in a specially designed envelope in keeping with the Maps theme.


A large folder designed by John Miers will house the book and additional elements - including a series of postcards that have been specially printed to encourage the reader to travel with their comics. Glow in the dark printing and seeded papers will be used along with state-of-the-art screenprinting techniques.


A wraparound book cover by Stephen Collins will be protected by a large A2 poster/dustjacket designed by Katie Green.


Featured artists: Takayo Akiyama / Kristyna Baczynski / Dan Berry / Joe Blann / Stephen Collins / Paul Harrison Davis / Joe Decie / John Cei Douglas / Oliver East / Nick Edwards / Marc Ellerby / Paul Francis, Katie Green / Isabel Greenberg / Howard Hardiman / Ste Hitchen / Tom Humberstone / Joe List / Lizz Lunney / John Miers / Kathryn Newman / Luke Pearson / Philippa Rice / Jenny Robins / Edward Ross / Alison Sampson / Anna Saunders / Matthew Sheret



What We Need

Due to the more ambitious nature of the fourth volume of Solipsistic Pop, we need help meeting the printing cost of the book and securing the collateral to establish a larger distribution model to the previous three volumes.


The funding target is just over £5,000 which would go a long way to meeting the printing costs and allow for a more sustainable business model for future editions of the book.



What You Get

Depending on your ability to contribute and invest in Solipsistic Pop, there are several exciting incentives available - from signed, exclusive postcards and badges to pre-ordered copies of Solipsistic Pop 4, free tickets to launch events, digital downloads, original artwork, limited edition prints, a credit in the book and even extremely rare printing plates.


Every little helps and whatever you can spare to help support us will be greatly appreciated. Everyone who donates will receive regular updates about Solipsistic Pop 4's progress before anyone else and will be invited to future Solipsistic Pop events throughout 2012.


UPDATE: Now SP4 is at the printers, the later IndieGoGo perk incentive of having a credit in the book cannot be honoured. Additional original artwork and early print proofs will be shipped instead.

story:
Reality Not Included is a comic anthology that shows the talents of the illustrators and animators from Brigham Young University. This is not a college-backed project, just a big group of friends and colleagues who wanted to get together and show what we can do as artists and story-tellers. Our motley little crew ranges from college students just getting their feet wet to professional artists who work in prestigious studios in the animation industry. Our participants specialize in different fields such as concept art, illustration, character animation, and storyboarding. Each artist creates their own comic or illustration thus bringing their own unique styles and abilities to the book.

 

        Our goal is to raise at least $4,000 to print extra books along with additional materials to sell at Dragon Con in Altanta, Georgia. All funds go to printing and binding the books, posters, transportation of our materials to Atlanta, and to printing and shipping all incentives to our donors. We already have many books printed, but we need to print a lot more for the convention.

        More importantly, your donations help our artists with their careers. Conventions like Dragon Con are fantastic opportunities for us to network and publicize our work. The entertainment industry is rapidly getting more and more competitive, making it harder for us to find work after college. We created this book with the idea of giving our arists an opportunity to get their feet in the door.

        


       We are very lucky to have such a talented, dedicated group that can produce top quality work. Our artists are either BYU students or BYU alumni. Our training comes from our faculty, from our favorite comics and movies, from each other, and, for some of us, international art academies. We are also including special guest artist, Matt Armstrong from Disney Interactive in our anthology. Here are samples of artwork you will find in the book, along with links to the artist's blogs:


 

 

       

       We have posted all incentives to the right in the perks. What you get depends on the amount you choose to donate. We have all sorts of exciting perks for you that range from posters, to books, to even a piece of artwork from one of the artists!

 


       

 

       Shipping to locations in the United States are covered. We will include tracking information for all orders shipped internationally. All international donors must pay the following shipping costs:

North America:  $10

Western Europe* and Australia: $15

All other countries and continents: $20

      To pay for international shipping, you must add the fee manually by adding the necessary amount to your pledge.

*United Kingdom, France, Spain, Portugal, Denmark, Italy, Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg, Norway, Finland, Sweden,Germany, Switzerland, Austria and Ireland.

 

      It's simple! Select one of the perks on the right side of the screen. They're the grey buttons lined up top to bottom. Click on the amount you wish to donate or which package you want, and that's that! Remember that you are not charged for your donation until the campaign is finished.

       Social Media plays a huge role in the success of our campaign. Take the link to our campaign, and post it on your facebook, tumblr or twitter account to spread the word. You can also forward the link to your friends via email.

 

        Don't be ashamed if you can only donate pocket change. Every little bit counts and gets us closer to our goal.

 

Thank you so much for taking a look at our campaign. We look forward to working with you, and maybe even running into you at Dragon Con!!!

story:
Welcome to the ZIRKUS!

2 clowns, 15 million dollars, 500 km to the border and only 1 deranged Ringmaster, 32 desert bandits, an ancient robot, a creepy old nuclear test ground, a broken fuel tank aaaand possibly an escaped lion between them and the good life! 

This'll be a 44 page full colour epic comic book caper with enough madcap thrills to keep even Chuck Norris entertained! This is for anyone that enjoys their comics with a side serving of surreal awesomeness (think Ghibli crossed Adventure Time via Tim burton and Goonies with a bit of Scooby Doo thrown in for good measure!) 

Perks

Perks, I got perks y'all and they are extremely super awesomely perky perks at that.  I got comics, I got prints, I got buttons and postcards, art comissions too plus you can even be in the comic if you're feeling brave!

The Mystery Box

Whats in the box, who knows...well I do but I'm not telling...but 5 people will find out! Every person that pledges to see the Zirkus  made will have their names thrown in a hat every ten days (an actual top hat btw!)  and 5 of you (oh please let there be 5 of you!) will be rewarded with one of these super secret mystery boxes as well as the regular perks, the earlier you pledge the more chances you get to be drawn. Trust me you'll like the surprise. 

UPDATE 1st box claimed by Mr Dan Turner. 4 LEFT!!! 

The Impact

Its gonna be huge, think Bill and Teds Bogus Journey world peace "Rock and Roll to ya" huge, so huge that it may even cause the Earths axis to invert and finally cats and dogs will live in harmony...ok maybe I won't  solve the worlds problems with a comic (not even the almighty Generalisimo has done that ) but it will leave the world that little bit smilier I hope :)

Why do I need ya dough?

You want a kickass comic? You gotsta pay dude! Because to make an awesome product and get it out to you there's always gonna be monies involved (though I still dream for a day when the world revolves around chocolate coins and Lego!) 

Risks & Challenges

Like all creative endeavours these things take time, sometimes a little longer than anticipated but if that happens it'll be with the promise that it'll be the best damn product that I can deliver! Aside from this, the main risk is reading the comic may result in utter confusion and possibly not help with that fear of clowns (though they aren't all bad...our main two are just a little... misguided!)  
If Zirkus doesn't make the full goal those who pledged will still get what ya paid for only it may take a little longer.

Other Ways You Can Help

Get yo ass to Mars!!!!
If you can and still get twitter, facebook and a good wifi signal up there you should definitely go to and shout it from the mountains. Let's take this galactic. 
Love you all lots, it's gonna be a sweet ride. Now fly you fools! 
Lee F-W
