story: 3

About the Project

"TITANS" is a 2012 mythological/fantasy-action comic book written and created by new indie comic writer Johnny Mack. The project was previously named Battle for the Throne before being officially named TITANS and is a re-imagining and “re-mixing” of stories from Greek, Norse and Egyptian mythologies to tell the overall story of the impending retirement of God and the ensuing battle over who will become the next “Supreme” ruler.

Our Goal...is to print the first run of issue one of TITANS “In the Beginning” and premier it at the 2012 Indianapolis, Gen Con conventions. Comic books are expensive to produce and with this in mind we are turning to kind supporters such as you in an effort to raise 4,000 to get this project off the ground. Funds raised here on our Indiegogo site will cover cost such as;

  • Paying Creative Talent (Artist, Inkers, Etc.)
  • Print & Promotion Cost
  • Swag Items for Con
  • Additional Production Cost
  • Table and Signs at Con
  • Hotel and Travel for Artist and Colorist to come to Indy to Promote Project
  • Any additional Con or Production Expenses

The 4,000 amount is the balance that remains needed from our 6,000 budget. We were able to come out of pocket and successfully raise a total of 2,000 of that; however, we are unable to continue to come pocket which is why we are asking YOU the people of Indiegogo to make this possible. Without your support, this project will take longer to get off the ground and may even fold…so we are counting on you and your donations.

In return for your kind donations we are offering a host of rewards...our way of saying "Thank You" for supporting out project. These rewards include:

  • Signed Copies of Comic
  • T-Shirts
  • Buttons
  • Alternate Covers
  • Character Trading Cards
  • Becoming a Character in the Comic
  • And Much More!!!

If we exceed our goal we will put the extra funds into packaging & shipping of rewards to you guys, printing more copies of issue one and towards the production of issues 2-12 that we can take with us to other cons….as well as additional or *BONUS* rewards. However, if we don’t meet our goal the project will become more difficult to accomplish as shipping & other cost will have to come out of our pocket and will mean us not being able to bring this new and exciting comic to you.

Got a Question or a Comment?

Email us at: Undergroundcomix@gmail.com, we are always happy to chat with people interested with the project.

Other Ways You Can Help

Show us some love and spread the word about this project to others. You continued support in this project is what will help us make our goal. Check out our blog and Facebook pages under the "Also Find this Campaign" section at the bottom of the page! Make sure to check back for art added to our gallery and updates on the status of the project!!!

Thank You So Very Much!!!
story_txt:
About the Project
"TITANS" is a 2012 mythological/fantasy-action comic book written and created by new indie comic writer Johnny Mack. The project was previously named Battle for the Throne before being officially named TITANS and is a re-imagining and “re-mixing” of stories from Greek, Norse and Egyptian mythologies to tell the overall story of the impending retirement of God and the ensuing battle over who will become the next “Supreme” ruler.
Our Goal...is to print the first run of issue one of TITANS “In the Beginning” and premier it at the 2012 Indianapolis, Gen Con conventions. Comic books are expensive to produce and with this in mind we are turning to kind supporters such as you in an effort to raise 4,000 to get this project off the ground. Funds raised here on our Indiegogo site will cover cost such as;

Paying Creative Talent (Artist, Inkers, Etc.)
Print & Promotion Cost
Swag Items for Con
Additional Production Cost
Table and Signs at Con
Hotel and Travel for Artist and Colorist to come to Indy to Promote Project
Any additional Con or Production Expenses
The 4,000 amount is the balance that remains needed from our 6,000 budget. We were able to come out of pocket and successfully raise a total of 2,000 of that; however, we are unable to continue to come pocket which is why we are asking YOU the people of Indiegogo to make this possible. Without your support, this project will take longer to get off the ground and may even fold…so we are counting on you and your donations.
In return for your kind donations we are offering a host of rewards...our way of saying "Thank You" for supporting out project. These rewards include:

Signed Copies of Comic
T-Shirts
Buttons
Alternate Covers
Character Trading Cards
Becoming a Character in the Comic
And Much More!!!
If we exceed our goal we will put the extra funds into packaging & shipping of rewards to you guys, printing more copies of issue one and towards the production of issues 2-12 that we can take with us to other cons….as well as additional or *BONUS* rewards. However, if we don’t meet our goal the project will become more difficult to accomplish as shipping & other cost will have to come out of our pocket and will mean us not being able to bring this new and exciting comic to you.
Got a Question or a Comment?
Email us at: Undergroundcomix@gmail.com, we are always happy to chat with people interested with the project. 
Other Ways You Can Help
Show us some love and spread the word about this project to others. You continued support in this project is what will help us make our goal. Check out our blog and Facebook pages under the "Also Find this Campaign" section at the bottom of the page! Make sure to check back for art added to our gallery and updates on the status of the project!!!
Thank You So Very Much!!!

story:
Stretch Goals!!

Thank you so much to everyone who contributed to help Ferrin Tale reach its minimum $1000 goal! We couldn't have done it without you! But now we need to talk stretch goals! Where do we go from here? What can we do to make Ferrin Tale even better? That's a good question! So let's get started.

$1,250 - Upgraded Forums

If we reach this stretch goal, we can invest in better forum software to meet Ferrin Tale's role playing needs, which is the biggest part of Ferrin Tale!

$1,500 - Ferrin Database

If this stretch goal is met, we will add a Ferrin Database where everyone can create a profile for their Ferrin Tale characters!

$2,000 - Full Prologue

If by some miracle we achieve this goal, Ferrin Tale's FULL prologue (lots of backstory!!) will be released on day one! It will take some time to complete this goal however and will push Ferrin Tale's launch a bit further away, but that's okay! The role playing community will still be open!

$2,100 - Species Variety!!!

If this final goal is unlocked, I will be releasing 3 NEW playable races at launch! Nabbi, Hra'es, and Wyvr!

About The Artist & Comic

Hello, I'm Demu - an aspiring artist. I've had a deep passion for art since I was a child. I would always find myself sketching or drawing little make-believe things in my room or sometimes in the classroom - much to the dismay of my teachers. I've always had a firm grip on the fictional worlds in my head. For the past several years, I've supported myself through art and art alone. I've had people telling me to "get a real job," but I've always stuck to my own path, despite any difficulties that have arisen. Which brings me to the point of this fundraiser.

First off, I should mention that this comic is based around critters named Ferrin. They're an anthropomorphic species I've been developing for the past several years. I love drawing animals, critters, and the like. Especially fictional species.

Ferrin Tale will consist of a main story comic (the one I draw) and a role playing community where members will participate in missions where they can interact with other members and their ferrin characters.

I've had a world in my head for years, but due to commission work I haven't had the chance to draw things for myself. I'd love to be able to create for myself and entertain others at the same time. I would love to support myself entirely through this comic. So that's the point of this Indiegogo.

By contributing, you'll be helping me achieve my goal of developing and displaying my worlds for all to see. Supporting me by justifying the time spent on this project, and most importantly of all: being creatively and financially stable.

What I Need & What You Get

I am requesting $1,000 to cover domain registration, web hosting for three years, and money to justify the time spent on this project to keep a roof over my head and food in the fridge for a little bit while I get this project off the ground.

If I do not reach my goal, I will be using all funds toward future web hosting and other maintenance costs. If I reach MORE than my goal I'll be thinking of more ways to thank all of you guys in really big ways.

By contributing you will receive various gifts in return, such as:

- Free ferrin tags. Tags are your free pass into the role playing community. Different tags receive different benefits, such as receiving more mission requests and such.

- Gift art. For high tier donations I will thank you in the form of art! I can't offer much as there might be lots of people contributing and I don't want to overwhelm myself.

- Cameos in the main story.

- A ferrin character designed for you!

- Designing a permanent character that will have their own part in the story.

Other Ways You Can Help

I would love to get the word out about this campaign. So please, share this around FurAffinity, Twitter, Tumblr, and wherever else you can! I want my world to come to life so much, and I can't do that without your help. Use the Indiegogo share buttons to get the word out!

Thank you so much for reading this far. And I hope you consider contributing! To put it very simply; if I don't receive enough funding, Ferrin Tale will never happen.

story:
Founded in 1974, Mee-Ow is Northwestern University's premiere short-form comedy group combining sketch, improv, and rock n' roll. A great number of Mee-Ow alumni have gone to perform and teach improv at many of the country's top improv venues. 

 

        This campaign is a fundraising effort in the hopes of being able to put on many more shows in the years to come. The funds you donate will go directly back into the Mee-Ow improv group to help keep the troupe alive and thriving both on, and off, Northwestern campus. 

 

 

The $1,000 that we hope to raise for this show is the number that Mee-Ow has calculated as being the amount of money that has gone into the materials, space, and time dedicated to this February show. 

 

 

Along with your donation, there are certain perks that you can receive with a specific donation. They range from having your name in the Mee-Ow playbill for the February 2013 show as a "Special Thanks" (please note that unless you donate before February 19th your name will simply be added to the playbill for the next Mee-Ow show), to a signed Mee-Ow poster, and even a signed DVD of the show itself. 

 

Please donate whatever money you can in order to help Mee-Ow continue to be a thriving and inspiring group on the Northwestern campus!

Please donate whatever money you can in order to help Mee-Ow continue to be a thriving and inspiring group on the Northwestern campus!

story:
TRIP needs you!

TRIP Comix is a small, alternative publisher interested in visionary, psychedelic, poetic and artistic graphic novels. Our goal is to support and promote unparalleled work that might not otherwise be published because it's deemed too risky.

We are raising money to publish 4 amazing books. Currently, Stan and Marc, the founding publishers, finance these books out of their own pockets (which are not that deep!) With the money raised here, we aim to appropriately compensate the artists and print larger runs for wider distribution which finally, will allow us to meet the criteria for grants and grow as a publisher. Please help us finance TRIP Comix!

Welcome to TRIPLAND!

TRIP a besoin de votre aide!

Éditions TRIP est un petit éditeur du Québec qui publie depuis 6 ans des bandes dessinées psychédéliques, poétiques et artistiques. Notre objectif est d'encourager des artistes ayant une vision originale et différente.

TRIP veut grandir afin de publier nos bandes dessinées à la grandeur du Québec, du Canada et du monde! On vous propose comme sociofinancement d’appuyer TRIP en commandant, selon vos moyens, nos 4 nouveaux livres ainsi que des sérigraphies, dessins et planches originales. Aidez nous à financer Éditions TRIP!

Bienvenue à TRIPLAND!

We are offering 4 truly amazing graphic novels,
2 in French and 2 in English (with french subtitles)

Nous offrons 4 fantastiques romans graphiques,
2 en français et 2 en anglais (avec sous-titres en français).

In french only, 128 pages in black and white.

Gut wrenching and powerful, here is an avant-garde creation which breaks with the traditional narrative of history. Here is a tale that each will read and recognize, entering the rich cultural universe of these great movers of Canadian history that were, and are. the First Nations.

  - Excerpt form the introduction by historian Denys Delâge.

Louis Rémillard has been active on the Quebec comics scene since the early eighties. He has spent 5 years researching and drawing this book, an amazing true tale from a history that we barely know. Probably the best graphic novel ever done on the subject of First Nations and how they lived.

En français, 128 pages, noir et blanc.

Percutant et d’une exceptionnelle force évocatrice, voilà une œuvre avant-gardiste qui rompt avec le narratif de l’histoire traditionnelle. Voilà un récit que tout un chacun lira pour s’y reconnaître et pour entrer dans le riche univers culturel de ces grands acteurs de l’histoire que furent et que sont les Premières Nations.
 - Extrait de la préface de l’historien Denys Delâge.

Louis Rémillard dessine et publie de la bande dessinée au Québec depuis les années 80. Après 5 ans de recherches et de travail, il nous présente son plus beau récit. Probablement le meilleur roman graphique sur le thème des premières nations, révélant des aspects inédits de ces peuples qui résonnent encore aujourd'hui avec notre sensibilité contemporaine. Un livre exceptionnel!

In french only, black and white, 96 pages.

New York, early nineties; drugs are becoming a big problem and all sorts of criminal activities are afflicting the city. Using the ensuing chaos as a cover, Joel Rifkin becomes the most prolific serial killer ever known to the city of New York. Within 4 years, he murdered seventeen prostitutes. Skip Jensen first discovered this story while looking into the singer of a punk group that he loved. He discovered  that Joel Rifkin shared the same musical interest. There began an investigation through the dark alleys of New York into the notorious life of Joel Rifkin.

Skip Jensen is a respected musician with four albums to his credit. His first graphic novel Lachine Beach chronicled his youth in Lachine, a suburb of Montreal, in the late seventies and early eighties. With a simple drawing style, Jensen tells affecting stories, writing like a professional journalist, masterfully mixing facts with emotions.

En français, noir et blanc, 96 pages.

New York, début des années 1990. La drogue fait des ravages et des activités criminelles de toutes sortes affligent la Grosse Pomme. Profitant du chaos ambiant, Joel Rifkin devient le tueur le plus prolifique que cet état ait jamais connu. En l’espace de quatre ans, il assassine dix-sept femmes s’adonnant à la prostitution.

C’est en découvrant un lien entre le chanteur d’un groupe punk et le tueur en série que Skip Jensen en est venu à raconter l'histoire de Joel Rifkin. Suivez la fascinante enquête de l’auteur dans les rues sombres du New York de cette époque.

Lachine Beach son premier livre documentait, avec émotion et une grande justesse, son enfance ainsi que l'histoire de la ville de Lachine.



In English with French translations (bilingual).

80 pages, colour and black and white.

Winner of the Independent Bédélys award, in Québec in 2012, Traumstadtdenken 1 was also selected to be part of the prestigious Collection of Independent Comics at the Library of Congress, in Washington. Bottenberg received another Bédélys nomination, in 2015, for Circulus. In Traumstadtdenken 2, his usual mastery of the the black and white format will be intensified with the addition of psychedelic, colorful pages. Featuring his usual deft mix of comics and illustrations.

Rupert Bottenberg is a founding member of the Montreal comics scene and Co-Director of EN MASSE. His comics always showcase a striking mix of narratives and illustrations full of imagination.

Bilingue, 80 pages, couleur et en noir et blanc.

Gagnant en 2012 du Bédélys Indépendant au Québec pour Traumstadtdenken 1.  Ce livre fut sélectionné en 2013 pour faire partie de la prestigieuse collection de BD indépendantes de la bibliothèque du Congrès à Washington. Bottenberg qui reçu une autre nomination au prix Bédélys en 2015 pour Circulus, revient en force avec un Traumstadtdenken 2 encore plus enchanteur et ludique, mélange de bandes dessinées et de dessins (et cette fois-ci, avec des pages en couleur!).

Rupert Bottenberg est un le co-directeur de EN MASSE. Il a été journaliste au MIRROR et est l'un des membres fondateurs  de la Montreal comic scene.

English with french subtitles (bilingual), 68 pages, black and white.

In AGALMA, his masterful, debut graphic novel, Stanley Wany explored the Anima, the feminine side of creation. For Sequences, he explores the flip side, the Animus; a graphic novel featuring men lost in a mythological forest.

Pushing the limits of the comics language, Wany chronicles the clash between the world of dreams and reality as the forces of life and death battle it out inside one man's mind.

Stanley Wany has a BA in comics and is the co-creator of Éditions TRIP.
AGALMA has been nominated for the 2016 Pigskin Peters Award.


Bilingue (anglais avec sous-titre en français), noir et blanc, 68 pages.

Après AGALMA, Stanley Wany continue d’explorer les limites du langage narratif en replongeant dans l’inconscient collectif pour créer un récit au dessin exceptionnel où les personnages de Séquences chevauchent à la fois le monde réel et un univers mythologiques où vont s’affronter les forces de la mort et de la vie.

AGALMA est en nomination pour le 2016 Pigskin Peters Award.

story:
The Bible tells of a coming period of great turmoil, referred to by many as the End of Days. 

​ The soon to be world leader known as the anti-christ is on a mission to bring forth the last days, before the appointed time. Under a platform of world peace, he uses his position in the United Nations to assemble a team of Super powered warriors to help him achieve his true goal, the destruction of mankind.

God calls a young man named Hector (aka Grok)  to find the Apostle John, who has never died, and is being held captive at the Vatican. 

Together they will assemble the greatest Superhero force the world has ever seen.  

​They are   THE TRIBULATION FORCE!
story_txt:
The Bible tells of a coming period of great turmoil, referred to by many as the End of Days. 
​ The soon to be world leader known as the anti-christ is on a mission to bring forth the last days, before the appointed time. Under a platform of world peace, he uses his position in the United Nations to assemble a team of Super powered warriors to help him achieve his true goal, the destruction of mankind.
God calls a young man named Hector (aka Grok)  to find the Apostle John, who has never died, and is being held captive at the Vatican. 
Together they will assemble the greatest Superhero force the world has ever seen.  
​They are   THE TRIBULATION FORCE!

story:
BECHDEL TEST FEST Saturday February 6th at Neighborhood House 

UPDATE  Hey! We are emailing all of you right now according to the perks you picked, looking forward to seeing everyone at the festival on Saturday!!

The funny women of Philadelphia created a community online and eventually there were so many of us that we said "Hey! We should celebrate this!".  

We need your help to make this thing happen!  Can you help us?  How much did that latte cost?  $5?  Skip a latte for one day and help us out!

What We Need & What You Get

Here is the breakdown:

  • We need to raise $2,000 to pay for space, tech, merchandise and marketing
  • Every donation gets a prize from a ticket to merch to a stage shout out and more
  • We will use every dollar to make this festival happen AND to support services for women in the city.  If we do not hit our goal we will sell our blood and eggs. We have Career Wardrobe as one of our beneficiaries, with other talks that will be finalized soon. 

Why is this so important?

Women make up more than half of the population and yet are seen on less than 25% of stages from film to theater to music.   The arts in Philadelphia is a strong scene with a vocal community.  Gender equality is not just a fancy phrase to post on Facebook but it is a real position in which you can affect change with your actions.  This is one of those actions.  

YES, AND us...please and thank you.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Let people know about this.   Friends and family and friends that are also in your family.
  • We will need volunteers. Email us at bechdelfest@gmail.com if you're interested in getting involved!
story_txt:
BECHDEL TEST FEST Saturday February 6th at Neighborhood House 
UPDATE  Hey! We are emailing all of you right now according to the perks you picked, looking forward to seeing everyone at the festival on Saturday!! The funny women of Philadelphia created a community online and eventually there were so many of us that we said "Hey! We should celebrate this!".  
We need your help to make this thing happen!  Can you help us?  How much did that latte cost?  $5?  Skip a latte for one day and help us out!   What We Need & What You Get Here is the breakdown:  We need to raise $2,000 to pay for space, tech, merchandise and marketing Every donation gets a prize from a ticket to merch to a stage shout out and more We will use every dollar to make this festival happen AND to support services for women in the city.  If we do not hit our goal we will sell our blood and eggs. We have Career Wardrobe as one of our beneficiaries, with other talks that will be finalized soon.     Why is this so important? Women make up more than half of the population and yet are seen on less than 25% of stages from film to theater to music.   The arts in Philadelphia is a strong scene with a vocal community.  Gender equality is not just a fancy phrase to post on Facebook but it is a real position in which you can affect change with your actions.  This is one of those actions.  
YES, AND us...please and thank you.

story:
Return with us to the wildly colorful world of PINK LEMONADE by rising star Nick Cagnetti! A story full of both fun and mystery, readers are sure to get lost in her strange, action-packed adventures!  And this issue features a four page PINK LEMONADE back-up story written by Cagnetti and illustrated by the one and only Don (MEGATON MAN) Simpson!  Three covers available: Standard cover by Nick Cagnetti, IndieGoGo exclusive cover by Nick Cagnetti, and TINTIN inspired variant cover by Rich (DRY COUNTY) Tommaso!  We are also making PINK LEMONADE #1 available here, in case you missed out on the first campaign.

STRETCH GOAL #1

If we hit $2000, all three of the PINK LEMONADE #2 comics will be covered in thick, matte-finished card stock, so that they not only look and feel amazing, but so they also match all the covers from PINK LEMONADE #1!

 

PINK LEMONADE #2 IndieGoGo Exclusive Cover by Nick Cagnetti

(ONLY AVAILABLE HERE ON INDIEGOGO!!!)

 

PINK LEMONADE #2 Standard Cover by Nick Cagnetti

 

PINK LEMONADE #2 Variant Cover by Rich (DRY COUNTY) TOMMASO

 

PINK LEMONADE #1 Standard Cover by Nick Cagnetti

 

IT'S ALIVE! IS PROUD TO PRESENT PINK LEMONADE #2 BY NICK CAGNETTI!

Mysterious past...colorful costume...altruistic...nomadic lifestyle...the journey continues!  Pink Lemonade dreams of doing big things.  She just wants to be good and help where she can. But things don't always work out the way we plan.  In issue one, Pink Lemonade found herself in jail, after a big misunderstanding with some cops, while trying to help a child.  And just when you thought she was sunk, hotshot movie producer Zavi Xarad shows up with an offer to help. 

In this new second issue, when footage of Pink Lemonade’s splashy balloon rescue stunt on a movie set (see issue one) gets leaked internally by that same hotshot movie producer who offered to help her, the public’s interest is piqued! They think Pink Lemonade is a new character in the upcoming Ron Radical movie being filmed!  Meanwhile, while attempting to bring back the original OJ-BOT, Pink Lemonade is tricked into signing a contract to co-star in a film with Ron Radical. Later, on the set of the new film, when the director yells action, Ron begins blasting Pink Lemonade. When she refuses to fight, Barzibelly Jr. (the strange being seen in her visions back in issue one) gives her control over what happens next in the film…and I promise you don’t wanna miss what she comes up with!

Rising star Nick Cagnetti brings us back to the wildly colorful world of Pink Lemonade. A story full of both fun and mystery, readers are sure to get lost in her strange, action-packed adventures!  Don’t miss the second issue (and first, if you missed it) that Lizzy Garcia from BUT WHY THO? called "a comic series with an art style that blows most of what is on stands out of the water."

You can pick up your copies of Pink Lemonade #2 from this IndieGoGo campaign, which includes the Standard Cover, the TINTIN inspired Variant Cover by Rich (DRY COUNTY) Tommaso, and the IndieGoGo Exclusive Cover (available ONLY from this campaign)!  You can also pick up a signed Standard Cover by Nick Cagnetti, or a signed Variant Cover by Rich Tommaso!  And don't forget, you can grab the first issue as well!

AND WHEN YOU CHECK OUT, YOU WILL SEE SEVERAL ADD-ON OPTIONS THAT YOU CAN ADD TO YOUR ORDER!  THIS INCLUDES SIGNED AND UNSIGNED COPIES OF PINK LEMONADE, AND PINK LEMONADE ORIGINAL SKETCH CARDS LIKE THESE, EACH DRAWN BY PINK LEMONADE CREATOR NICK CAGNETTI...

Also, Nick Cagnetti will be making some of his gorgeous original PINK LEMONADE art available.  There will also be a handful of PINK LEMONADE pin-ups available from a group of amazing artists who believe in what Nick is doing.  All of this original art will be available as add-on rewards during the course of the campaign, and will be released one by one over the next few weeks!  Here is an example of what you can expect...

Through this campaign we hope to raise some of the funds necessary to print and ship PINK LEMONADE #2, as well as pay for the variant cover.  We are only asking for $1000, but we do have some stretch goals in mind if we go beyond the initial goal.

Thank you for your interest in PINK LEMONADE!  Please let us know if you have any questions.

And now...here are a few WIP black and white interior pages to get you excited!  Colors and letters coming soon!

 

 

And HERE is a look at some WIP panels from the PINK LEMONADE #2 back-up story entitled FREE DAY, written by Nick Cagnetti and illustrated by Don (MEGATON MAN) Simpson!  The story will be four pages long, and full color, once it's done!

----------------------------------------------

WHAT PEOPLE ARE SAYING ABOUT PINK LEMONADE

"Terrific and original like crazy" –Michael Allred (MADMAN)

"Dreamy 'bots, fun fandom examination and her bike is her best friend. Delirious insanity with danger lurking just around the corner." –John Cassaday (PLANETARY)

"Above all else, comic books are meant to be fun. PINK LEMONADE hits the mark from the start, and blasts through the entertainment strata with style I can’t help but believe would make King Jack proud." –Dan Brereton (NOCTURNALS)

"Crazy fun--has a playful look and feel of a 90's comic reminiscent of Michael Allred and Jay Stephens." –Rich Tommaso (DRY COUNTY)

“It’s unique and refreshing! I love the pure style of it all.” –Dan Fraga (THE GRAVE)

"PINK LEMONADE is pure pop art funkiness. It’s a mix of Mike Allred’s MADMAN with a healthy does of Jack Kirby and Dan Clowes thrown in for good measure." –Jamal Igle (MOLLY DANGER)

"A pop culture story that's deeply rooted in its own fictional pop culture, PINK LEMONADE #1 is as intriguing is it is bizarre. Entertaining, with solid art that is a mash up of Allred, Clowes, and animator Sally Cruikshank." –David Hahn (SIX MILLION DOLLAR MAN)

"Nick Cagnetti's PINK LEMONADE is a quirky, good-hearted comic book series. Try a taste of PINK LEMONADE. You'll find it refreshing!" –Michael T. Gilbert (MR. MONSTER)

"Pink Lemonade is a fun romp with visual nods to the coolest art books of yesteryear!" –Pop Mahn (RAVEN: DAUGHTER OF DARKNESS)

"What an endearingly goofy heroine!  I want to go to lunch with her!" –Trina Robbins (LAST GIRL STANDING)

"Nothing can prepare you for how cool and eye-popping the world of Pink Lemonade is. You'll instantly fall for the eponymous do-gooder motorcyclist who will charm her way into your heart while also injecting a healthy dose of madness into your mind." –Scott Duvall (ARMY OF DARKNESS/BUBBA HO-TEP)

"First half of the book was like 'What?' and the second half was like 'Whoa!!'  The ending had me like, where is book 2 going to take me?" –N. Steven Harris (WILDSTORM: MICHAEL CRAY)

"This is a very fun comic book! If you enjoy quirky, whimsical, and surreal comics like Mike Allred’s MADMAN, then this is for you." –Henry Chamberlain, COMICS GRINDER

"This book’s zany, upbeat, often surreal sensibilities lie somewhere between Mike Allred’s MADMAN and Ryan North and Erica Henderson’s UNBEATABLE SQUIRREL GIRL." –Dan Grote, WMQ COMICS

"Overall, Pink Lemonade #1 is a stunning start to a comic series with an art style that blows most of what is on stands out of the water." –Lizzy Garcia, BUT WHY THO?

"On the surface, this may seem like cool stuff for younger readers. I think kids will appreciate PINK LEMONADE on several levels, and I look forward to seeing her cosplayed. But Cagnetti, the writer/artist/colorist/letterer/genius/madman behind PINK LEMONADE has some things to tell us grownups, too." –Clyde Hall, DOOMROCKET

"Cagnetti’s introduction to the world of Pink Lemonade is chock-full of mystery and surrealism, and he does a great job establishing a very large, mystic universe.” –Grant DeArmitt, MONKEYS FIGHTING ROBOTS

"Nick Cagnetti’s art is so sweet in this comic. It’s like my soul has found the perfect expression in a comic that reflects it!" –Trevor Bieker, THE COMIC LOUNGE

 

 

RECENT PRESS FOR PINK LEMONADE

BLEEDING COOL: https://www.bleedingcool.com/2019/05/10/its-ali...

COMIC CRUSADERS: https://www.comiccrusaders.com/its-alive-announ...

COMICS GRINDER: https://comicsgrinder.com/2019/05/11/review-pin...

WMQ COMICS: https://wmqcomics.com/news/indie-review-pink-le...

BUT WHY THO?: https://butwhythopodcast.com/2019/06/18/heroesc...

BLEEDING COOL: https://www.bleedingcool.com/2019/06/15/exclusi...

KGW COMIC PICK OF THE WEEK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SB9CskVgAN0

DOOMROCKET: https://doomrocket.com/pink-lemonade-1-review/

REVIEW FIX: https://reviewfix.com/2019/08/review-fix-exclus...

THE COMIC LOUNGE: https://www.thecomiclounge.com/single-post/2019...

MONKEYS FIGHTING ROBOTS: https://monkeysfightingrobots.co/review-its-ali...

 

----------------------------------------------

ABOUT NICK CAGNETTI

Nick Cagnetti is 24 years old, he's been drawing forever but he first started making comics with his friends in 2012. Among the works produced were two series: Infinite Wonders, and The Spirit of The Shadows. Alongside storyboard work and other art gigs, Nick has been making Pink Lemonade comic strips and short stories on his own since 2016. In 2019, he set out to tell larger stories with Pink Lemonade's own comic book series which brings us to today.

 

ABOUT IT'S ALIVE!

IT'S ALIVE! is the brainchild of multiple Eisner Award nominee Drew Ford, publishing out of print comics, English translations of foreign material, original projects (like PINK LEMONADE!), and other unique collectibles.

story:
By request, Machi is now available on IndieGoGo!

It's been a long time coming and I am very excited to share the tale of Machi The Lazy Witch with you! 

These are the first two issues of a 12+ issue series, telling the story of a young witch who has been thrown headfirst into college life, fresh out of high school.

With her first day approaching, there is no turning back now! Not with those student loans looming over her head... 

It all starts with a nervous ride through the sky. The destination? None other than the Pendelton Art Institute for Gifted Witches. An art-based college dedicated to producing only the most exceptional graduates. Unfortunately for Machi (our main character), exceptional isn't a word often used to describe her. 

In a pressured decision to satisfy her family, Machi now finds herself swimming upstream in the competitive world of magical art. With her talented older sister to guide her through her first year, Machi must step out of her comfort zone and stand out in her classes. But will she stand out for the right reasons? Can she survive the 4 years until graduation? 

Machi will turn her dreams into actions by doing her very best to improve her magic skills! She will have her ups, her downs, her accidental enemies and her unlikely friends. From Re-Animating golems to finding the perfect familiar, Machi and her friends are in for one bumpy ride! 

Issue one gives you a taste of the college campus and colorful character cast. 

Issue two jumps into the exciting academic life that Machi and her friends will sacrifice long nights to, as well as introduce you to the cute and creepy familiars available to students. 

Each Issue will be a total of 32 full-color pages!

It's 64 pages in full color, and this is only the very beginning!

 

 

Collectible Character cards!

Every tier after Friendly Familiar will receive several surprise character cards. These cards are exclusive to Indiegogo backers only! There are 10 normal cards and 2 specialty cards to collect.

Each tier will have the chance to receive a special card! 

Cards are standard poker deck size with full color on the front and back. 

 

Cozy up with a cute Machi mug! 

Surprise character Icons for ALL backers!

In addition to the surprise character cards, each backer will receive a surprise character icon! Each backer has a 1/4 chance of getting a specific character. Icons made by the amazing Paetyn Monroe! 

How will your money be spent?

Printing books is the most expensive part of this process, fortunately, I am now partnered with Wikid Publishing. This streamlines the fund distribution. In addition to that the comic printing, funds will also be allocated to; the character cards, CGC submissions, poster prints, mugs, and stickers. Not to mention the 5% that IndieGoGo takes.

 

Any additional funds will go towards future issues of Machi The Lazy Witch! Issues 3 and 4 are currently in the works! These issues will include some exciting character cameos!

As for the timeline, I've estimated all of the physical rewards should be in your mailboxes by February of next year.

Issue 1 is complete and is currently printing, issue 2 is close behind! 

I've been working very hard the last few years on this series, it wasn't until this year that I decided to drop everything and put my absolute soul into this and get Machi ready for her debut. The Kickstarter was a big success, but I received large amounts of requests from individuals who wanted to see Machi come over to IndieGogo. I want to make everyone happy, so I have whipped up a ton of exclusive exciting rewards! There is even a tier for individuals who would just like the extra goodies! 

 I'm so excited to be able to share Machi with you all!

 

 

Why Back Machi The Lazy Witch?

 

Machi is a slice of fantasy life that aims to shine a light on mental health in a softer tone. 

Machi illustrates the effects of anxiety and depression through many different lenses, in hopes of inspiring others who may be struggling, showing that no matter what the voice in your head is screaming, you can and will succeed. Mental health is something I care a lot about, and I hope that by sharing Machi's story, at least one person may not feel so alone. 

Machi is family-friendly and made for all ages!

 

 

Special Thanks To:

Sedric Harris- For Editing both issues of Machi The Lazy Witch

Stacey Rivera- For translating both issues of Machi The Lazy Witch

Shishishiena- For Voicing Machi!

Paetyn Monroe- For animating the "thank you" ending and helping me with the running animation.

Kyle Scott- For composing the wonderful song in the video! 

Brian Ball- For inspiring me!

Eric Diaz- For putting up with my late nights of drawing and supporting me all the way.

Red Valkyrie- For inspiring me to go Indiegogo and for your amazing support! 

 

Risks and challenges

 

Now that I am partnered with the amazing team at Wikid Publishing, many of the issues regarding printing have been negated. The team is local to my state and has a fantastic track record of producing high-quality comic prints. Issue 1 of the comic is already complete, and issue 2 is on track to be completed on time as well. The only risks I can foresee revolve around the mugs, I have ordered a bunch of packing supplies to protect them during shipping, so they might be a bit heavy in the boxes, making shipping a little higher. 

If any challenges should arise, I'll be posting an update and letting everyone know as soon as possible, and letting you know what my plans are moving forward to avoid from happening again.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you've made it this far, thank you so much for reading! This project means the absolute world to me and I hope it can bring joy to you as well!

If this project isn't your cup of tea, that's okay! But if you think someone else may enjoy it, it would mean the world to me if you would share the word!

How will your money be spent?
Printing books is the most expensive part of this process, fortunately, I am now partnered with Wikid Publishing. This streamlines the fund distribution. In addition to that the comic printing, funds will also be allocated to; the character cards, CGC submissions, poster prints, mugs, and stickers. Not to mention the 5% that IndieGoGo takes.

 

Any additional funds will go towards future issues of Machi The Lazy Witch! Issues 3 and 4 are currently in the works! These issues will include some exciting character cameos!
As for the timeline, I've estimated all of the physical rewards should be in your mailboxes by February of next year.
Issue 1 is complete and is currently printing, issue 2 is close behind! 
I've been working very hard the last few years on this series, it wasn't until this year that I decided to drop everything and put my absolute soul into this and get Machi ready for her debut. The Kickstarter was a big success, but I received large amounts of requests from individuals who wanted to see Machi come over to IndieGogo. I want to make everyone happy, so I have whipped up a ton of exclusive exciting rewards! There is even a tier for individuals who would just like the extra goodies! 
 I'm so excited to be able to share Machi with you all!
 

 

Why Back Machi The Lazy Witch?
 
Machi is a slice of fantasy life that aims to shine a light on mental health in a softer tone. 
Machi illustrates the effects of anxiety and depression through many different lenses, in hopes of inspiring others who may be struggling, showing that no matter what the voice in your head is screaming, you can and will succeed. Mental health is something I care a lot about, and I hope that by sharing Machi's story, at least one person may not feel so alone. 
Machi is family-friendly and made for all ages!
 

 
Special Thanks To:
Sedric Harris- For Editing both issues of Machi The Lazy Witch
Stacey Rivera- For translating both issues of Machi The Lazy Witch
Shishishiena- For Voicing Machi!
Paetyn Monroe- For animating the "thank you" ending and helping me with the running animation.
Kyle Scott- For composing the wonderful song in the video! 
Brian Ball- For inspiring me!
Eric Diaz- For putting up with my late nights of drawing and supporting me all the way.
Red Valkyrie- For inspiring me to go Indiegogo and for your amazing support! 
 
Risks and challenges
 
Now that I am partnered with the amazing team at Wikid Publishing, many of the issues regarding printing have been negated. The team is local to my state and has a fantastic track record of producing high-quality comic prints. Issue 1 of the comic is already complete, and issue 2 is on track to be completed on time as well. The only risks I can foresee revolve around the mugs, I have ordered a bunch of packing supplies to protect them during shipping, so they might be a bit heavy in the boxes, making shipping a little higher. 
If any challenges should arise, I'll be posting an update and letting everyone know as soon as possible, and letting you know what my plans are moving forward to avoid from happening again.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you've made it this far, thank you so much for reading! This project means the absolute world to me and I hope it can bring joy to you as well!
If this project isn't your cup of tea, that's okay! But if you think someone else may enjoy it, it would mean the world to me if you would share the word!

story:
What is Column: Vol. 1?

Column Vol. 1 is an action packed, full color, 6.5x10.25in (standard western comic size), 90+ page, manga-esque graphic novel. Fun characters, cute artwork and explosions.

Column: Volume 1 is already completed and simply awaiting printing. This is your chance to get an EXCLUSIVE private edition variant of our first installment in a series of brand new graphic novels! (If you want to skip the description and just jump to a free digital version of the product, click here!)

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise enough money for a limited print run of Column: Vol. 1 before it is released via a different publisher in 2019. We also would like to offer the chance to pick up a few exclusive variants of our character propaganda posters.

It's the most fun you'll have with a comic this year!

Column: Vol. 1 Overview

Column's story follows the crew of the Helcat, a US Army M1A2 Abrams main battle tank, in their adventure across the world fighting the Meta-National Transitory Pact. It is a lighthearted combat series with plenty of comedy and loads of action! As you may have guessed, it's World War 3, but with a bit of a twist. And no, it's not zombies...

The Metas have developed a top secret technology only known as "The Disruptor". It's unknown how this weapon works, but it's effects are felt across the globe. Advanced GPS, satellite guided weapons, long range radar and radios --- all rendered useless, the Disruptor interfering with all forms of over-the-air signals. 

Without the massive advantage of automated weapons like UAVs and long range technologies like GPS-guided cruise missiles, the US and her allies were at an extreme disadvantage once war broke out. In 2026, the Metas made landfall in North America and the war seemed to be going their direction for 3 years. But the tide is turning...

This is where our story picks up. It's 2029 and the Allies are on the counter-attack. The men and women of the Army's 10th Special Missions Unit have been assigned the harrowing task of tracking down the Disruptor Device on land and eliminating it at all costs.

Jack and Hatch are two civilian volunteers of the Civil Defense Corps. The war has come to them. Will they survive their unexpected combat tour? How will they fare fighting alongside the Ladies of the 2nd Platoon of the 10th SMU? Guess you'll have to read to find out!

Risks & Challenges

This funding is only for the printing of the exclusive Column: Vol. 1 variant and the exclusive posters. The rest of the project is already created and paid for.

This is a LOW RISK crowdfunding campaign. Unlike other campaigns, we have removed all obstacles to you getting what you ordered and quickly. Kraken Print will be handling both the printing and fulfillment, meaning you won't have to rely on an indie creator in their living room trying to wrap and ship a large volume of orders, having never done it before.


Meet the Characters! And HEAR THEM!

As part of the Column project, we went out of our way to create original character audio logs and introductions voiced by professional veterans of the anime dubbing industry. Check out our YouTube and enjoy our immersive character vignettes.

There is also an entire audio playlist dedicated to Volume 1. It includes character logs and original music. This is also available for FREE on our YouTube channel. Take a listen and fall in love with our colorful cast!

Want More?

Contact us on here or on Twitter (@RawBlinkProd) and feel free to ask any questions as well as enjoy some of our latest artwork and colorful exclusives!

story:
!STRETCH GOALS INCOMING!

IF WE PASS...$6,000 = Every backer of a physical book gets a BOOKMARK! 

IF WE PASS...$7,000 = Every backer of a physical book gets a NEW ART PRINT BY TOM BARTON!

IF WE PASS...$8,000 = We will add 5 more pages to the comic! 

IF WE PASS...$9,000 = We will be able to letter the comic in Portuguese so Rafael can distribute the book at cons!

IF WE PASS..$10,000 = We will add 10 to 15 more pages to the comic! :)

MORE TO COME? IT'S UP TO YOU! 

 

BRIC-A-BRAC #1 is a 30-page, full color comic book and the first part of a three part epic! 

The goal of this Indiegogo campaign is to fund the production, printing, and shipping of this comic book!

Pledge to one of the tiers on the right and get some rewards for your contribution! 

 

BRIC-A-BRAC is unlike any Christmas story you've ever read! 

The story follows a young boy named Garret who lives on the beautiful and isolated Sugar Plum Cove (an island on Planet Christmas). There, he and his friends are protected by the magical Sugar Plum Fairies. 

That is...until the Nutcracker Army invades their cozy little island in order to steal the Christmas Spirit from under it and gain an advantage in the war. 

Garret and his friends devise a list of wishes to give to Father Christmas so he might stop the Nutcrackers from harming their care-takers and put and end to the war. In a turn of events, Garret is separated from his old pals and hurled into an adventure that will challenge his belief and trust in ways he never expected--while also showing him fantastical locations and introducing him to new allies and dangers! 

 

 

Here are some character concepts to give you an idea of the great characters Garret will meet on his journey! 

 

CHECK OUT THIS AWESOME FAN ART BY OUR AWESOME BACKERS!

by @miltonaquiarart

by @muttman75

 

by @marcuscollar

 

by @miltionaquiarart

 

by @rimurray97

RYAN HAACK: I'm the creator and writer of BRIC-A-BRAC! I just successfully funded the Unspeakable Text (Vol. 1) campaign and I am confident that with your help we can make this goal on Indiegogo! I always write stories that are personal to me, and this one is especially personal because it connects all the way back to my early fascination with Christmas! 

 

RAFAEL SAM: Born in São Paulo, and raised in Recife (PE), Rafael Sam has worked as a freelance illustrator and comic artist for 9 years. He has worked in the area of textbooks and also comic books, in cartoon style, concept art and has made scenarios for animations. Some time ago, he worked for DreamWorks Animation in the comic area, where he made 3 editions of the Madagascar title. He recently worked on the catharsis-funded Black Desert author project where he made the official launch at ccxp 2018. His Instagram is @rafael1234hc. 

 

LETTERING will be done by the amazing TOBEN RACICOT! I've worked with Toben on practically all my comic book stories and believe me when I say he is one of the most talented letterers on the indie scene! 

 As mentioned, this will be a 30-page, full color comic book in Standard American Size (10 and 1/8 X 6 and 5/8). We will be using Mixam to print the comic and the art print. We have full trust in Mixam and believe teaming with them will allow us to deliver the best product possible. The comics will be shipped in bags and boards with bubble-wrap to ensure the comic will not be damaged. 

Indiegogo has a 5% fee for letting us use their wonderful platform. 

Oh, and Rafael has completely drawn about 25% of the comic and will be actively producing pages while we go on with this campaign! With your help, we will be able to complete the rest of the production and get more money for shipping and reward fulfillment! 

Here's a pie chart to breakdown what we'll use the money for: 

There is a $5 U.S. shipping charge for every physical reward and those outside of the U.S. will have to pay varying charges for international shipping depending on your location. This is a precautionary measure that must be taken, as international shipping is very expensive. We must take this precaution because we don't want to disappoint backers. 

We can't promise physical copies will be out before Christmas comes, as Christmas shipping can be very expensive and unpredictable. We can, however, confidently say digital copies will be given to backers in December and physical copies will come in January. Changes and setbacks are always around the corner, however.

If the physical copy being delivered before Christmas is a deal-breaker for you, we want you to know that this story is about the idea of Christmas--not the holiday. It's about implementing Christmas cheer into each of our lives everyday, for a better tomorrow!

Send me your favorite holiday photos so I can add them to our Holiday Collage which will be in the back of this first issue! 

 

JUST ADDED! TCHAIKOVSKY's REVENGE - $55

RECEIVE ALL PREVIOUS REWARDS PLUS A SKETCH OF A BRIC-A-BRAC CHARACTER FROM RAFAEL SAM HIMSELF!

story:
Short Summary

I've been making movies in Oregon since the early 2000s. In that time I have produced and directed 4 feature length projects and countless shorts and music videos. 

I've had an idea/script for the last five years for a feature entitled Demonized. Without giving too much away, it's a dark comedy set in the late nineties about a demon who possess multiple people, one of them a bullied goth kid. 

Unfortunately, time and money have always been an issue with getting this project off the ground as a movie, especially with the upcoming arrival of my second daughter in early December. So I decided to storyboard the project out, hand it off to the super talented artist and fellow Oregon movie maker, Joe Sherlock, and create a self-published graphic novel! The idea of seeing the story realized in a completely new medium (especially one I love) is very fun and exciting. Here's what he did with the first five pages (minus the dialogue). The inside cover my wife Sara designed.

What We Need & What You Get

The $2900 will go towards printing the books and compensating Joe for his time spent illustrating the pages. He's doing it for practically nothing, especially given the time and energy that goes into drawing, inking, lettering, scanning and cleaning each page.

We have some very cool reward packages planned. Starting at a thank you in the book and ending at a character in the book being drawn to your likeness!

The Impact

My favorite part about movie making is storytelling, but it's always been a challenge to convey the story in my head onto the screen. I hope that creating a graphic novel will really give me a shot at getting my entire story clearly onto paper without financial or location limitations. 

Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges will hopefully be very minimal. Those of you who know me know that when I start a project I always see it through. I already have the story written out and a good part of it storyboarded/outlined.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Even a dollar or two helps, but if you're strapped for cash please share this on whatever social media you're on or share it with a friend. Any and all support is truly appreciated.

story:
Issue #7: Spooklyhoma!

The dream: to give out free comics anthologies to show local talent. The reality: it's happening!

For our seventh issue, we're doing our first themed anthology with eight spooky stories. We have scary, heartfelt, action-packed, and even funny stories lined up! All we need is some money to print. You can help and get awesome rewards for going the extra mile to make art happen.

 

The Details

For our seventh issue, we have put together a 48-page anthology with eight stories to spook ya. Stories are all-ages so everyone can enjoy them; if it were a movie, we would rate it roughly PG with some fantasy violence. Each is from a different writer/artist team, so each is very different in tone and style. Here are a few sample pages:

 

 

 

 

Check out our previous issues at Okie Comics.com for a taste of what we've already done.

 

About Us

Okie Comics started in 2017 with a dream to share artistic talent locally. We're proud of what we've been able to show off so far, and we hope to continue to grow.

In addition to the awesome new artists premiering in this anthology, a few of our artists have worked with us before. Take a look at their previous stories in Okie Comics:

  • Matthew Brendle - Shaman's Portal
  • Kent Clark - Left Hanging
  • Tanner Feuerborn - The Boomers
  • Jonathan Koelsch - It Happened... in Will Rogers Gardens
  • Mackenzie Mullins - Burialesque
  • Katrina Younts - The Ballad of Puddin' McGee

 

Risks & Challenges

The art is all nearly complete, and we have produced six issues already. The biggest challenge is funds. With your help, we can raise the funds to get print copies out into the world.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about the awesome art we are making right here in Oklahoma!

story:
We did it! Check out the stretch goals!

We've successfully hit our funding goal for Housebound, here's what we have planned:

  • $750- All backers receive: 1 Digital Copy of Coronary #1, James Bond meets Black Mirror in a world where plastic surgery is free. You also get an exclusive preview of Super Fed Up by Alex Dandino and Evan Peter! Super Fed Up is a break up story set in the world of superheroes. It asks the simple question: "When is enough enough for Lois Lane?"
  • Super Fed Up Preview booklet includes script pages, a statement from Alex Dandino, and some preliminary character work from artist Evan Peter! 
  • $1000- All backers receive a digital copy of Stalkings, in addition to Coronary 1 & 2.

Coronary Previews below!

 

 

 

Super Fed Up Preview booklet samples below!

Art by Evan Peter. Script by Alex Dandino.

 

What is Housebound?

Hey everyone! Housebound is a digital only comics anthology by the indie comics community.

As for us, we're Ryan Burke and Alex Dandino, two LA-based comics writers and the curators of this awesome project.

We're all stuck inside. it kinda sucks, we know. 

So we decided to bring a little light in by bringing any and everyone we could in with this anthology! What you'll find here is various writers and artists all coming together to talk about one thing: Inside. The anthology's theme, much like it's title, is all about what's happening inside. Inside our houses. Inside our brains. Inside out souls? It's all inside!

Think of this as a collective "How Are You Holding Up?" from the indie comics community!

What We Need & What You Get

What do we need? We need you! We want you to want us! If you chip in, we can send some money to some worthwhile charities, namely Hero Initiative & Direct Relief! We know the comics community is hurting with cons effectively cancelled for the year, so we're doing what we can to help our friends out! 

What do you get? If you donate, we'll send you a 100% digital version of this anthology! That's right, we're keeping EVERYONE safe and giving you a digital copy so you can enjoy in the comfort of your own home without sanitizing anything first! (But please...sanitize anyways as you're going about your days!)

The Impact

We want to help. Comics are for everyone, and everyone needs help right now. Trust that anything you can spare helps someone out of a jam. The indie comics community is all about love, and "Housebound" is meant to show the love, whether that's through donations, art, writing, and just in general getting people's work out there!

(Day Job by Tim Vargulish and Mario Miranda)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't get in on this...please look to your LCS and any small press and buy their books too. This is a tough time for anyone in entertainment, and we want to keep comics thriving. If your money can't come in on this, help any and everyone you know in comics! 

The Artwork

('Territories' by Rob Pilkington and Rio Burton)

('Trapped' by Joseph Morris)

('The Ninja' by Gunnar Long and Alfonso Monge aka Fonzcomics)

^The cover art, by Joel Saavedra!

More to come!

Art by Evan Peter. Script by Alex Dandino.
 
What is Housebound?
Hey everyone! Housebound is a digital only comics anthology by the indie comics community.
As for us, we're Ryan Burke and Alex Dandino, two LA-based comics writers and the curators of this awesome project.
We're all stuck inside. it kinda sucks, we know. 
So we decided to bring a little light in by bringing any and everyone we could in with this anthology! What you'll find here is various writers and artists all coming together to talk about one thing: Inside. The anthology's theme, much like it's title, is all about what's happening inside. Inside our houses. Inside our brains. Inside out souls? It's all inside!
Think of this as a collective "How Are You Holding Up?" from the indie comics community!


What We Need & What You Get
What do we need? We need you! We want you to want us! If you chip in, we can send some money to some worthwhile charities, namely Hero Initiative & Direct Relief! We know the comics community is hurting with cons effectively cancelled for the year, so we're doing what we can to help our friends out! 
What do you get? If you donate, we'll send you a 100% digital version of this anthology! That's right, we're keeping EVERYONE safe and giving you a digital copy so you can enjoy in the comfort of your own home without sanitizing anything first! (But please...sanitize anyways as you're going about your days!)

The Impact
We want to help. Comics are for everyone, and everyone needs help right now. Trust that anything you can spare helps someone out of a jam. The indie comics community is all about love, and "Housebound" is meant to show the love, whether that's through donations, art, writing, and just in general getting people's work out there!

(Day Job by Tim Vargulish and Mario Miranda)

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't get in on this...please look to your LCS and any small press and buy their books too. This is a tough time for anyone in entertainment, and we want to keep comics thriving. If your money can't come in on this, help any and everyone you know in comics! 
The Artwork


('Territories' by Rob Pilkington and Rio Burton)

('Trapped' by Joseph Morris)
('The Ninja' by Gunnar Long and Alfonso Monge aka Fonzcomics)

^The cover art, by Joel Saavedra!
More to come!

story:
Sarah "Neila" Elkins is a Freelance comic artist and writer who has worked on such books as Womanthology, Skin Crawling Comics and her webcomic Paragon Ketch.


Sharkpony and the Glitter Riders is a 1 issue satirical parody comic about 4 Dude Bros who steal a spaceship and are transformed into 3 Magical Girls and a Sharkpony. The comic began it's life as an forum art challenge entry but was just too fun an idea so it became a full 22 page comic.

The Breakdown (Where your donations are going!)
Our goal is to reach $4500, with $220 going to print at least 100 copies of the comic issue, about $2500 will cover a artist page rate, that will be used for modest living expenses, Taxes, and any other things like the Indie GoGo fees or any unforeseen expenses with the rewards or additional shipping that is above the $5 estimated shipping factored into most funding levels. The remaining funds go to the production and shipping of rewards. If fewer people select certain rewards fewer of those rewards will be made. 


If we do not reach the full goal the funding structure should still allow for a smaller number of the books to be printed and for rewards that were pledged for to be created and sent to backers.

UPDATE:  
BONUS MINI COMIC Page 1 Unlocked at $500!

Bonus Mini Comic Page 2 UNLOCKED at $1000!

Bonus Mini Comic Page 3 will be unlocked at $1500!
One new Mini comic page per every $500 raised! Up to 8 pgs of Mini Bonus Comics will be made!

Bonus Sketch will go to the person who pushes the fundraiser over $1500!
Bonus Sketch will go to the 40th backer!

See below the reward photos for more Unlockable Incentives and Rewards!


Check out the Gallery above for examples of art from the book and rewards!








Unlockable Rewards:

Other Rewards unlockable if we raise more than $4000:

$5000 - PRETTY GLITTER: All backers will get a digital poster

 

$6000 - FEEDING FRENZY: This will fund a SECOND issue of shark pony which will be given digitially FOR FREE to all backers.

 

$7000 - LIFE OF SHARKPONY:  All backers will get a set of digital bio-cards for shark pony and the glitter riders.

 

$8000 - FEEDING FRENZIER: This will fund a THIRD issue of shark pony which will be given digitially FOR FREE to all backers.

 

UNLOCKED!!! Additionally if we hit our goal for every $500 dollars we raise we will add one page to a bonus digital mini-comic in the style of a Heman Toy-Tie.  That is 8 mini-pages plus cover just for hitting our target goal!!!


Unlockable Donation Incentives!

If we reach $6000 the first of the unlockable donation Incentives will go live!

Background Chum (Limit 5)
For a donation of $500 you will recieve:
A Digital PDF of the comic
Signed Physical copy of the comic
Limited Edition Mini Poster
T-Shirt
Mug
Yourself drawn in the background of the extended Comic surviving.

Feeding Time (Limit 4)
For a donation of $1000 you will recieve:
A Digital PDF of the comic
Signed Physical copy of the comic
Limited Edition Mini Poster
T-Shirt
Mug
Get Eaten by Sharkpony in the extended Comic!

If shipping outside the United States, please include an extra $5 to cover additional shipping charges for all donation tiers.

story:
The Story

Dating. Friendships. Work life balance. It's tough to be a young woman in the city, especially when you can fly. 

Can the the all-girl superteam BOOM!SQUAD protect their hometown from menacing corporate powerhouse Mr. Goode? Will their boyfriends, a trio of musicians playing in the city's worst rock and roll band, cause more problems than their worth? And where can a girl find a good latte without having to go to a corporate coffee chain? 

Boom!Squad is an 80 page color graphic novel with something fun for comic readers young and old. Discover an engaging superhero tale with dynamic artwork, sharp dialogue, and just a hint of self-consciousness. Fans of genre-busting creators like Mike Allred, Brian Vaughan, Daniel Clowes, Matt Groening and the Hernandez brothers will love this witty and wild story of superpowered young women.


The Creators

David Crouse is a writer with complex tastes. He loves Virginia Woolf, Gabriel Garcia Marquez, bad science fiction and horror movies, and (of course) comic books.

His short story collection Copy Cats won the Flannery O’Connor award for Short Fiction and was nominated for the Pen-Faulkner. His second collection of short stories, The Man Back There, won the Mary McCarthy Prize and was published by Sarabande books. His comic book writing has been published in the horror anthology The Dark Horse Book of the Dead. He's currently writing a novel about vampires and academia and a short story collection about interior Alaska. He lives in Seattle, Washington.

Greg Moutafis has illustrated a variety of projects for publishers including Cengage Learning, Topps, Jetpack Press, Children's Hospital Boston, Lollipop music magazine and the Boston Comics Roundtable. He has worked on numerous indie comic projects including Boston's groundbreaking comics anthology Don't Shoot It's Only Comix and was the winner of a Xeric Grant for the underground comic Killer Ape.

Where our funding goes
  • Full Color Paperback Printing. It's a gorgeous, colorful tale and we want to share a great looking printed book with generations of readers and collectors.
  • Barcoding. Official ISBN numbering improves US distribution and cataloging.
  • Marketing: Reaching comic shop retailers, regional bookstores, libraries, and online booksellers
  • Final illustration, digital coloring, lettering and packaging for print

Fundraising Video Action hosted by Bonnie!


Perks

  • Paperback graphic novels
  • Digital PDF downloads of the full graphic novel
  • Exclusive art and behind the scenes rarities
  • Limited run prints and original art
 
 
8x10" Limited Edition Art Print signed by Greg
 
 
The Man Back There paperback signed by David
Frankenstein 11x17" Limited Edition Art Print
_____________________________________________________________________
 
Set: "Play the Chess Master" Art & Spellbound Boston Comics Anthology
BCR Book Link:  http://bostoncomics.com/anthologies/ 
____________________________________________________________________
Mad Robot Art signed by Greg     $90   SOLD
 

Boomtown Concept Art signed by Greg    $100
 

Secret Origins

David Crouse and Greg Moutafis met in high school, became intensely close friends, and then eventually grew up, heading off in different directions. David moved to Alaska and became a writer of short stories and a young teacher. Greg settled in Massachusetts and became a comic book artist and graphic designer. 

Separated by thousands of miles, they managed to stay in touch over the years and whenever they spoke they talked about comics, comics, comics. Marvel Comics, DC Comics, Archie Comics, and underground comics. And they talked about Boom!Squad, an idea that would celebrate their love of the technicolor superhero books of their childhoods while looking to the future.

Boom!Squad is a labor of love, created by two people who are still excited by all the possibilities of the medium. The story is a supercharged mash up of superheroes, modern rock, gender politics, and slacker culture. It's also very, very entertaining.

Contributions to this project will help David and Greg realize their dream of publishing Boom!Squad as a complete, full-color graphic novel. The comic book scene needs more stories that are both intelligent AND fun and Boom!Squad fills that need.

Visit Boom!Squad on Facebook and Tumblr for more art and news!

Thanks for your support!

story:
If anybody reading this has any suggestions or questions that you would like to see or know about Black Rose please send them on my way.

A BRIEF LOOK AT THE STORY
Black Rose War is a fantasy epic following two cousins who get caught up in a democratic revolution that is gripping their nation. Jillian and Razakel Corday find themselves refugees without a home as the king is overthrown and the revolutionaries take over. Once in power the new senate quickly begins to be corrupted by its new found power. The cousins find themselves on the run, trying to find allies to help them rein in the spreading terror. Razakel’s sympathies lie with the senate, and as Jillian continues to try and hold them back he eventually turns on his cousin. Now a general in the senate’s legion Razakel begins to attack neighboring countries, and brings with him a terrible new weapon, subjugating people, attempting to impose his vision on every person and place that he finds. Jillian finds herself traveling the world trying to stay ahead of her cousin and his armies, leading a resistance that tries to salvage the ideas of freedom and individuality that are fast evaporating from the senate’s revolution.

SOME OF THE THEMES
Traveling around the world the story draws from mythology and history to create a menagerie of visuals. The inspirations for Black Rose War come from places as disparate as the French Revolution and Italian Renaissance to Ancient Egypt and the Han Dynasty. We meet nomadic natives and sea-faring traders. There are classical creatures of mythology such as elves, dwarves, and satyrs that live side by side with anthropomorphic beings, creatures of light, and other exotic characters. In the end it is a human story, about loss, courage, jealousies, and fears, that is played out across an extravagant canvass. These are ordinary people that find themselves living in extraordinary times, children who grow up surrounded by war, men and women who see the prime of their life consumed by it, and the old who watch as the world they knew is destroyed.

THE PROJECT
Right now I’m scrambling, Black Rose War is a project so near and dear to my heart it’s hard to put into words. I’ve been working on this story for nearly nine years now. I even finished two book versions and threw them out because in the end they didn’t live up to what I wanted Black Rose to be. This script is finally living up to those expectations that I put on myself and Black Rose is as exciting as I imagined it, and as expressive, and the talent that I have around me right now are amazing and only making the final piece even better.

THE TEAM
I have three amazing artists and two fantastic colorists who have come on board to help me realize Black Rose War the way I always pictured it, which is a challenging piece of work. We’re trying to push the medium to the breaking point in how much story and detail are in every panel on every page. I’m here because while all of these people are working for, in some cases, half their usual rates they need money to be able to devote time to this. I’ve been paying out of pocket but my ability to fund this is running out so I’m here asking for the help of strangers. Anything is appreciated, send in a quarter if that’s all you’ve got, after nine years I’m just trying to find a way to make this long dream turn into reality and we’re taking steps in that direction every day.

story:
Welcome to the World of UltraViolet

What started off as the first time trying cosplay, has turned into a full-fledged comic/episodic that everyone is falling in love with.

My name is Elizabeth Lambert. I'm 20 and I'm an actress. All my life, I've wanted to do nothing but inspire people.

On the popular app Tiktok, I discovered that people were cosplaying our favorite Spidey Characters, and I wanted to join in! But if I was going to do it, I was going to make sure that I stood out.

And what could possibly stand out more than a Purple-faced, white-haired Alien?

Soon after the first test cosplay with UltraViolet, she gained over 9k devoted followers, who either thought the symbiote was actually a part of the MCU or were already tagging Marvel to make her a part of it. After that, I invested some real money into her own custom costume. 19k followers later, the light bulb went off in my head.

 

I had the chance to summon an actual team, composed of talented POC and LGBTQ+ members to write out an actual, relatable college hero. No gimmicks, no weird fetishizing tropes, no body clones. We're normalizing different body types, demolishing corny tropes, and above all, giving the struggling young adult, 9 to 5 college community the characters and story they NEED.

 

UltraViolet is about a girl named Jai, a college Freshman who attends ASU West with her friends Ty and Sara. As she progresses through college, Jai faces different challenges with her pals, and of course; her symbiote.

The main characters from UltraViolet come from different backgrounds.  We feel it's crucial to have single-parent households normalized into comics, as not everyone can relate to having an upper-middle-class household with both of your biological parents. On top of that, we cover the topic of surviving on minimum wage and balancing work/life as a college student, because unfortunately, having a really cool Symbiote doesn't pay off your student loans. 

UltraViolet also fights to destigmatize and get rid of the over-exaggeration and romanticization of mental illness. A study reported that 39 percent of students were struggling with at least one mental illness. And that 39% percent deserves to know that their new favorite hero is fighting the same fight that they are. 

As you grow with Jai and the gang, you see them all truly figure out their footing and perspective on who they truly might be, and what they stand for.

Meet The Mains!

We won't spoil too much :)

 

Name: Jai Clemens ( JJ ) 

Age: 19

Sign: Aries

Fun Fact: JJ loves 80-90’s clothing and music! 

( just don't quiz her though, you might be stuck there for hours)

 

 

Name: Ty Gibbons

Age: 18

Sign: Capricorn

Fun Fact: Ty likes to make people feel awkward when she’s done with conversations

 

Name: Sara D Tompson 

Age: 20

Sign: Virgo

Fun Fact: Sara can name pretty much any celebrities' zodiac sign. 

 

Comic Specifications:

Since this is UltraViolets' first issue, we wanted to make sure that all aspects of the quality of the book left you all impressed and wanting more, down to the packaging.

Page Count: 24

Dimensions: 6.125 inches (width) x 9.25 inches (height, spine)

Paper Quality: Premium 4-color on 70# Boise offset white

Binding: Perfect Binding

Meet The Team:

Writer:

Hey pals! My name is Emily Sogan, and I’ve been a storyteller for as long as I can remember. Having been writing for eight years, Ultraviolet is the project I’m most excited about and I hope you’re just as stoked as I am!

 

 

 

Artists:

Hiim Gem! I'm the Directive Lead for the art team and I'm also a gamer! 

 

Hey guys! My name is Avery, and I’m one of the artists for this comic  Superheroes and art are two of my favorite things, so I am beyond excited to be apart of this project and team. I’m currently pursuing a degree in Digital Media & Design, and this opportunity has not only introduced me to new skills but also to some wonderful people. I hope you’ll fall in love with UltraViolet like I already have. 

 

Howdy! My name is Jesse but y’all can call me JJ. I’ve been doing art for as long as I can remember. I’m planning on pursuing a career in animation/illustration and I’m ecstatic to be working on this project. I hope you all love UV as much as  I’ve loved working on her.

Hi! My name is Danica Mojonnier but you can just call me Dani! I’ve been doing art for 5 years and I’m so excited to be entering into the professional art world with this project. I hope you love Ultra Violet as much as I do and I’m so happy to be sharing this project with you! 
Reminder: You’re beautiful 

Hey everyone, my name is Amaria Combee and I’ve been doing art seriously for the past 6 years. Art has always been a huge passion of mine. I’m extremely excited about Ultraviolet and I know that you’ll love it even more!

Hey I’m Samaria Torres! Im a graphic design/illustration student and have been drawing since I was young!  Im excited to be working on this comic and hope y’all enjoy it! 

 

The Creator:

Hi again! Im Elizabeth, the actress behind UltraViolet

Funding goals:

The money raised is going to be used to pay the artist fairly and cover all production costs for UltraViolet. This isn't the teams first encounter this production costs and we've made sure to get the best price and quality for all of the incentives!  

If we proceed to earn more than our goal, the funding will go towards helping our amazing comic team upgrade their tools for the next run, but also set up the fund for the next set of comics, filming supplies for the web series and the UltraViolet Short Film, which is the end goal of all of this!

If you can please support us either by making a contribution to this campaign or by sharing this campaign with all your friends, we would mean so much to us.

 

At the end of the day, we just want UV to become someone in the worlds favorite hero.
