On top of that, we cover the topic of surviving on minimum wage and balancing work/life as a college student, because unfortunately, having a really cool Symbiote doesn't pay off your student loans. UltraViolet also fights to destigmatize and get rid of the over-exaggeration and romanticization of mental illness. A study reported that 39 percent of students were struggling with at least one mental illness. And that 39% percent deserves to know that their new favorite hero is fighting the same fight that they are. As you grow with Jai and the gang, you see them all truly figure out their footing and perspective on who they truly might be, and what they stand for.Meet The Mains!We won't spoil too much :) Name: Jai Clemens ( JJ ) Age: 19Sign: AriesFun Fact: JJ loves 80-90’s clothing and music! ( just don't quiz her though, you might be stuck there for hours)  Name: Ty GibbonsAge: 18Sign: CapricornFun Fact: Ty likes to make people feel awkward when she’s done with conversations Name: Sara D Tompson Age: 20Sign: VirgoFun Fact: Sara can name pretty much any celebrities' zodiac sign.  Comic Specifications:Since this is UltraViolets' first issue, we wanted to make sure that all aspects of the quality of the book left you all impressed and wanting more, down to the packaging.Page Count: 24Dimensions: 6.125 inches (width) x 9.25 inches (height, spine)Paper Quality: Premium 4-color on 70# Boise offset whiteBinding: Perfect BindingMeet The Team:Writer:Hey pals! My name is Emily Sogan, and I’ve been a storyteller for as long as I can remember. Having been writing for eight years, Ultraviolet is the project I’m most excited about and I hope you’re just as stoked as I am!   Artists:Hiim Gem! I'm the Directive Lead for the art team and I'm also a gamer!  Hey guys! My name is Avery, and I’m one of the artists for this comic  Superheroes and art are two of my favorite things, so I am beyond excited to be apart of this project and team. I’m currently pursuing a degree in Digital Media & Design, and this opportunity has not only introduced me to new skills but also to some wonderful people. I hope you’ll fall in love with UltraViolet like I already have.  Howdy! My name is Jesse but y’all can call me JJ. I’ve been doing art for as long as I can remember. I’m planning on pursuing a career in animation/illustration and I’m ecstatic to be working on this project. I hope you all love UV as much as  I’ve loved working on her.Hi! My name is Danica Mojonnier but you can just call me Dani! I’ve been doing art for 5 years and I’m so excited to be entering into the professional art world with this project. I hope you love Ultra Violet as much as I do and I’m so happy to be sharing this project with you! Reminder: You’re beautiful Hey everyone, my name is Amaria Combee and I’ve been doing art seriously for the past 6 years. Art has always been a huge passion of mine. I’m extremely excited about Ultraviolet and I know that you’ll love it even more!Hey I’m Samaria Torres! Im a graphic design/illustration student and have been drawing since I was young!  Im excited to be working on this comic and hope y’all enjoy it!  The Creator:Hi again! Im Elizabeth, the actress behind UltraVioletFunding goals:The money raised is going to be used to pay the artist fairly and cover all production costs for UltraViolet. This isn't the teams first encounter this production costs and we've made sure to get the best price and quality for all of the incentives!  If we proceed to earn more than our goal, the funding will go towards helping our amazing comic team upgrade their tools for the next run, but also set up the fund for the next set of comics, filming supplies for the web series and the UltraViolet Short Film, which is the end goal of all of this!If you can please support us either by making a contribution to this campaign or by sharing this campaign with all your friends, we would mean so much to us. At the end of the day, we just want UV to become someone in the worlds favorite hero.

story:
I’m Ben Bender, and I’m making BEORN: The Littlest Viking Saga. The first book has already been successfully crowdfunded, and now I'm bringing the campaign over to Indiegogo so more folks can get in on the fun. I'm hoping to use this as a good way for folks to get in on pre-orders for the book, and pick up some of the extra campaign goodies in the process. Thank you so much for your support!

 

 

Cover mockup. Design and dimensions may change slightly.

All books come signed by the creator.

 

This book prints the first chapter of Beorn's saga. Readers will be introduced to Beorn, the fantastical island on which he lives, and get a first look at the magic (and danger!) that awaits our little Viking. 

Thanks to a successful Kickstarter campaign (Over $20,000 funded), the book now features a Case Hardcover (7.5x11) with Gold Foil Stamping, Embossing, and Gloss Spot Coating. With 40 pages of full-color story, and 12 pages of incredible guest artist pinups, this book will be a real beauty. The finishing touches are being put on the additional content, and the book will be ready to go to print before this campaign wraps up. 

 

I want to make the most beautiful book possible! This is a labor of passion, and I am working hard to ensure the physical book embodies the love I have for Beorn's story. 

Cover mockup. Design and dimensions may change slightly.

All books come signed by the creator.

 

 

Beorn knows he will be a legendary warrior any day now. In the meantime, he’ll spread his personal brand of mischief across his new home...a fantastical island where ancient myths, powerful gods, and magical fairy tales come to life. 

As rambunctious and unruly as Beorn can be, he somehow manages to endear himself to those around him and forge friendships with an amazing cast of characters and creatures. None of those friendships is more special than his secret friendship with a little troll named Goob.

I've been working on Beorn's saga for around a decade. It was initially inspired by my long-time love for newspaper comic strips. But as I was writing the daily strip, Beorn's world kept growing. His slice of life experiences couldn't be separated from the amazing and fantastical world in which he lived. Soon, Beorn's story was chalk full of Norse mythology, and Old-World fairy tales. Epic fantasy and high adventure followed this kid wherever he went! His curiosity and his thirst for adventure were insatiable.  

Beorn was a little Viking who kept leading me down roads full of big moments...and big feelings. I fell in love with the cast of characters. It was a delight to see how their relationships with Beorn, and each, other grew.

Of course, not all of Beorn's world was safe and welcoming! Outside the safety of the small village where Beorn settled was a Dark Forest filled with dangerous and mysterious creatures and beings. Sometimes they were misunderstood and harmless. Other times, Beorn found himself in very real danger! 

But no matter how Beorn's world and saga grew, there was always one constant. At it's center, Beorn's story was about friendship. A magical friendship between a little Viking and his best friend who happened to be a troll. I have found it to be something very special, and I'm excited to finally share it. 

 

In this first chapter, we will see Beorn's first fateful experiences as he lands on the island and discovers some of its inhabitants. I hope you'll join me in seeing this project come to life, and enjoy reading Beorn's adventures as much as I do!


 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

I was very fortunate to have the support and contributions of some AMAZING artists for my Kickstarter campaign. These pictures by some of my all-time favorite artists will be featured in the pinup section of BEORN 1. You can get a good look at them below. I feel incredibly grateful to have these folks associated with my first book, and I hope you enjoy these pieces as much as I do!

Matt Smith

 

 

Benjamin Schipper

 

 

Mike Hartigan

 

 

Jared Cullum

 

 

Eric Orchard

 

 

Simone D'Armini

 

 

Rob Guillory

 

 

Kevin Merriman

 

 

Jeff Smith

 

 

 

Cam Kendell

 

 

Will Henry

 

 

 

Scott Brown

 

 

 

Thank you so much for checking out BEORN, and giving it a chance. I've been really fortunate, and incredibly grateful, to have received the initial outpouring of support that's come my way. I really hope you'll consider joining us for the first chapter in Beorn's saga. Thank you!

story:
UPDATE as of October 1:

We're at 100%+! WE'RE PRINTING A BOOK!

UPDATE as of Sept 10:

FREE printable low-effort activity/coloring book for ALL backers (including the $5 e-book tier)!

 

I’m a Filipino animator by profession, and on the side I've been making one comic strip a day plus a few short cartoons for almost 3 years now, starring super weird but pretty adorable, uh... mushrooms. You may have seen them popping up on the internet:

I made these comic strips as a way to let all my ideas out and hopefully entertain a few people in the process. I never really expected my mushrooms to make a lot of people a wee bit happier!

I’ve also been asked constantly when an actual printed book is coming out. This is my chance and with your support (in my best mushroom voice), WE CAN DO THIS!

The first-ever Mushroom Movie book (well, it's a mockup, but still)!

“You’re Doing Just Fine” is a collection of 100 Mushroom Movie comic strips dealing with the saddies and the happies of everyday life. Its cover and inside pages are all full-color, and it's going to be a square 8 x 8-inch book.

ALL the comics are done and ready to go, but we're going to need your help to fund the printing. Pledge $20 or more (add shipping) to get a book plus freebies shipped to you!

Our modest $3,000 fixed goal will take care of book printing, Indiegogo fees, paying the people who will work on preparing your books, plus juicy mushroomy freebies! We're going all or nothing with this thing, and we're offering a couple of surprises for the first few backers. Here are the early bird perks, goals, and stretch goals:

(UPDATED AS OF OCT 4)


 

[UNLOCKED!] EARLY BIRD - 20 out of 1st 100 BACKERS get a chance to win a hi-res mushroom-ized digital portrait sent via email. We'll raffle these off and announce the winners after the campaign.

[UNLOCKED!] EARLY BIRD - 10 out of 1st 100 BACKERS get a chance to suggest the theme/idea of the next online comic. We'll raffle these off and announce the winners after the campaign (different from the portrait winners).

[UNLOCKED!] $1,000 MILESTONE - each order will include a desktop and phone wallpaper of the cover!

[UNLOCKED!] $2,000 MILESTONE  - each order will include an outrageously cute Mushroom bookmark!

[UNLOCKED!] $3,000 GOAL - OUR BOOKS GET PRINTED! Each order will now include a sticker pack with five (5) Mushroom stickers!

[UNLOCKED!] $3,500 STRETCH GOAL - 20 bonus comics will be added to the book, for a total of 120 pages!

$4,000 STRETCH GOAL - spot UV cover!

$4,500++ - we'll think of more stretch goals when we get there!

The freebies and other rewards are a way to THANK YOU for your support. Check out our different perks to start contributing!

UPDATE as of Sept 4: We're extended until October 7! A new e-book tier has also been added for $5.

 

We're teaming up with Silaw Publishing, a local indie publisher who has successfully published books in the past via crowdfunding:

They have more than 3 years' experience to make this happen from crowdfunding to delivery.

We're targeting getting your copies to you by the end of the year, that's why we limited the number of books we’re shipping out to 500 copies. This way we can be more personal in fulfilling your orders; our small team can manage shipping out the books and still be able to take care of potential problems.

We will make sure to be transparent with our updates—it's the least we can do for you.

(UPDATE as of Sept 5: We've extended the campaign to 30 more days)
AUG 8: campaign launch
OCT 7: end of campaign
(we'll be producing freebies in advance)
OCT 21: we should have the funds from Indiegogo (it takes 15 days)
OCT 21 - NOV 4:
printing of books
NOV 5 - NOV 10:
we prepare all your packages
NOV 11: we ship all of them out!

From there, it will take 8-15 business days for your books to be delivered—this is the commitment we got from our very dedicated partner courier.

Let other people know this crowdfunding campaign exists! Share our recent comics and announcements on social media! Let your friends know there's a little square book trying its tiniest best to be born!

Find us on:
Facebook
Instagram
Webtoon

story:
Get some perspective through this drawing adventure! This unique comic book workbook guides you through a drawing exercise using events from your actual life, which will help you take a step back and see things from a whole new angle. Using these powerful visual activities, you will gain some helpful new tools for navigating interpersonal dynamics and getting your own needs met. NO ARTISTIC SKILL REQUIRED!

Tikva Wolf is the creator of the popular poly webcomic Kimchi Cuddles, and an author of a handful of books. Wolf’s work is used as an aid by therapists and educators, has been translated to several different languages, and is a part of the Kinsey Institute’s archive collection as well as the Ivy Plus Libraries Global Webcomics Archive.

Testimonials:
"I was surprised at how powerful this simple exercise was for me, and how deep it went. I want to use this every time my brain starts spinning!"

"I really appreciated the addition of the part about how to share this as an activity with kids. I liked the process itself and am looking forward to trying it out as a shared activity with my family." 

- Therapeutic Comic Drawing Workshop attendees


SHIPPING INFO:

Shipping is free within the United States and additional shipping is required overseas. Check specifics on each item. Books are ready to be signed and sent to you!

story:
[IT] Grimorio è 100 pagine di fumetti e illustrazioni  da 20+ artisti sulla Stregoneria. Venti e più visioni dello stregato, dell'occulto, diverse da quelle che troverete in qualunque altro luogo, selezionate e impaginate per voi da Ariel Vittori e Laura Guglielmo. 


[ENG] Grimorio is 100 pages of comics and illustrations on Witchcraft by 20+ artists. More than twenty different takes on the occult, the bewitched, unlike any other you'll find, accurately selected for you by Ariel Vittori and Laura Guglielmo.

[IT] Ariel ha già partecipato ad antologie internazionali (Food Porn) e lavora con fumetto e illustrazione da più di tre anni. Ha conosciuto Laura alla Bologna Children's Book Fair di due anni fa, innamorandosi delle sue storie. Laura stessa, oltre ad essere scrittrice sopraffina, lavora disegnando tra le altre cose per videogiochi, animazione, giochi da tavolo. 
Si sono trovate a sviluppare insieme una storia stregata, e con tanta voglia di raccontarla. Si sono chieste, 'Quanti altri avranno voglia di gridare una storia, senza avere un luogo in cui farla ascoltare? Quanti vorranno tracciare il segno di come vedono la stregoneria, tra le pagine del Grimorio con copertina esclusiva di Antonio de Luca (Warner Bros, Riot Games) e Mirko Failoni (Spectrum 23)?' Ed eccoli, tutti, o quasi... Dovremo pur svelarvi ancora altri misteri!
Nei prossimi giorni getteremo luce su ognuno di loro, parlando del loro lavoro per l'Antologia e fuori, quindi continuate a seguire la sezione degli aggiornamenti qui sulla nostra pagina e sugli altri social.


[ENG] Ariel has already partecipated in international anthologies (Food Porn) and she's been working with comics and illustrations for more than three years. She met Laura at Bologna Children's Book Fair two years ago and fell in love with her stories. Laura isn't just an amazing writer but an illustrator herself, working in the game and animation industry.
They had this witchy story, and they so wanted to tell it. So they wondered, 'How many others must have magical stories like this and no place to share them? How many would like to trace their vision of witchcraft in the pages of a Grimoire, with an exclusive cover by Mirko Failoni (Spectrum 23) and Antonio de Luca (Warner Bros, Riot Games)?'. Here they are, all of them... or almost. We simply must keep some mystery still!

With illustrations by:
Alice Girlanda, Astrid Lucchesi, Fabio Mancini, Giopota, Isabella Mazzanti, Romina Moranelli, Susanna Rumiz
[UPDATE] Arianna Robustelli, Nicolò Pellizzon and Flavia Biondi will be contributing as guests with 3 amazing prints included in perks from 40€ up, while Julia Sardà will be joining us with an illustration included in the book!


And Comics by:
Ariel Vittori, Eleonora Bruni, Freddie Tanto, Greta Xella, Laura Guglielmo, Laura Vivacqua, Monica Sangermano, Morena Forza, Noemi de Maio, Silvia Vanni, Sumi, Tessa Black.


[IT] Abbiamo bisogno del vostro aiuto per rendere Grimorio palpabile. Noi ci mettiamo tutta la nostra magia ed energia: ora tocca a voi.

La maggior parte dei fondi ci aiuterà a stampare il volume (€1800). Una parte andrà alle tasse di Paypal e Indiegogo (€350), un'altra parte ci servirà per lo spazio di esordio in Self Area a Lucca Comics&Games 2016 (€300). Il resto ci permetterà di coprire le spese promozionali e pagare i collaboratori esterni alla Congrega. Ah, e di realizzare gli altri meravigliosi Perk, ovviamente! 


[ENG] We need your help to make Grimorio real: we're putting all our magic and energy into it: now it's up to you. 

Most of the funds will go towards printing the volume (€1800). We'll need €300 to buy the table at Lucca Comics & Games, then 10% goes towards Indiegogo and Paypal fees. Everything else will let us cover marketing expenses, pay collaborators... and, oh, make all the other wonderful rewards of course!

[UPDATE: NEW PERK! SPECIAL COMBO PACK WITH POErtraits Crowdfunding]

POErtraits  - Portraits of Edgar Allan Poe

[IT] Come trasformare il più cupo e triste scrittore della letteratura americana in un personaggio ironico e divertente?

Semplice, basta fargli un ritratto. Anzi 100!

Cos'è un POErtrait? E' la caricatura di Edgar Allan Poe disegnata da Marco Rocchi. Ma non solo... E' una divertente ed originale illustrazione che miscela Edgar Allan Poe con giochi di parole e cultura pop.

Il libro conterrà 100 di queste caricature, 100 POErtraits, e gli aPOEcrypha, ritratti di Edgar Allan Poe realizzati da altri artisti.

[ENG] How to turn the darkest and saddest writer of american literature into an ironic and funny character?

Simple, just drawing him a portrait. Or even better... 100 POErtraits!

What is a POErtrait? It is an Edgar Allan Poe caricature drawn by Marco Rocchi. But that's not all... It is a funny and original illustration that blend Edgar Allan Poe with puns and pop culture.

The book will contain 100 of these caricatures, 100 POErtraits, and the aPOEcrypha, Edgar Allan Poe's portraits created from other artists.

[IT] Per vedere le vostre perk più da vicino, sfogliate la gallery: troverete anche delle anteprime dalle pagine del nostro Grimorio!

Importante: per la perk 'THE TOME' da €15 - e il corrispettivo Early Bird da €12 -, SE volete riceverlo a casa, dovrete selezionare anche la perk 'SHIPPING' successivamente.  Altrimenti potrete ritirare la vostra copia al Lucca Comics&Games 2016, o presso i nostri punti amici a Roma (Hula Hoop Club) e Milano (Ostello Bello Milan Hotel).

         

       

        

                            

               

               

[ENG] Check out the Gallery to see the perks up close AND more previews of the inside of the book!

IMPORTANT: The physical book is available in italian only, for now. If you wish to pick up the perks 'THE TOME' and its early bird version, and you want the book to be delivered to you, you''ll have to select the 'SHIPPING' perk as well - unless you can pick up the book at Lucca Comics&Games Convention 2016, or at our pick up points in Rome (Hula Hoop Club) and Milan (Ostello Bello Milan Hotel).

[UPDATES!]

The mystery guests aren't mysterious anymore! Here are the design for the 5x8 prints included in perks from 40€ up!


[IT] Con €5000 potremo non solo stampare più copie, ma aggiungere contenuto. Almeno 25 pagine in più, alcune di autori ancora avvolti nel mistero.   

Con €6000 aggiungeremo questa meravigliosa maglietta a tutti i backer delle perk da €100+, ma con soli €10 aggiunti alla vostra perk (escluse le perk digitali 'MAGIC POTION' e 'INVISIBLE ENCHANTMENT'), potrete averla ugualmente!

Con €9000 arriveremmo all'obiettivo più incantato in assoluto: pagare un anticipo a tutti i 20 e più artisti della Congrega. Crediamo tutti nella magia del Grimorio, e per questo stiamo lavorando dai primi raggi del sole fino alla luce della luna, e non ci sarebbe prova più lampante di questa di quanto ci crediate anche voi!

[ENG] With €5000 we could not only print more copies, but add content as well. At least 25 more pages, some by authors still shrouded in mystery. 

With €6000 we can give this wonderful t-shirt to all backers of €100+ perks, but with €10 only added to your perk (excluding the digital ones, 'MAGIC POTION' and 'INVISIBLE ENCHANTMENT'), you can have it too!

With €9000 we stretch to the most enchanting goal of all: pay an advance to all the 20+ artists of the Coven. We all believe in the Grimoire's magic, and that's why we've been working from the first light of day to the soft glow of the moon. There could be no better proof of how much you believe in it, too.



[IT] Abbiamo tutta l'estate per terminare tutti i fumetti e le illustrazioni ancora in corso (ma avrete modo di sbirciare in anteprima, nel corso della campagna, molte opere già terminate), e avremo il volume impaginato e stampato prima dell'inizio dell'autunno! Tutti i partecipanti sono professionisti, abituati a consegnare lavori di qualità con scadenze precise.

Sappiamo già chi stamperà al meglio non solo il volume, ma anche chi realizzerà tutti gli extra dei vari perk, dalle piccole spille ai poster.

Sì, è la prima volta che affrontiamo un progetto del genere, ma lo facciamo sulle spalle e con il supporto di amici più esperti, e con un'attenta pianificazione (derivata da un rapporto d'amore morboso di entrambe le Editor con le liste), e siamo pronti a gestire ogni imprevisto con la massima determinazione e trasparenza.


[ENG] We've got the whole summer to finish all the comics and illustrations we haven't yet finished (but you'll get to see throughout the campaign a bit of what's been completed already), and we'll have everything printed and ready by early fall! All the contributors are professionals, used to delivering high quality work on precise deadlines.

We already know not only where we'll print the volume, but also how to get all the extra perks to you, from the pins to the posters.

Yes, it's the first time we embark on such a project, but we do it supported by expert friends and with a careful plan (borne of the Editors' obsession with lists and organization). We're ready to deal with any setbacks with determination and transparency.

Frequently Asked Questions:

[IT] 

I perk 'The Early Wizard Gets The Tome' e 'The Tome' sembrano uguali!

Lo sono, ma il primo è per i maghetti furbi che vogliono approfittare di una super promozione, solo per Indiegogo: Grimorio, a €12!

I perk 'The Early Sorcerer' e 'The Sorcerer's Package' sembrano uguali!

Stesso discorso che per The Tome: approfittatene, qui la promozione è su soli 25 pacchetti!

Nella descrizione di 'The Early Sorcerer' si parla delle reward di 'Your Own Grimoire'...

Un'interferenza con la bacchetta: intendevamo 'Your Complete Grimoire', ahimé non si possono effettuare modifiche sui perk a campagna iniziata e non possiamo correggere l'errore.

Ho preso [qualunque perk che non sia 'The Early Wizard Gets the Tome/The Tome'] ma mi fa pagare la spedizione, io voglio ritirarlo a Lucca!

A Lucca non avremo tutto il merchandising extra che vedete qui nel Crowdfunding, quindi l'unico perk che si può ritirare lì, o nei pick up point di Roma e Milano, è 'The Tome' o la sua versione scontata 'Early Wizard'.

Tutti gli altri dovranno venir spediti a casa vostra da fidi gufi! Ma non temete, questo avverrà subito dopo Lucca Comics. SE ci tenete molto a ritirare il volume a Lucca, potete indicarlo nel form che vi spediremo via email, da compilare a fine campagna: alla fiera potrete prendere il solo volume, e vi spediremo tutte le altre cose incluse nel perk dopo la fiera.

Ho preso 'The Early Wizard Gets the Tome/The Tome' ma non lo devo ritirare, lo voglio ricevere a casa, e non mi fa selezionare 'Shipping' insieme!

Basta prendere prima una perk, poi aprire di nuovo la pagina della campagna, e prendere l'altra.

Ho preso 'The Early Wizard Gets the Tome/The Tome', posso avere la dedica sulla mia copia?

Per le dediche vere e proprie su un foglio a parte abbiamo dei perk appositi, quindi per correttezza verso chi li acquista la risposta è che di certo una dedica schizzata dentro il libro, in Fiera è sacra: ma sarà appunto uno schizzo veloce!

[ENG]

The perks 'The Early Wizard Gets The Tome' and 'The Tome' look the same!

They are, the first is an early bird version exclusive to this crowdfunding and limited to 70 spots (with half gone already), a super promotion: Grimorio at €12 only!

The perks 'The Early Sorcerer' e 'The Sorcerer's Package' look the same!

Same deal as for The Tome: take advantage, only 25 spots available for this!

In the description of the perk ‘The Early Sorcerer' it mentions the reward of the perk 'Your Own Grimoire', that isn’t there...

A wrong touch of the wand: we meant 'Your Complete Grimoire', alas we can’t edit perks after the campaign begins so we’ll have to stick with the mistake.

I bought [any perk that isn’t 'The Early Wizard Gets the Tome/The Tome'] but it makes me pay for shipping, I want to pick it up in Lucca/Rome/Milan!

We won’t have all the extra merch you see here, at the Lucca Con, so the only perk you can pick up there (or at the two major italian cities) is ‘The Tome’ or its Early Bird version. Everything else will be delivered swiftly to you by owl right after Lucca Comics. BUT if you really want to get the book at Lucca Con, just write so in the form we'll send to you after the campaign is over: we'll bring your copy to the con, but we'll still send you the rest of the rewards after the Con.

I got the 'The Early Wizard Gets the Tome/The Tome' perk, but I don’t want to pick it up and it won’t let me select the ‘Shipping’ perk at the same time!

You just have to take one perk first, then open up the campaign page again, and take the other: one after another, not together.

I got the 'The Early Wizard Gets the Tome/The Tome' perk, may I have a drawing on my copy?

We have special perks for full drawing, so to be fair to other backers, we’ll surely make a quick doodle for you in your copy at Lucca/at the presentations in Rome and Milan, but that’s all it’ll be: a quick doodle!


[IT] Potete aiutare Grimorio a vedere la luce lanciando un semplice incantesimo: parlandone con i vostri colleghi, o durante l'incontro del vostro club del libro, o anche più semplicemente condividendo questa pagina sui social media.

[ENG] You can help Grimorio come to be by casting a simple spell: talk about it with your coworkers, during your book club, or even easier...share this page on your social media.

Facebook: facebook.com/grimorio.antologia

Tumblr: grimorioanthology.tumblr.com

Twitter: @grimorio_comic

Instagram: @grimorio.anthology


In Partnership with:
story_txt:
[IT] Grimorio è 100 pagine di fumetti e illustrazioni  da 20+ artisti sulla Stregoneria. Venti e più visioni dello stregato, dell'occulto, diverse da quelle che troverete in qualunque altro luogo, selezionate e impaginate per voi da Ariel Vittori e Laura Guglielmo. 





[ENG] Grimorio is 100 pages of comics and illustrations on Witchcraft by 20+ artists. More than twenty different takes on the occult, the bewitched, unlike any other you'll find, accurately selected for you by Ariel Vittori and Laura Guglielmo.


[IT] Ariel ha già partecipato ad antologie internazionali (Food Porn) e lavora con fumetto e illustrazione da più di tre anni. Ha conosciuto Laura alla Bologna Children's Book Fair di due anni fa, innamorandosi delle sue storie. Laura stessa, oltre ad essere scrittrice sopraffina, lavora disegnando tra le altre cose per videogiochi, animazione, giochi da tavolo. 

Si sono trovate a sviluppare insieme una storia stregata, e con tanta voglia di raccontarla. Si sono chieste, 'Quanti altri avranno voglia di gridare una storia, senza avere un luogo in cui farla ascoltare? Quanti vorranno tracciare il segno di come vedono la stregoneria, tra le pagine del Grimorio con copertina esclusiva di Antonio de Luca (Warner Bros, Riot Games) e Mirko Failoni (Spectrum 23)?' Ed eccoli, tutti, o quasi... Dovremo pur svelarvi ancora altri misteri!

Nei prossimi giorni getteremo luce su ognuno di loro, parlando del loro lavoro per l'Antologia e fuori, quindi continuate a seguire la sezione degli aggiornamenti qui sulla nostra pagina e sugli altri social.





[ENG] Ariel has already partecipated in international anthologies (Food Porn) and she's been working with comics and illustrations for more than three years. She met Laura at Bologna Children's Book Fair two years ago and fell in love with her stories. Laura isn't just an amazing writer but an illustrator herself, working in the game and animation industry.
They had this witchy story, and they so wanted to tell it. So they wondered, 'How many others must have magical stories like this and no place to share them? How many would like to trace their vision of witchcraft in the pages of a Grimoire, with an exclusive cover by Mirko Failoni (Spectrum 23) and Antonio de Luca (Warner Bros, Riot Games)?'. Here they are, all of them... or almost. We simply must keep some mystery still!

With illustrations by:

Alice Girlanda, Astrid Lucchesi, Fabio Mancini, Giopota, Isabella Mazzanti, Romina Moranelli, Susanna Rumiz

[UPDATE] Arianna Robustelli, Nicolò Pellizzon and Flavia Biondi will be contributing as guests with 3 amazing prints included in perks from 40€ up, while Julia Sardà will be joining us with an illustration included in the book!




And Comics by:

Ariel Vittori, Eleonora Bruni, Freddie Tanto, Greta Xella, Laura Guglielmo, Laura Vivacqua, Monica Sangermano, Morena Forza, Noemi de Maio, Silvia Vanni, Sumi, Tessa Black.




 [IT] Abbiamo bisogno del vostro aiuto per rendere Grimorio palpabile. Noi ci mettiamo tutta la nostra magia ed energia: ora tocca a voi.
La maggior parte dei fondi ci aiuterà a stampare il volume (€1800). Una parte andrà alle tasse di Paypal e Indiegogo (€350), un'altra parte ci servirà per lo spazio di esordio in Self Area a Lucca Comics&Games 2016 (€300). Il resto ci permetterà di coprire le spese promozionali e pagare i collaboratori esterni alla Congrega. Ah, e di realizzare gli altri meravigliosi Perk, ovviamente! 




[ENG] We need your help to make Grimorio real: we're putting all our magic and energy into it: now it's up to you. 
Most of the funds will go towards printing the volume (€1800). We'll need €300 to buy the table at Lucca Comics & Games, then 10% goes towards Indiegogo and Paypal fees. Everything else will let us cover marketing expenses, pay collaborators... and, oh, make all the other wonderful rewards of course!




[UPDATE: NEW PERK! SPECIAL COMBO PACK WITH POErtraits Crowdfunding]



POErtraits  - Portraits of Edgar Allan Poe
[IT] Come trasformare il più cupo e triste scrittore della letteratura americana in un personaggio ironico e divertente?
Semplice, basta fargli un ritratto. Anzi 100!
Cos'è un POErtrait? E' la caricatura di Edgar Allan Poe disegnata da Marco Rocchi. Ma non solo... E' una divertente ed originale illustrazione che miscela Edgar Allan Poe con giochi di parole e cultura pop.
Il libro conterrà 100 di queste caricature, 100 POErtraits, e gli aPOEcrypha, ritratti di Edgar Allan Poe realizzati da altri artisti.
[ENG] How to turn the darkest and saddest writer of american literature into an ironic and funny character?
Simple, just drawing him a portrait. Or even better... 100 POErtraits!
What is a POErtrait? It is an Edgar Allan Poe caricature drawn by Marco Rocchi. But that's not all... It is a funny and original illustration that blend Edgar Allan Poe with puns and pop culture.
The book will contain 100 of these caricatures, 100 POErtraits, and the aPOEcrypha, Edgar Allan Poe's portraits created from other artists.


[IT] Per vedere le vostre perk più da vicino, sfogliate la gallery: troverete anche delle anteprime dalle pagine del nostro Grimorio!
Importante: per la perk 'THE TOME' da €15 - e il corrispettivo Early Bird da €12 -, SE volete riceverlo a casa, dovrete selezionare anche la perk 'SHIPPING' successivamente.  Altrimenti potrete ritirare la vostra copia al Lucca Comics&Games 2016, o presso i nostri punti amici a Roma (Hula Hoop Club) e Milano (Ostello Bello Milan Hotel).
         

       
        
                            
               
               

[ENG] Check out the Gallery to see the perks up close AND more previews of the inside of the book!

IMPORTANT: The physical book is available in italian only, for now. If you wish to pick up the perks 'THE TOME' and its early bird version, and you want the book to be delivered to you, you''ll have to select the 'SHIPPING' perk as well - unless you can pick up the book at Lucca Comics&Games Convention 2016, or at our pick up points in Rome (Hula Hoop Club) and Milan (Ostello Bello Milan Hotel).

[UPDATES!]

In Partnership with:

story:
L'Ultima Terra

Dicembre 2015: sulla pagina Facebook "PK - L'Ultima Terra" comincia l'odissea tra supereroi e superproblemi di Paperino. Un'incredibile minaccia, la più spaventosa mai vista prima, un giornalista pronto a svelare l'identità segreta di PK e un Super Pippo confuso e pronto a menar le mani. 
Questo e molto altro nel Fan Comic scritto da Roberto Diglio e disegnato da Paride Prete, in collaborazione con  Lorenzo Barba per i colori, fumetto che in pochi giorni ha invaso gli schermi di migliaia di Pkers appassionati e sfegatati.
Al momento sono usciti il prologo, i primi due atti e due tie-in per un totale di più di 100 pagine a colori. Gli autori sono al lavoro sul terzo atto, in uscita ad ottobre.

Pikabbufo

Dicembre 2014: sulla pagina Facebook "Pikappa Official" cominciano le appassionanti vignette di Jacopo Mistura, ibrido tra il personaggio di Alfredo Castelli "L'Omino Bufo" e il personaggio di PK. Mistura ripropone le storie principali del papero mascherato in chiave comica e irriverente, ottenendo subito successo tra i fan.
Al momento è al lavoro sull'ultima, incredibile, saga del suo personaggio: "Pikabbufo R.I.P.".

L'Ultima Terra... Bufa!

Ogni vero Pkers sa che "estate" non significa mare, divertimento e caldo ma "Speciale Estivo"! Un volume speciale che ogni compagno di classe invidiava, motivo di ricerche forsennate alle fiere fumettistiche. Tante storie, create dai migliori artisti del PK Team, per il godimento dei veri fan.
Il Team dell'Ultima Terra e Jacopo Mistura si sono incontrati e hanno, durante un momento di pazzia generale, deciso di solcare la stessa onda che invase i mari italiani tanti anni fa: creare uno speciale estivo tutto nuovo e per la prima volta STAMPATO SU CARTA!

La storia

Ci sono diversi problemi in casa Karisma. Eterno giunge dai figli con una notizia catastrofica: una terra è riuscita a conquistare la libertà. 
Un nuovo figlio, una nuova missione: riconquistare Terra-B.
I Karisma dovranno però fare i conti con... Pikabbufo!

Cos'è il crowd-funding

Per la prima volta i personaggi de L'Ultima Terra e di Pikabbufo saranno stampati su carta. Un VERO fumetto! Per farlo, però, gli autori dovranno affrontare diverse spese di produzione che abbiamo deciso di finanziare con il crowd-funding, un moderno sistema di donazioni.
Si tratta di una campagna FLESSIBILE: significa che anche se non raggiungeremo 500€ raccolti, chiunque avrà donato riceverà l'oggetto promesso!
Chiediamo quindi ai lettori un piccolo contributo, ovviamente con grandi sorprese!

Cosa e quali sono i Perk

Per ogni donazione guadagnerete un regalo da parte nostra! Questi sono chiamati Perk.

1€                  = Digitale + Sfondo
2€ + sped   = Stampato
3€ + sped   = Stampato + Digitale + Sfondo
5€ + sped   = Stampato + Digitale + Sfondo + Menzione nella pagina dei ringraziamenti
10€ + sped = Stampato + Digitale + Sfondo + Menzione nella pagina dei ringraziamenti + Stampa Antares (Solo 20!)

Come aiutarci

Beh, ovviamente donando! Non ti preoccupare, è tutto sicuro! 
Se non puoi donare, beh, allora spargi la voce, ci sarai d'aiuto lo stesso!

Ogni vero Pkers sa che "estate" non significa mare, divertimento e caldo ma "Speciale Estivo"! Un volume speciale che ogni compagno di classe invidiava, motivo di ricerche forsennate alle fiere fumettistiche. Tante storie, create dai migliori artisti del PK Team, per il godimento dei veri fan.Il Team dell'Ultima Terra e Jacopo Mistura si sono incontrati e hanno, durante un momento di pazzia generale, deciso di solcare la stessa onda che invase i mari italiani tanti anni fa: creare uno speciale estivo tutto nuovo e per la prima volta STAMPATO SU CARTA!
La storia

Ci sono diversi problemi in casa Karisma. Eterno giunge dai figli con una notizia catastrofica: una terra è riuscita a conquistare la libertà. Un nuovo figlio, una nuova missione: riconquistare Terra-B.I Karisma dovranno però fare i conti con... Pikabbufo!
Cos'è il crowd-funding

Per la prima volta i personaggi de L'Ultima Terra e di Pikabbufo saranno stampati su carta. Un VERO fumetto! Per farlo, però, gli autori dovranno affrontare diverse spese di produzione che abbiamo deciso di finanziare con il crowd-funding, un moderno sistema di donazioni.Si tratta di una campagna FLESSIBILE: significa che anche se non raggiungeremo 500€ raccolti, chiunque avrà donato riceverà l'oggetto promesso!Chiediamo quindi ai lettori un piccolo contributo, ovviamente con grandi sorprese!
Cosa e quali sono i Perk
Per ogni donazione guadagnerete un regalo da parte nostra! Questi sono chiamati Perk.1€                  = Digitale + Sfondo2€ + sped   = Stampato3€ + sped   = Stampato + Digitale + Sfondo5€ + sped   = Stampato + Digitale + Sfondo + Menzione nella pagina dei ringraziamenti10€ + sped = Stampato + Digitale + Sfondo + Menzione nella pagina dei ringraziamenti + Stampa Antares (Solo 20!)
Come aiutarci

Beh, ovviamente donando! Non ti preoccupare, è tutto sicuro! Se non puoi donare, beh, allora spargi la voce, ci sarai d'aiuto lo stesso!

story:
Forced to create genetically modified bioweapons for an archaic occult organization, Dr. Albert Vogel inadvertently succeeds at discovering the means to unlock the limits of human potential. He attempts to conceal his revelation but ends up arousing the suspicion of his oppressors, who now believe the doctor is withholding that which they desperately desire.

Saaya Volkova, Vogel’s niece, is forcefully abducted and used as leverage. She is critically injured and Vogel has no choice but to inject his niece with the perfected formula to save her life. The mutagen transforms Saaya’s body, increasing her skeletal and muscular density, granting her incredible strength and resilience. She also gains the ability to fly and a unique power to absorb and manipulate biokinetic concussive force!

Before she can fully adapt to her body and her newly acquired power, Saaya fights back in a desperate attempt to escape from the clutches of her captors. But even if she and her uncle manage to survive, how long will it take for the agents of chaos to track them down, and just how far does this organization’s influence extend?

Greetings!

I'm Keung Lee! Thanks so much for taking the time to check out my passion project, Battle Maiden Knuckle Bomb! I've been reading both domestic comics and manga since I was young. I now have the opportunity and the time to dedicate to the development of my own comic that blurs the lines between the two styles of comics.

BMKB is a comic harkening back to older comics and manga that I grew up enjoying. This series will offer some slice of life comedy and drama combined with fast and hard-hitting super-powered martial arts action with a flair of pro wrestling thrown in for good measure! You'll be introduced to a full cast of characters and exposed to terrifying, monstrous mutations and bioweapons!

This book is intended for YA Readers, young adults ages 13+ as it contains oppai, violence, pantsu, suggestive themes, grotesque mutations, women with curves, use of tobacco, concealed raging boners, more oppai, partial nudity and strong language. Most of these will be featured in issue #1, the others will make their way into the series sooner rather than later.

 

Campaign Goal

This campaign has a fixed goal of $3,000 to produce the first and only print run of the Indiegogo-exclusive first edition of Battle Maiden Knuckle Bomb #1! The digital version of this comic will become available after the printed comics have made their way to their respective backers.

STRETCH GOALS

$10,000 GOAL REACHED! - Four additional  pages of supplemental material, containing production sketches, notes and teaser content for future issues!

$20,000 GOAL REACHED! - Trading Card! Each Backer will receive one trading card with their comic(s).

$30,000 GOAL REACHED! - Giclée Pin Up Print! Each Backer will receive an exclusive 6x9 inch signed print of Knuckle Bomb pin up art with their comic(s).

$40,000 STRETCH GOAL - Guest Artist Pin Up page!

story:
... det går fortfarande att stötta den och få alla fantastiska perks som vi lade till under kampanjen! Den 20:e november stänger vi dock kampanjen för gott, så vill du ha alla dessa bonussaker så gäller det att passa på! Vi postar ut allt innan 14:e december så att de kommer till er innan jul!

Här ser ni den kompletta sammanställningen av alla bonussaker som ni får om ni backar kampanjen:

Sword Princess Amaltea är en svensk manga-serie, skapad av Natalia Batista som också skapat serierna Mjau! och Sjöjungfrun Minna.

Serien publicerades mellan 2013-2015 i Sverige och har sedan dess även utkommit i USA, Tyskland, Italien och Tjeckien samt även blivit rollspel!

Serien handlar om prinsessan Amaltea som lever i en matriarkalisk sagovärld. Där är det drottningarna som styr och prinsessorna blir utsända att rädda prinsar i nöd och gifta sig med dem. Amaltea räddar prins Ossian, som dock inte vill vara prins i denna sexistiska värld, och tillsammans får de uppleva äventyr på sin resa tillbaka till hans moders slott. Banditbrudar, en förförisk servitör och en drakridande häxa förföljer dem på deras färd i denna könsomvända fantasyberättelse. Humor, action och äventyr blandas i denna satir över hur vårt eget samhälle behandlar kvinnor och män olika.
Läs några kapitel på engelska här: www.SwordPrincessAmaltea.com

Det finns även en lärarhandledning för att läsa Sword Princess Amaltea i klassrummet och använda den i undervisningen, skriven av Helga Boström.

Nosebleed Studio är idag Sveriges främsta mangaförlag och mangatecknarstudio. Vi ger ut svenskproducerad manga för unga läsare såväl som läsare av alla åldrar som vill hitta något nytt som inte kommer från Japan. Studion grundades 2006 och förlaget bildades 2011 av oss mangatecknare själva. Idag består den av sex medlemmar:

  • Natalia Batista, skaparen av Sword Princess Amaltea, Mjau! och Sjöjungfrun Minna.
  • Magnolia Winroth, skaparen av serien Uriah på WEBTOON.
  • Joakim Waller, skaparen av serien Penguin Rumble.
  • Alice Engström, som tecknar hästmanga för serietidningen Min Häst.
  • Catarina Batista, som tecknat för Folktandvården Skåne.
  • Elise Rosberg, som skrivit Lär dig teckna manga! - Karaktärsdesign.

Trilogin Sword Princess Amaltea har i skrivande stund sålt drygt 9000 exemplar, och de senaste upplagorna börjar ta slut. Vi vill fortsätta hålla serien tillgänglig för läsare, för vi har under dessa sex åren sedan första boken kom ut fått se och höra om hur mycket den betyder för läsarna. Denna berättelse som lyfter tjejer och visar hur en värld kan se ut där makten mellan könen är omvänd, har både skapat tankeväckande samtal såväl som inspiration för de unga läsarna att själva skapa världar som bryter mot normer och vad vi är vana vid. Den uppskattas av både vuxna och barn och vi hoppas att med denna samlingsbok nå ut till ännu fler läsare.

Våra mål är att:

  • Trycka en fin hårdpärmsbok som samlar hela serien.
  • Trycka boken på det miljövänliga tryckeriet Lenanders Grafiska i Kalmar.
  • Inkludera bonusmaterial om hur Natalia skapade serien, med både text, foton och skisser från arbetsprocessen.
  • Göra boken så lyxig som möjligt, se Stretch Goals nedan.
  • Se till att leverera boken till er som stödjer projektet innan 20 december!
  • Få ut boken i bokhandel och till bibliotek landet över.

Vi i Nosebleed Studio kommer lägga in 80 000 kr själva i detta projekt. Vad vi skulle behöva din hjälp med är de där extra pengarna som behövs för att göra boken extra lyxig. Därför har vi lagt upp en rad Stretch Goals, alltså mål på vägen mot den mest lyxiga bok vi någonsin skapat!

Här kan du se lite mer om de olika nivåerna som du kan stödja detta projektet på.

På första nivån dubbas du till Knight och får hela boken som PDF via mail för 100 kr.

På andra nivån tillägnas du titeln Shield Maiden och får både den tryckta boken samt PDF:en via mail för 350 kr.

På tredje nivån föräras du titeln Sword Princess och får boken signerad, PDF:en via mail samt en signerad, svartvit originalteckning i A6-format föreställande Amaltea, tecknad av Natalia Batista för 500 kr. PLUS ROLLSPELSBOKEN GRATIS!

På fjärde nivån kröns du till Queen of Magic och får boken signerad, PDF:en via mail samt en signerad, svartvit originalteckning i A4-format föreställande Amaltea, tecknad av Natalia Batista för 1000 kr. PLUS ROLLSPELSBOKEN GRATIS!

På femte nivån har du tillskansat dig titeln Dragon Mistress och får boken signerad, PDF:en via mail samt en signerad, originalteckning i färg i A4-format föreställande Amaltea, tecknad av Natalia Batista för 1500 kr. PLUS ROLLSPELSBOKEN GRATIS!

På sjätte nivån har du uppnåt titeln Army Commander och får 10 signerade exemplar av boken för 2500 kr. PLUS ROLLSPELSBOKEN GRATIS!

På sjunde nivån har du utnämnts till Dame of Knowledge och får en klassuppsättning på 25 exemplar av boken för 5000 kr. Lärarhandledning finns att ladda ner här. PLUS ROLLSPELSBOKEN GRATIS!

På åttonde nivån uppnår du titeln Lady of Learning och får en klassuppsättning på 25 exemplar av boken samt en workshop/föreläsning på 1 h med skaparen Natalia Batista för 10 000 kr. Resa tillkommer utanför Skåne. Klassuppsättningen kan bytas ut mot ännu en 1 h workshop/föreläsning samt 2 exemplar av boken. Lärarhandledning finns att ladda ner här. PLUS ROLLSPELSBOKEN GRATIS!

Vi har arbetat med att trycka och ge ut böcker i 8 år, och känner oss inte oroliga för att detta projekt skulle bli någon större svårighet. Den största risken är om det skulle bli förseningar hos tryckeriet, men vi har sett till att redan nu boka in hela trycket hos dem så att de står redo när tryckfilen kommer till dem i oktober.

En annan risk är ju om fraktbolaget från tryckeriet eller från oss till er skulle slarva med tiden, eller slarva bort paket, men den risken finns ju tyvärr alltid. Vi kommer göra vårt yttersta för att få iväg paket i så god tid att det inte ska bli något problem att leverera dem till er innan den 20:e december.

Ännu en risk, som vi blygsamt inte tror kommer vara så överhängande, är ju om detta skulle bli en så stor succé att Natalia inte skulle hinna rita klart alla bilderna åt er innan paketen ska skickas. Detta kommer hon motverka genom att börja rita på bilder redan under kampanjen och bygga upp en buffert.

 

Vi hoppas verkligen att du vill vara med och stödja oss i detta projekt!

story:
DANGEROUS CURVES/MAVRIX: ENTER THE DOLLHOUSE is a graphic novel written and illustrated by erotic comic artist, Shade.

Shade is the creator of comics like Sinsationals, Neon Dreams, Rule 34 Megazine #1-3, SuperHeroes After Dark #1-3, Dangerous Curves #1, MAVRIX #1, Dollhouse and others.

$500 - Introductory shower scene added to the story featuring Sylk!

$2,000 - Introductory nude scene added to the story featuring Madame M!

$4,000 - "X-ray" schematic pinup of iDoll included in the comic!

$7,000 - 80s-inspired pinup of some of the Dangerous Curves/MAVRIX girls in 80s fashion included in the comic

A sexy super-spy named SYLK has acquired information pertaining to a dangerous super weapon being created by a mad scientist named DR. KILLGRAVE. Seeing this impending threat, a mysterious and powerful sorceress called MADAME M recruits the members of Dangerous Curves and MAVRIX--two rival superhero teams--to help stop this weapon from being unleashed on the world.

The crowdfunded version of this comic will feature additional UNCENSORED content.

story:
Short Summary

Greetings Indiegogo, let me introduce myself, my name is Ben Lee. I'm a comic creator & publisher here in the heartland of America, and I'm hoping to tell a meaningful story, and I'm hoping you'll help me out!

You can call me a self-publisher, independent publisher, even small press... but however you'd like to call it, I've always noticed that a lot people in this arena always resort to a "hook" to gain an audience, usually involving a mass amount of T&A, but usually comes at the sacrifice of the story.

But I don't want to do that, I simply want to tell stories that have an impact. And I'm hoping to can help me get the work out there. 

The reason why LOST IN THE MIDDLE is so important to me is because, to put it simply, it's personal. Issue one is out in the world, and this whole concept sprung from a moment of racism in my own life, and from there a very personal story came forth. 

And since starting the first issue, I've been committed to seeing this through. Those of you who've read the first issue, I hope you dug it. And if you have, I really think where the story is going will have an impact. At least that's my hope. 

And if you haven't read any of LOST IN THE MIDDLE, I do hope you'll give it a try. You can order the first issue here. This really has been a labor of love, and I hope it finds an audience. 

What We Need & What You Get

So in terms of what I need to raise? Well, that comes to approximately $2000. Now what will that go towards? First and foremost, fulfilling perks. I want to make sure you guys get what I'm promising as a thank you for your support. But the rest? Pretty much accounts for an 800 copy print run, as well as for some light marketing and advertising. 

But I'm sure you're wondering what perks are offered? Well, we got comics of course, then signed comics, prints, and pins! I mean, who doesn't love pins?!!! And honestly, I might surprise the backers with anything else I think of before the campaign ends!

Now if I don't reach my goal, like I said earlier, my priority is to fulfill perks. And if anything is left, that will go to publishing the comic. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know not everyone can contribute to campaigns. But at the very least, if you dig this campaign, if I could ask the favor of sharing this with your family and friends would mean so much!

But more than anything, thanks so much for checking this out! I hope you dug it. 

— Ben Lee

PS

Thank you so much for visiting! And please remember, EVERY little bit helps. Be it a share, or a $1. It all helps!

Thank you so much!

And since starting the first issue, I've been committed to seeing this through. Those of you who've read the first issue, I hope you dug it. And if you have, I really think where the story is going will have an impact. At least that's my hope. 
And if you haven't read any of LOST IN THE MIDDLE, I do hope you'll give it a try. You can order the first issue here. This really has been a labor of love, and I hope it finds an audience. 

What We Need & What You Get
So in terms of what I need to raise? Well, that comes to approximately $2000. Now what will that go towards? First and foremost, fulfilling perks. I want to make sure you guys get what I'm promising as a thank you for your support. But the rest? Pretty much accounts for an 800 copy print run, as well as for some light marketing and advertising. 
But I'm sure you're wondering what perks are offered? Well, we got comics of course, then signed comics, prints, and pins! I mean, who doesn't love pins?!!! And honestly, I might surprise the backers with anything else I think of before the campaign ends!
Now if I don't reach my goal, like I said earlier, my priority is to fulfill perks. And if anything is left, that will go to publishing the comic. 

Other Ways You Can Help
I know not everyone can contribute to campaigns. But at the very least, if you dig this campaign, if I could ask the favor of sharing this with your family and friends would mean so much!
But more than anything, thanks so much for checking this out! I hope you dug it. 
— Ben Lee
PS
Thank you so much for visiting! And please remember, EVERY little bit helps. Be it a share, or a $1. It all helps!
Thank you so much!

story:
WHAT IS L.A. INK STAINS PROM NIGHT?

To celebrate the release of his "Los Angeles Ink Stains"  collection from Image Comics, pop artist extraordinaire Jim Mahfood is hosting "Los Angeles Ink Stains Prom Night" on Saturday, June 16 at Titmouse Animation Studios. Come party with the entire cast of the Ink Stains comics! The illest music! Booze! Funk! A Taco Truck! And of course Food One will be on-hand with the rest of the gang to sign your Ink Stains book!  7pm - ?  

 

CAN I BUY TICKETS AT THE DOOR?

Pre-Sale tickets are highly encouraged via indiegogo.com, but there will be a limited number of tickets at the door.


HOW CAN I GET A FREE BOOK?

We need volunteers! Email JaneDope@gmail.com to score a spot on the prom committee! We need reliable people to work the door, merch booth and bar. You'll receive a signed copy of the book! How rad is that!?


DO I REALLY HAVE TO RENT A TUXEDO?

No. A suit and tie will do. Hell even a tuxedo t-shirt, suit jacket and chucks will work. Ladies, have fun with this! Anything from simple cocktail dresses to ball gowns. Whatever you show up in, make sure it's Black, White, or Grey! Get into the spirit people!

 

CAN I PURCHASE A BOOK AT THE EVENT?

There will be a limited number of books at the merch booth. Plus, some other totally exciting, top-secret merch that we ain't gonna tell you about right here. You have to show up to see what it is!

 

IS THIS EVENT ALL AGES?

This event is 18+. Anyone under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. 21+ to drink. You will be asked to show I.D. at the door.

 

WILL I GET LUCKY?

If you play your cards right.

 

WHY SUCH A HIGH GOAL AMOUNT?

This number is simply based on venue capacity and quantity/price of books.
This goal does not need to be met for the party to take place.

CAN I RUN FOR PROM KING/QUEEN?

YES! You can submit your own name or a friend's, in the ballot boxes provided.
Winners will be chosen at random and crowned at 11pm.

story:
A teenage girl learns she carries a power thought to be lost to the world. With that power, she has to protect her friends & home while learning the truth behind her powers and her own life.

Campaign News: Thanks to everyone who joined our stream! No idea if we'll have another one before our campaign ends on Saturday. If a lot of people ask for it, we'll work it out. Just leave a comment on this page if you want another stream.


As a note for potential backers. we've come across a problem with Paypal donations regarding Paypal's fees. As such, we'd like to ask that if you're going to donate less than $15, please do so only by credit card. If you can only use Paypal, please consider donating at least $15. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. Note this isn't a requirement, only a request.


Snowbound is the story of Yukino Maeda, a Japanese teenager who lives in a world where it doesn't snow! One day, though, Yukino learns that she has the power to create and control snow! At the same time, her home becomes overrun with creatures known as daemons (day-mons). Once beings that helped humans in the shadows, they now cause mischief and trouble for the city. It's up to Yukino to stop them and find out why they're being drawn to her home.

This is a serial comic, styled like Japanese comics often referred to as manga and based in Toronto, Canada.  While it carries references from three stories that helped inspire it (Sailor Moon, Cardcaptor Sakura and My-HiME), it works to twist these elements into something that carries a touch of nostalgia and yet, thanks to a story that tries to reshape the idea of how our world works and how the actions of people can affect it, feels new and fresh. Each character is designed to not just feel unique to each other but to feel real to readers, to make them think they are actual people because, to an extent, they are! Most of the main cast of characters are based around actual people, often named for them and sharing aspects like similar personalities, similar interests or similar ways of thinking even if their behavior might be different.

Each issue/chapter of the comic is about 45 pages long, compared to the average 20 pages found in Japanese comics.


Page 10 from the manga.

Want to see more? Scroll down or go here to see the full preview of the manga here!

Can't read on deviantART? Try this link instead!


Drew Byrne - The writer and creator of Snowbound, Drew, going by the alias hythrain, is an amateur writer trying to prove himself in the writing world. For the past four years he's worked hard to improve himself and make a name as an independent comic writer; Snowbound is the result of his efforts thus far. With the support of the artists, all of whom have shown great enthusiasm for the project, and his friends, Drew is putting himself out there to try and prove that he can tango with the big boys of comics.

Anna Tsocheva - Anna, otherwise known as Rikae, is a freelance illustrator and comic artist based in Sofia, Bulgaria. Since 2003, she's worked on numerous short story comics of varying success. She has a huge love for art, always open to changing and experimenting for new results. Snowbound is her first large scale project, and she's very excited to be able to work on it. -

Rachel Marks - A very versatile freelance artist, Rachel has 12 years of work history ranging from character design and 2D animation to comic books and video games. She's the Art Director and co-owner of indie game development house, Bang Bang Attack Studios, and has been a great supporter of Snowbound since the team was first formed. You can find more of her work on her deviantART account, FalyneVarger.

Laurie Thomas - Currently a student of Ringling College of Art and Design where she pursues a major in Illustration and a minor in Visual Development, Laurie "Cetriya" Thomas has a huge body of works including paintings, illustrations, product design and several self published books. Her work has been shown at various galleries, Madeby Boutique, and even in games.


A so-called "rough" version of our limited edition 12x18 poster print (As stated by the artist, Finni). If this is suppose to be rough, can you imagine what it'll look like when finished?!


The idea of the campaign is to help jump start the comic's production which, not surprisingly, costs a lot of money. While the comic will be produced regardless of the success of this campaign, the pace will be much slower without your support. Every bit of money we raise, after the service fees and reward costs, goes straight to producing pages. Our target goal of $3500 gets the first chapter completed. After that, we need to raise an additional $3500 plus $500 to make each future chapter. This means we'd need a total of $17,000 to complete a full volume.

It takes as little as $5. If every person who saw this gave just $5, we'd hit our goal in no time!




Q. How often do you plan to release chapters?

A. That depends on our success here. At the top end, if this campaign is an overwhelming success then we could look into doing up to seven chapters a year along with perhaps one to two chapters of a sidestory. (At 45 pages on average per chapter, this is 360 to 405 pages). However, if the opposite were to happen and we absolutely bomb, we'll likely begin at only one chapter a year. This is the key thing: the more success, both in funding and in exposure, the more we can make not just now but in the future.

More questions to be added in the future.



Here's the first 11 pages of the manga, for you to check out!

story:
Special Announcement!

Our $10 level has been a HUGE hit up here at Emerald City Comic Con, so I wanted to make sure to highlight it right up top here.  For a $10 donation,  you get to suggest ANY line of dialogue, and I will find some way to work it into the strip.  Check the comments section for what some people have come up with so far.

Our Story

Searnold here - writer of "Behind the Hero" and now "Behind the Hero - The Webcomic!"  Along with artist John McDowell we're going to be bringing you a weekly dose of funny with characters that are as silly as they are super.

If you enjoy a good laugh, we'd love your support!

You can see the first 10 strips in the gallery section to get an idea of what "Behind the Hero" will look like on the internets.  Plus, if you're not familiar with the characters, you can read the original comic book for FREE on my website:

http://www.SuperSearnold.com/BehindTheHero01.php

The Impact

Want social impact?  They say laughter is the best medicine.  If we raise enough money, we can cure the whole world!

What We Need & What You Get

Creating "Behind the Hero - The Webcomic" costs about $10 per strip.  So our goal is to raise $520 in order to create a year's worth of weekly strips.

Of course, if we raise more, we can create more content!

And we'll never leave you empty handed - every donation comes with free prizes!  (Read the right side of the page for details.)

But we're also doing something special: you can buy any level multiple times.  Want to suggest 5 lines of dialogue?  Donate $50 and just mention that you want 5 "$10 Prizes."

Want us to turn you AND your best friend into comic book characters?  Donate $100 and get double of EVERY prize!

Other Ways You Can Help

Where would we be without our fans?  Don't forget that spreading the word can be just as helpful as giving money (though less prize-filled.)  Like us on Facebook.  Share a link to this site.  And tell all your friends that you want to see more "Behind the Hero!"
The link should be easy to spread around.  It's just www.BehindTheHero.com.

story:
Who the heck is this weirdo?

I'm Hannah Lee Stockdale, and I'm an illustrator from southeast Michigan. I just graduated from college this past May, so in natural post-American college fashion, money is pretty tight for me right now! I love visual storytelling and comics and love meeting people who create just as much. The lousy thing about the midwest is that it's pretty sparse in terms of great opportunities for illustrators and comic folks alike. I rely very heavily on the internet for networking and work, but that can only go so far! Traveling costs a pretty penny, and while I've spent the past few months out of school trying to scrounge up cash through commissions and sending my app to every Staples and Gamestop in metro-Detroit, it hasn't been enough. 

I am hoping to make it out to Bethesda, Maryland in September to attend the Small Press Expo. Getting the chance to connect with people (in real life!) and to share my portfolio of work will help me along in my career exponentially. 

My plans are to create a short comic that serves as a sort of intro or "pilot" to a longer story I have been planning for a few months now. It's a story about Anita, a jaded girl who's too close to the cusp of adulthood to be considered a teenager anymore, and the secrets she finds in the forest behind her house. Up until now, I've done only comics of the autobiographical variety and I would love to stretch my muscles into new territory! If all goes according to plan, I will have it printed and all primped and pretty to hand out to folks at SPX! (and to the lovely folks who donated but couldn't make it to SPX)

Why, you ask? 

The costs will cover travel to and from Maryland, printing of the comic, and other supplies needed for the perk rewards.

I plan on driving to MD from MI, and a rough estimate from here tells me that fuel will cost around $130 round trip.  The other costs include hotel fees, money for printing the comic itself, and shipping costs for those with rewards needing that. (the more money I can get, the fancier everything will be!)

 

The Impact

Like I said earlier, I don't get a whole lot in the way of job prospects around my neck of the woods! And this combined with the glorious post-grad money woes and anxiety, I know that missing out on such a great opportunity that is SPX would only slow me down! The magic of the world-wide-web can only help me so far.

I've been in love with comics, graphic novels, webcomics, etc, for years now, and they have been such an inspiration to me personally. It's a big deal for me to try and be a part of the thing that's inspired me so much. 

Dangit Hannah, I'm broke too!

That's totally okay, you can join the club! We'll get silly hats from the dollar store and everything. It'll be the coolest support group ever. 

If you still want to help someway, you can help spread the word, be that through Tumblr, Twitter, Facebook, Xanga, Neopets, what have you! Any bit helps and it all means the world to me.  

Thank you very much! <3

story:
Short Summary:

Hello, My name is Rob Skiba. I have been a documentary filmmaker since 1994. This has had the effect of making me into a researcher. By that I mean I RE-search that which has already been searched by others before me. It has become a passionate hobby of mine, which has resulted in the development of a web series called SEED. The above trailer is a concept animation for that series, which will be shot in live action. Here is a brief synopsis of this story:

Think: Lost meets Battlestar Galactica, wrapped up in an X-File.

In 33A.D., Jesus Christ prophesied that the Last Days would be like the days of Noah.

In December of 2002, an advanced party special operations team was sent to Iraq looking for weapons of mass destruction. But what they found was far worse than any conventional weaponry.

Cpt. Zak Randall and his team inadvertently discover the cave of Dudael and all hell breaks loose. Zak's team gets wiped out, but he survives with the help of a mysterious Bedouin who transports him through time and space from the desert of Iraq in 2002 to the desert of Arizona in 2010.

Zak's quest for answers begins here, at the beginning... of the end.

Project Status:

SEED is currently being developed as both a (TV ready) live action web series as well as fictional novel series. Now, we are trying to create it as a graphic novel series to go along with it. Part of the reason for this is so that we can use the profits to help completely self-fund the web series. It is essential for us to be self-funded because:

  • Going through a network/studio usually means compromising the vision.
  • Investors will want to control content.
  • Networks/studios will censor content.
  • Networks/studios can cancel a series prematurely and own the rights, which effectively can kill a project.
  • We have a big vision for 72 episodes, and we are not willing to compromise in order to achieve it. This means we must do everything we can to retain complete creative control.
  • If you are sick and tired of the same-old, same-old, and hate it when your favorite TV shows keep getting cancelled prematurely (sometimes on a season end cliff-hanger), we are putting the control in you, the audience's hands.

One of the ways we can become both self-funded as well as reach a broader market is through projects like this. Graphic novels and comic books are very popular, even amongst adults. And we've been able to determine that each 1 hour web series script for SEED will essentially translate to 6 individual comic book issues, which will then get packaged together into a thick graphic novel. Thus, each episode of SEED will generate 7 products that can be sold in order to help fund the web series as well as get the story out through another popular market.

What We Need:

We already have enough written content right now to produce 12 comic book issues and two graphic novels, with more written content on the way. Thus, we need your help to raise a minimum of $15,000. This will:

  • Enable us to hire the writers, artists and staff needed to do this right.
  • Enable us to do a limited print run for promotional purposes.
  • Help us to kick-start the promotions for both the web series as well as the fictional novel series.

What You Get:

  • Once the graphic novel is done, anyone who contributes $33 or more will receive a FREE digital copy in PDF format.
  • People who contribute a minimum of $111 will get the above plus credit on our SEED graphic novel web site (currently in development).
  • People who contribute a minimum of $222 will get the above plus credit in the graphic novel as well.
  • People who contribute $444 or more will get the above and also have the option of being drawn into the graphic novel as an "extra" in the story.
  • People who contribute $777 or more will get the above and also have the option of being "cast" into the story as a "bit part" (short speaking scene).
  • People who contribute more than $1,000 will get all of the above, plus an autographed hardcopy of the graphic novel.

If we do not reach our entire goal of $15,000, whatever funds we do get will still go toward the development of this comic book series. And to whatever degree we are successful, the above benefits will still apply.

The Impact:

SEED is more than just a cool web series, sci-fi novel and comic book idea. SEED is meant to entertain, while at the same time help people learn about the times we are living in and how we are really just repeating ancient history - a history that had terrible consequences. The keys to undertanding the future lie buried in the past. Thus, SEED has the potential to really make an impact on culture by making social, political and religious commentary, wrapped up in an entertaining tale of mystery, intrigue, conspiracy and the supernatural.

Other Ways You Can Help:

Some just can’t afford to contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Spread the word through e-mail.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools
  • Post this to your website and/or blogs
  • Share on Facebook.

Together, we can make this comic book/graphic novel series a reality!
