Hello, My name is Rob Skiba. I have been a documentary filmmaker since 1994. This has had the effect of making me into a researcher. By that I mean I RE-search that which has already been searched by others before me. It has become a passionate hobby of mine, which has resulted in the development of a web series called SEED. The above trailer is a concept animation for that series, which will be shot in live action. Here is a brief synopsis of this story:
Think: Lost meets Battlestar Galactica, wrapped up in an X-File.
In 33A.D., Jesus Christ prophesied that the Last Days would be like the days of Noah.
In December of 2002, an advanced party special operations team was sent to Iraq looking for weapons of mass destruction. But what they found was far worse than any conventional weaponry.
Cpt. Zak Randall and his team inadvertently discover the cave of Dudael and all hell breaks loose. Zak's team gets wiped out, but he survives with the help of a mysterious Bedouin who transports him through time and space from the desert of Iraq in 2002 to the desert of Arizona in 2010.
Zak's quest for answers begins here, at the beginning... of the end.
Project Status:
SEED is currently being developed as both a (TV ready) live action web series as well as fictional novel series. Now, we are trying to create it as a graphic novel series to go along with it. Part of the reason for this is so that we can use the profits to help completely self-fund the web series. It is essential for us to be self-funded because:

Going through a network/studio usually means compromising the vision.
Investors will want to control content.
Networks/studios will censor content.
Networks/studios can cancel a series prematurely and own the rights, which effectively can kill a project.
We have a big vision for 72 episodes, and we are not willing to compromise in order to achieve it. This means we must do everything we can to retain complete creative control.
If you are sick and tired of the same-old, same-old, and hate it when your favorite TV shows keep getting cancelled prematurely (sometimes on a season end cliff-hanger), we are putting the control in you, the audience's hands.
One of the ways we can become both self-funded as well as reach a broader market is through projects like this. Graphic novels and comic books are very popular, even amongst adults. And we've been able to determine that each 1 hour web series script for SEED will essentially translate to 6 individual comic book issues, which will then get packaged together into a thick graphic novel. Thus, each episode of SEED will generate 7 products that can be sold in order to help fund the web series as well as get the story out through another popular market.
What We Need:
We already have enough written content right now to produce 12 comic book issues and two graphic novels, with more written content on the way. Thus, we need your help to raise a minimum of $15,000. This will:

Enable us to hire the writers, artists and staff needed to do this right.
Enable us to do a limited print run for promotional purposes.
Help us to kick-start the promotions for both the web series as well as the fictional novel series.
What You Get:

Once the graphic novel is done, anyone who contributes $33 or more will receive a FREE digital copy in PDF format.
People who contribute a minimum of $111 will get the above plus credit on our SEED graphic novel web site (currently in development).
People who contribute a minimum of $222 will get the above plus credit in the graphic novel as well.
People who contribute $444 or more will get the above and also have the option of being drawn into the graphic novel as an "extra" in the story.
People who contribute $777 or more will get the above and also have the option of being "cast" into the story as a "bit part" (short speaking scene).
People who contribute more than $1,000 will get all of the above, plus an autographed hardcopy of the graphic novel.
If we do not reach our entire goal of $15,000, whatever funds we do get will still go toward the development of this comic book series. And to whatever degree we are successful, the above benefits will still apply.
The Impact:
SEED is more than just a cool web series, sci-fi novel and comic book idea. SEED is meant to entertain, while at the same time help people learn about the times we are living in and how we are really just repeating ancient history - a history that had terrible consequences. The keys to undertanding the future lie buried in the past. Thus, SEED has the potential to really make an impact on culture by making social, political and religious commentary, wrapped up in an entertaining tale of mystery, intrigue, conspiracy and the supernatural.

Other Ways You Can Help:
Some just can’t afford to contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Spread the word through e-mail.
Use the Indiegogo share tools
Post this to your website and/or blogs
Share on Facebook.


Together, we can make this comic book/graphic novel series a reality!

story:
Our Story

Comixiade is: International, Unconventional, The Work of Many from Many Countries, in content Abstract and Melancholic and devoted to the art of Comic and Visual Storytelling.

 

We function as an international network of artists focusing on graphic narratives and comics. For over a year, Comixiade has been organizing international gatherings of young artists from all over Europe. During these so-called 'comic jams', they had one week to turn a number of comic scenario's into comic strips, working together using their individual styles, learning and getting to know each other in the process. The central theme was a Tintin-like main character, the all-European journalist Osvald.

Osvald explored the back alleys, docks and slums of Europe, looking for the untold stories of the old continent. The three jams took place in the city Poznan, Poland, on the island of Terschelling, the Netherlands, and in the industrial town of Pancevo, Serbia.

Meanwhile, at home, many more comic artists were also creating their own stories about Osvald and his pet pig, Carmen. All these stories were published at www.comixiade.org. While the series of comic jams has ended, the work-at-home artists will continue to create comic art for the website.

To complete the wonderful journey that is Comixiade, we will publish all artwork created during the project - both at the jams and at home - in a gorgeous book. And we need your help to do that. So far, Comixiade has been funded by the wonderful people over at the European Cultural Foundation in Amsterdam. They agreed to grant us another 5000 euro's, but only after we manage to raise enough funding from the public to come up with a total budget of about 7500 to design, print, publish and distribute the book. This means that from all of you, we need just 3500 US dollars to make Comixiade - The Book see the light.

The book will be edited by the experts in comic publications of our partner organisation Centrala in Poland. It will be printed over in Bulgaria with the help of the Next Page Foundation, will be distributed in the Netherlands by Platform Spartak itself, and by our partners in Serbia, Poland, and the Czech Republic. The publication date is planned for October 1st, 2012.

The Impact

Comixiade is already having a huge impact on the Europe underground comic scene. Artists that would have never heard from each other, let alone create artwork together, are now cooperating to make some of the most beautiful graphic novels you have ever seen. Ideas are shared, new initiatives are born. Through e-mail and social media the story of Osvald continues. But we need to make it real. We need to give all that wonderful artwork the medium that it deserves: a real, printed, paper book. It will be the completion of Comixiade, the achieving of our final goal, and it will also have a continuing impact on the comic scene, both underground and mainstream. And come on, don't you just want to own all these beautiful comics, not just on a screen, but in your hands?

What We Need & What You Get

The money raised will be spent on the whole book publishing from scratch to finish. For example:

  • Redacting the book
  • Design by a professional print designer
  • Printing of the book
  • Distributing the book
  • Promoting the book

Of course, there's something in it for you too if you donate. For just $ 15,- your name will be mentioned on a special, extra-beautifully designed 'thank you' page. For $ 30,- you get mentioned AND receive the book, delivered to your home. And for $100,- you get mentioned with your own cartoon drawn by one of our professional comic artists, plus you get the book, of course.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Spam people with our web address. Nag to your parents about it! Go to comic stores and tell us to put our poster up! And of course, post all this info on Facebook, Twitter, your blog, anywhere you can think of. With your help, we can give Comixiade the grand finale it deserves.

story:
ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED: Slimy Thief #5 Presto part: II

ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED: Aisha Costume Ready

----------------------------

Slimy Thief is a comedic, sexy, fantasy webcomic. Its main goal is to deliver to readers fresh and light hearted fun.

I've been running this webcomic for a while now, but due to financial problems I can't give the regular updates it deserves.

The known ways of funding an online comic by itself has always been, to build a paysite or selling digital copies. But neither options are piracy safe.

However I've only made this far thanks to piracy. People sharing my comics through image boards, forums and blogs made these characters popular so I could start it's own webcomic. I think it's cool that people want to read my comics. I would make it all for free if I could, but Slimy Thief as it is, takes too much time to be done. So either I draw this webcomic or I do something else to cover the bills. I chose Slimy Thief.

I believe that the collective effort is the best way to sustain something we like. It's like the old times when we could build a comics collection with friends, we could read our friends books as long as they could read the ones you bought... good o' times!

Slimy Thief needs your help. Each dollar counts, higher contributions can give you the rewards listed on your right. Basically this is the same as pre-order of the old pay-per-download deal, but now you will be contributing for bigger projects.

All contributors will get especial editions with more content than the regular pay-for-download versions of the upcoming releases. With 2 extra illustrations, work in process material and sketches.

If this campaign succeeds; besides the money to survive, I'll have the moral boost to make more comics. It's good to know that I can count with people :-) If it's surpass my initial expectations I'll make steps forward and start production of a flash game.


If this campaign doesn't succeed:  Oh well... Life goes on, you will have your money back... And I'll stick to the random encounters with Slimy Thief updates and commissions.


Projects Production Time Goal $
Weekly Comic Strips as the campaign runs

SlimyThief #5 Presto II (UNLOCKED!)
 20 1600
Cosplay-photo set – 30pics

SlimyThief #6 Presto III 25 3500 minimum



One steady month of weekly strips  for every 1000 past mininum goal



Cosplay-photo set

SlimyThief #4,#5 and #6 free for download
5000
Game 0.1 B&W – w/ basic-animations 30 7000
Cosplay-photo set

All comics free for download

Game 1.1 mono 4tones –w/ Full -animations 20 10000

story:
In the future, no one sleeps anymore thanks to a wonderful pill. Unfortunately for Drew Spencer, stapler-wielding office drone, he's allergic to it. Struggling to keep up with a society that no longer dreams, Drew slowly starts to realize there are sinister things lurking under the surface of the new and shiny world.

Power Nap is our online graphic novel, dynamically drawn by Bachan and written by yours truly, Maritza Campos. We have been uploading the story from the beginning at http://www.powernapcomic.com . However, plans to get it in print form have existed from the beginning, and we hope now to make it possible through you.

Why help? Well, if you're already a fan of Power Nap,  to ensure its continued publication by helping the authors pay the print bills instead of them having to sell a kidney or pawn their pets/loved ones.

If you're not familiar with Power Nap, you can go read the comic from the beginning http://www.powernapcomic.com/d/20110617.html and see if you like it and consider it worthwhile. It's free! :)

Plus, you can get the book and/or other attractives perks and rewards. Check it out.

 

What We Need


Basically, $10K for the print run, fees, and shipping. This is a full-color book, european-album (bd) sized. It won't look as pretty if we print it black and white or smaller just to get it cheaper. We want to give you the greatest quality possible!

 

THANK YOU!!!

UPDATE ON THIS: We are fully funded, so this book is definitely happening. We have to let the campaign run its full course, however, so you can still get perks and such.

Check out from time to time, we might add new ones!! 

 

Yeah yeah, tell me the good stuff already. What do I get?

Finally, we get to the fun part! Check these babies out. Some of them are number-limited only, others you can hoard to your heart's content!

 

Digital package + Wallpapers ($5)

The downloadable Power Nap (cbr/cbz), the first 3 chapters, along with 3 exclusive, never-seen-before, mesmerizing wallpapers. Uncompressed color quality, better than the webcomic versions!

To be delivered digitally via email as soon as the campaign is over and I have your data, y'all.

 

Power Nap MAXICOMIC ($10)

It's a comic. It's a poster. It's an 8-page comic that you unfold: every fold is a page, until the last page is the poster. Bachan-patented! Unreleased material, all new, and unavailable in any other form.

This price includes shipping everywhere!

Estimated shipping date: at the same time of the book, actually. Around February 2013 or earlier.

 

Power Nap Vol. 1 ($30)

 

The first 3 chapters of Power Nap. 70+ pages of european-album sized pages, full color. Chapters included:
1. Freak of Nature
2. Acts of God
3. Personal Space

This price includes shipping everywhere!

Estimated shipping date: Around February 2013 or earlier.

 

Power Nap Vol. 1  + Maxicomic ($35)

For the discerning comic fan who wants it all.

This price includes shipping everywhere!

Estimated shipping date: Around February 2013 or earlier.

 

Power Nap Vol. 1: Sketched ($50)

Power Nap Vol 1. This one is EXACTLY like the $30 version, only that, for a meager extra $20, it will be lovingly dedicated and sketched inside by Bachan. I'll sign it too but will refrain from ruining it with my drawings, do not worry :P (unless you really really want to!)

We'll offer only 200 of these wonderfully scribbled babies. So get yours before it's horribly late!

And just as an extra, we'll toss in a maxicomic too! Because we love you.

This price includes shipping everywhere!

Estimated shipping date: Around February 2013 or earlier.

 

Digital Package BLACK AND WHITE ($5)

The downloadable Power Nap (cbr/cbz), the first 3 chapters, along with 3 exclusive, never-seen-before, mesmerizing wallpapers. But get this. These are not in color! These are the black and white versions! For the discerning fan who enjoys looking at pretty inking :)

To be delivered digitally via email.

 

Power Nap Vol. 1 ESPAÑOL ($30)


Igualito al libro en inglés, pero la edición en español. Traducida por la autora, yo mera :P


Todos los gastos de envío están incluidos a cualquier parte del mundo.

Power Nap Vol. 1 ESPAÑOL + Maxicomic ($35)


El libro en español y el maxicómic en inglés.


Todos los gastos de envío están incluidos a cualquier parte del mundo.

 

Power Nap Vol. 1 ESPAÑOL: Sketched ($50)


La edición en español, pero con dibujito y dedicatoria. ¡Qué bonitooo! Ah y le incluimos el maxicómic de pilón. ¡Llévele!


Todos los gastos de envío están incluidos a cualquier parte del mundo.

 

Nota: Si ya adquiriste el libro en inglés y quieres cambiarlo por el de español, es perfectamente posible, solamente tienes que avisarme cuando se vayan a hacer los envíos. :D

 

 

 

But I work 16 hours and I have no money.

 

You can still help, and it's cheap! The only thing we need is that you spread the word and share the news. Indiegogo provides great tools to do that without the risk of being accused of spam or being mistaken for a bot. Just copy and paste this handy link:

 

http://igg.me/p/209380?a=1069894

 

Power Nap is alive thanks to you, and we really appreciate any kind of support you can throw our way. <3

To be delivered digitally via email.

story:
THE STORY

Welcome to the Good, the Bad and the Dead Issue.

After mercenaries/lovers Sharp and Teague clash with an assassin during a routine operation in Northern Mexico, only Sharp survives. Who was the assassin? Why was he in Mexico? Will the tat on his forearm help identify him? These are the questions that plague Sharp. Turning to Teague's ex girlfriend, Treasury Agent Jackson for help, she learns the tattoo is the mark of a cult alleged to worship a mythical person known only as Uncle Fetus.  Unable to discover anything more, Sharp has no way to pursue the cult. The cultists, however, aren't done with her. Not by a long shot. 

WRITER/CREATOR


In 1999, Jeff Coley completed the UCLA Professional Program in Screenwriting.  In 2007, after relocating to Austin, he discovered the graphic novel format and resolved to create one some day. He can be found on the forums at www.comicsexperience.com and in person at the Austin Film Festival and SXSW.

COLORIST

Jessica Alley graduated from the Art Institute of Washington with her BFA in Media Arts and Animation, majoring as a Colorist in Sequential Art. She has done other works for card games and web comics.

(www.alleycatinks.wordpress.com and http://bloodrose13th.deviantart.com/

story:
Our story

The Food Chain Workers Alliance is a coalition of worker-based organizations whose members plant, harvest, process, pack, transport, prepare, serve, and sell food, organizing to improve wages and working conditions for all workers along the food chain. The Alliance works together to build a more sustainable food system that respects workers’ rights, based on the principles of social, environmental and racial justice, in which everyone has access to healthy and affordable food.

20 million people work in the food system in the U.S., joining millions around the world who labor on farms and in meat, poultry and food processing facilities, warehouses, grocery stores and restaurants. The food system is the largest employer in the U.S. and the majority of frontline food workers earn poverty wages. In the U.S., a third of food workers suffer from food insecurity and hunger.

Background

The members of the Alliance decided to create a comic book focused on food workers in order to illustrate the issues facing these workers, as well as their efforts to organize to improve their workplaces, their communities, and the food system. Luis DeLeon, a restaurant worker and member of the Restaurant Opportunities Center of Chicago, volunteered to write the backstory for the comic book. He created five characters, each representing one of the five main sectors of the food system, and he called them the Food Chain Avengers.

The Comic Book

The Food Chain Avengers comic book uses examples drawn from real experiences by workers in their respective industries, the five main characters of the story walk us through each of five sectors of the food chain: production, processing, distribution, retail, and food service. The comic book exposes the exploitative nature of the industry Vis-à-vis its workers, communities, and the environment. in addition, it tells the story of struggle to victory.

Food Chain Avengers is illustrated and written by artist Jerel Dye. Jerel is an Artist, illustrator, and designer based in Massachusetts.  While in high school he worked as a pizza chef. You can learn more about Jerel's work at http://jereldye.com/blog/.

Where you come in

We need to raise 10K by Nov 15!  

Your donations will go to supporting the distribution of our comic book and help educate youth about food workers. Youth who participate in our release parties in NYC, Chicago and LA will get free copies of the comic book. We feel its important for youth to have tools to learn who is responsible for the food we eat each day.

We're printing 5,000 English and 1,000 Spanish spanish copies of the comic book. The pdf will be free and downloadable online. Next month we'll start taking orders and are asking for a small suggested donation for a copies of the printed version. That really will barely cover cost to print and it won't really cover shipping and the fee to the artist and writer and FCWA staff time working on it. The total project budget is $23,000.  $10,000 is what we haven't raised yet from other sources.

Your donation ensures that food worker stories are told and that we can come together to support their struggles for change.  You'll be giving a voice to millions of workers who are responsible for the food we eat each day but many times are invisible to us.

story:
Help us create 5 new Star Squadron episodes.

Traditional Sex Education isn't working.
Each week, 68 million young people search Google for the answer to, "What is Sex?"
 
Educational videos like this one cost $1,000 each to make, and reach upwards of 20,000 viewers a month. 
 
 
Your $25 donation will bring ANSWERS to 500 young people's burning questions about sex every month.

Who’re we?

We're Shannon Farley from Spark and Deb Levine from ISIS. We work every day to secure health and education for women and young people.

How can I help?

5 things you can do to support this campaign.

1)    Make a donation. – Spark/ISIS is covering the administrative  costs of this effort. 100% of your donations will go directly to this project.

2)    Learn More. – Read this white paper about where youth are getting their sex education today (HINT: Google and YouTube). 

4)    Spread the word.  – Share with your friends on Facebook and Twitter. Tell us your sex ed story and encourage others to share theirs.

5)   Participate in the pilot. - This is a pilot project. If you want to be part of it, email us at programs@sparksf.org.

--------

Since 2003, factually accurate, comprehensive sex education is state mandated. But all over California – even in the Bay Area – kids are not getting the education they need.

They have told us that the sex education they get in schools is only moderately successful.
 
And that the first place they go to find answers to their burning questions is Google.

What are we going to do?

Our goal of $5,000 will create 5 new videos, bringing answers to 100,000 young people each month. 

 

Why us?

Spark is the largest network of young philanthropists committed to women’s human rights in the world. ISIS is the national expert in using social and mobile media to improve young people’s access to reproductive health.

Why now?

We can’t afford to wait.

story:
Short Summary 

Since you’ve stopped by to look at Ethos, you are already one of our favorite people! We are a group of creators looking to tell engaging stories you will come to love just as much as anything you’ve read before. Ethos is only the beginning, and is one of the best!

Being human is something we find difficult, joyous, defeating, and empowering all at once. At times we certainly take it for granted, but what if we weren’t always human?  Exactly how would we see things? Would our perspective change or would our simple challenges we face now be that much more difficult?

What if you were once a God? An Olympian forced to reside in the body of a human. Even worse, what if you had despised the human race before this horrible atrocity had befallen you and the other Gods? Things might be more difficult than you thought, but could being human change you forever?

These are some of the big questions concerning our characters in Ethos. Sure there’s a level of epic proportions (we are talking about the Gods of Olympus), some mysterious intrigue, and even stories of redemption, but at its core, Ethos is about being human and what that really means.

Told in two different tales in the same context, Ethos follows the lives of the Gods (after the events of the zero issue), and a few humans destined to change everything we’ve come to know about Greek mythology, but that’s not all. In a back-up tale, the world of Ethos is set on it’s ear with a tale of redemption, evil, and the darkness where the light no longer shines.

Ethos has so much in store we have to make sure the world gets to hear the story we have planned. That’s where you guys come in!

After the success of our zero issue release (selling over 50% of our original print run, and still counting), we are turning to our current and future fans to help get this great big ball really rolling to deliver a big experience in the small pages we will craft.

We are highly motivated and very passionate about the project, and are excited for you to join us on this journey!!

What We Need & What You Get

We are reaching out for $1,500 for the first issue. That issue will hopefully garner enough of a profit to get us rolling on into the series.

A professional grade cover usually runs about $300-$500. The idea is to always ensure we have a cover that pops right off the stands among the other industry powerhouses.

Printing costs are a big factor for independent comics. A small order of comics runs at about $400, and can really start to add up the higher our print run goes.

Sequential art pages weigh heavily on the cost as well. Ranging from $75-$100 a page, those totals per issue start to add up fast. Not to mention the inker and the colorist fees.

But our perks are fantastic and everyone gets something!

At the $10 level, you receive an exclusive campaign print A as well as a thank you on the website.

At the $25 level, you receive thanks in the book and website as well as the exclusive campaign prints A and B and a coupon for 50% off the first issue at one of our signing events.

At the $50 level, you receive thanks in the book and website as well as the exclusive campaign prints A, B, and C, and a coupon for 50% off the first issue at one of our signing events. You also become part of an exclusive preview club that will allow you to see the early developments of Ethos #1.

Now things get really interesting.

At the $75 level you will receive thanks in the book and website as well as the exclusive campaign prints A, B, C and D, and a coupon for 50% off the first issue at one of our future signing events. You also become part of an exclusive preview club that will allow you to see the early developments of Ethos #1.

At the $100 level, we have another set of options for you. The first one you will receive thanks in the book and website as well as the exclusive campaign prints A, B, C and D, and a coupon for 50% off the first issue at one of our signing events. You also become part of an exclusive preview club that will allow you to see the early developments of Ethos #1, plus an original piece of art from Ethos #1.

At $150 level, you will receive thanks in the book and website as well as the exclusive campaign prints A, B, C and D, and a coupon for 50% off the first issue at one of our future signing events. You also become part of an exclusive preview club that will allow you to see the early developments of Ethos #1, plus an original piece of art from Ethos #1 and the chance to hang out with the team at one of our future signing events.

Then we have the ultimate Ethos fan option at $250. At this level, you receive thanks in the book and website as well as the exclusive campaign prints A, B, C and D, and a coupon for 50% off the first issue at one of our future signing events. You also become part of an exclusive preview club that will allow you to see the early developments of Ethos #1, plus an original piece of art from Ethos #1 and the Ethos #0 Bundle package, which includes the signed zero issue, two character prints separate from the campaign prints, and the extra rare “do your own cover” variant of issue #1. You can bring this to one of our signing events and get your own personalized cover sketch done.

Don’t worry, we didn’t forget the retailers. We have a few choice perks lined up just for you.

At the $150 level you will receive 10 copies of Ethos #1 with an exclusive retailer incentive cover, as well as an exclusive poster signed by the team.

At $250 level you will receive 10 copies of Ethos #1 with an exclusive retailer incentive cover, as well as an exclusive poster signed by the team, plus an in-store signing event (limited to the travel radius in our location), and a special collage of our visit to your store.

We have a couple stretch goals in mind as well. If we reach $1750, we will add some behind the scenes pages to Ethos #1 as well as a signed copy of the original script sent to everyone who has contributed $50 and above.

If we reach our stretch goal of $2000, not only will we add some behind the scenes pages to Ethos #1 as well as a signed copy of the original script sent to everyone who has contributed $50 and above, but there will be exclusive first look pages of Ethos # 2.

If we make our goal, don’t make our goal, or if we go past our goal, we will continue to produce Ethos because we believe that much in the project. Every little bit will help though, and we appreciate your support!

The Impact

We’ve all had different lives, some easy, some difficult, but at the end of the day, we all embrace the idea of being human differently. It’s those differences that shape us into the type of person we are. Those are the differences that shape the people we know. It’s these differences we want to showcase in Ethos, and utilizing a “clean slate” with the Olympian characters learning to stumble before they walk is just an exciting aspect we want share with the world. Maybe it’ll help each of us learn to explore just how we can embrace our own humanity.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute with a monetary gift, we would still love for you to help us spread the word about Ethos. You can help by simply posting the links to your Facebook, Twitter, and/or whatever other social media outlets you favor. Send these links out to anyone you think might be interested in the project. It's not just money that we need. Getting people to see the project is every bit as important as the funding, so thank you in advance for all your help and support!

story:
WHAT'S AN ACID MONDAY

Acid Monday is a boys love webcomic that I started in 2008. I finished it in 2010 and had a small run printed. Now I've completely sold out of books, and due to there still being demand for the comic, I've decided to do a reprint!

If you're new to the Acid Monday, here is a synopsis:

Before, Clover only knew Monday as the local acid addict. This changes after Clover snaps at him in the boy’s bathroom. As fate would have it, the boy’s mother forces him into a job at her rehab clinic as a mentor for none other than Monday.

Is it fate bringing them together or is there some ulterior motive for the acidhead being at the clinic?

You can read the main comic in full at acidmonday.smackjeeves.com

(Please note that the reward levels to this campaign include content that is sexually explicit in nature, and by funding this project you are acknowledging that you are 18 years or older.)

SO WHAT'S NEW

There's an entire new chapter of the book that I made just for this reprint. I'll be posting the first 10 pages up online, but to get the whole 29 page comic, you've gotta buy a pdf or the book! It features Ren and Larxt. Because of REASONS OK. It is 18+. There are peens.

I'll be posting two pages a week--one on Tuesday and one on Friday.

I've also had a killer team to help me with reformatting and relettering the pages for the reprint. While the story remains the same, I've revised some of the dialogue and art. It looks way better now holy cow.

The pdf and book will also include the 13 page extra that was made for the first printing.

SO…18+??

YEAH. You gotta be 18+ to buy this comic, sweeties. Dems da rules. While there isn't much explicit content in the main storyline, both of the extras are pretty gosh darn porn heavy. Also it's gay. But, I'm assuming you've figured it out by this point.

WHAT'S THE PRINTING PLAN?

The estimated cost to get this printed is around $2500 or so. I have some money saved up for it, so I'm only setting my goal at $1500. Any additional funds will be used to support future publishing projects by Lucid. There is a direct dollar to gay porn exchange.

The book itself will be 224 pages, offset, perfect bound, 5"x7", b/w, with a color cover.

TIMEFRAME

The book will be going out to print in about 5 weeks. I'll be posting two pages of the extra every week--one on Tuesday and one on Friday while the fundraiser is going. After that, it'll take a few weeks for the printer to do their thing, and another couple weeks for me to sign/sketch in books and ship them out! So you can probably expect your book sometime in November for USA residents, and late November/early December for international residents. This schedule is subject to change, but I will keep you updated throughout the process.

OOO A CONTEST

To celebrate the reprint, I'm holding a fanart contest! You'll have the chance to win a copy of the book and be featured in it as well!

There will be a winner and a runner up. The winner will get a drawn in copy of the book, the letter size print, and I'll just throw books and zines at you until I'm satisfied. The runner up will get a signed copy of the book.

Content Requirements: Must be Acid Monday related! That's about it. Comics? Yes plz. Illustrations? Aww yeah. It can be 18+, funny, serious??, whatever! Though if you do a comic, please keep it 2 pages or under.

Size Requirements: Must be 5"x 7", b/w, 300 dpi. Here is a template with the bleed margins and safe zones for you to use~ click for zip download

Email your submission to missllllucid@gmail.com

Deadline: September 14th

story:
To see the progress of Vampire Mob - Issue 1, drop by VampireMob.com

Thank YOU for making it possible for Vampire Mob to continue! 

I can't wait to tell you more of this story and I'm psyched to spend more time with these characters in this world. 

                                           

                                 Vampire Mob, Issue 1 - Cover by JM Ringuet.

My name is Joe Wilson and I tell stories with the help of people located all over the world. 
                                              

One of these stories. "Vampire Mob," started four years ago and I was hoping to tell more of it.


I tried to find a way to tell this story without asking for help from you, the audience, which resulted in taking a lot of meetings with companies and doing a lot of waiting.

Because I made the mistake of not taking that same time to raise the budget independently, that story can no longer be told, at least not the way I had hoped. 

The biggest lesson I learned making Vampire Mob was DON'T WAIT FOR SOMEONE TO PICK YOU. 

If you're reading this, whatever it is you want to do in life, START NOW. 

DO NOT WAIT. 

                       Marcia Wallace as a vampire?

I watched a lot of reruns of “The Bob Newhart Show” as a kid and was always a fan of Marcia’s work. You may know her voice as Edna Krabappel on "The Simpsons."

                Marcia Wallace and the character she made so memorable!

I created a character for Marcia Wallace, without her knowing it.

I loved hearing Marcia's voice in my head as I typed dialogue for Virginia Jones, I didn't know if Marcia would say yes because I didn't know Marcia.  We had mutual friends who got me in contact with her and she DID say yes, with the caveat, “I usually don’t do these things.” 

Marcia Wallace did me a gigantic favor by saying yes to being in “Vampire Mob.”  Then she said yes, again, and we made season two of “Vampire Mob.” 

I wrote a third season with Marcia’s character all over the script and she was on board to reprise her role. 

Unfortunately, on October 25, 2013 the world got less funny when Marcia Wallace died. 

"Improvise, adapt and overcome." 

Recasting Virginia just didn’t feel right. 

I wanted to continue telling the story of “Vampire Mob,” it’s a really funny script!  But without Marcia, how? 

Creating “Vampire Mob” as a graphic novel would allow Marcia’s character to be “alive” in our imaginations.

We could all imagine Marcia Wallace saying the words on the page and that did feel right.

        

                         Vampire Mob - Issue 1 


The live-action script for VMob season three is twice as long as seasons 1 and 2, combined! The goal with the S3 script was to pick up the story a few days after the kitchen scene in season two. 

Vampire Mob Issue 1 will have a color cover and be approximately 28-30 black and white pages, with the possibility of a few extra pages if we reach stretch goals.       

Adapting the entire VMob S3 live-action script into a graphic-novel script will result in 7 individual issues of the graphic novel.  

PLEASE NOTE: VAMPIRE MOB has adult language (F-Carpet Bombs) meant for adults in both the live-action version and in the graphic novel version. 

                                        Get drawn as a VAMPIRE!

                    

                     Supporting Mob member Larry Fleming with his perk!

JM Ringuet will draw YOU as a vampire grocery shopping in the Mustang with Don!

I'll send you the extremely high quality file and you can post it, print it, or both! 


 I only have a handful of these posters and they are the last that will be printed. 

                                   

                      "We are all famous to a few people," the mug!!


                  

Mama Giacomina's Polpette (meatball) recipe, contributed by Darlene Vendegna! It's her mom's recipe! Everyone who contributes gets it! 

                   

                     "We are all famous to a few people" T-Shirt, two styles!

                    

        I love this album by Bookhouse! Killer takes of music from "Twin Peaks"! 

             But, like, what kinda stuff can I get?

  • EVERYONE who contributes will have their name in the Supporting Mob section of Vampire Mob Issue 1! Your name (or anonymous) in the book!
  • EVERYONE who contributes receives an Ebook of Issue 1, Mama Giacomina’s Polpette recipe AND a high quality download of the cover of Issue 1 you can use to print your own poster AND all stretch goals!
  • You can also contribute to receive VMob Issue 1, signed to you!
  • "We are all famous to a few people" T-shirts! Two styles!
  • "Vampire Mob" T-shirts! Two styles! Unisex and Women's! 
  • Blood jugs from seasons one and two. (blood not included)
  • Skype with Mike (and me).
  • Graphic Novel Writer's Commentary Video. 
  • Director's Commentary Video of season 1 and 2. 
  • Make a cameo in the graphic novel, like your face IN Issue 1!

                    Vampire Mob shirt and that's a giant Blood Jar!!!  Both are perks!

         Vampire Mob Issue 1 thumbnail sketch of page 1 by JM Ringuet.

If, by chance, we raise more than the original goal (I'm a dreamer), everyone who contributes will receive additional perks, including a longer Issue 1.

$10,000 - Back matter happens!

Even more Issue 1! Think of these pages like DVD extras. Additional pages will be created that will include character profiles, story background and a couple other surprises if we reach this stretch goal.

$13,500 - "Craig's Other List" 

Vampire Mob was first performed as a short play called "Craig's Other List" which tells the story of Don meeting someone to become a vampire. The play was performed twice, on one night, and then never seen again. If we reach this stretch goal, "Craig's Other List" will be adapted into a short graphic novelette, which will be included as part of Issue 1! 

$18,000 - Vampire Mob ISSUE TWO, HAPPENS!

If we reach this stretch goal, Vampire Mob Issue 2 is created! Everyone who contributes to create Issue 1 will also receive Vampire Mob Issue 2 as an eBook, which starts inside the castle!! 

        Where's the dough goin'?

                         That's a lotta scratch! 

                                      What's the plan, Stan?

  • Pay for IndieGoGo fees, PayPal fees, credit card transaction fees.
  • Pay to create the artwork, lettering & graphic designs for Issue 1.
  • Pay to print Issue 1.
  • Pay to print posters of the Issue 1 cover.
  • Pay for shirts and for them to be printed.
  • Pay for envelopes, tubes and shipping materials.
  • Pay for the worldwide shipping of Issue 1, posters, T-shirts, albums and giant blood jugs!

            Vampire Mob Issue 1 pencil sketch of page 1 by JM Ringuet.


          The Vampire Mob Graphic Novel Team

JM Ringuet - China 

Drawing Vampire Mob Issue 1 is writer, comic and concept artist, illustrator JM Ringuet, who is also the Creator of 'Repossessed' published by Image. See his work JMRinguet.com.

Deron Bennett - U.S.

Deron Bennett will be putting all the words and sounds on the pages of VMob Issue 1.  Deron is the creator of "Quixote" and was nominated for an Eisner Award for his work on Billy Fog, Jim Henson’s Dark Crystal, Jim Henson’s Tale of Sand, Mr. Murder Is Dead (Archaia); Helldorado, Puss N Boots, and Richie Rich (APE Entertainment). See Deron's work http://andworlddesign.com.

Corey Blake - U.S. 

Corey Blake is guiding Vampire Mob Issue 1 as the creative consultant, giving notes on the script and the creation of the book itself. Corey writes about the comic book industry and art form for Robot 6 @ Comic Book Resources - http://robot6.comicbookresources.com/author/coreyblake/. He is also an improviser, actor and writer. 

Lynnaire MacDonald - New Zealand

"I'm Lynnaire MacDonald, founder of Indie Film Sprites, a social media and publicity firm. I'm proud to be donating Indie Film Sprites' services to the Vampire Mob graphic novel crowdfunding campaign, and looking forward to seeing the next chapter of the VMob story unfolding in graphic novel form!"        


Katharine Holmes - Canada

Katharine Holmes from VisualizeSocial is assisting with social media and the graphic design of Vampire Mob Issue 1.  Katharine also created the PlayShorts logo and numerous designs for VMob used online and on a whole lotta coffee mugs! 

                        Vampire Mob Issue 1, inked page 1 by JM Ringuet.

                                Risks & Challenges

    Stuff goes wrong. Every project that I start I'm looking for obstacles, I'm looking for what's going to stop me. 

    If we don't raise the budget by the end of the campaign, I will find a way to make this story happen. As those of you know, Vampire Mob season two almost didn't happen, but I found a way and will do that same for Issue 1.

            Can't contribute now, but want to help?

    I've been there. I know what it's like when you want to help, but there's bills to pay. You can still help make this project happen!! 

    • Tell your extremely talkative friend on Facebook.
    • There's a whole lotta share buttons right under the video to help, you know, share Vampire Mob.
    • Yell, "Vampire Mob!" out your window at passersby, or maybe Tweet a link to this campaign. 
    • Point your phone at the screen and post a picture of the cover on Instagram.
    • Explain to people that Vampire Mob is a vampire story for the rest of us! 
    • Thank YOU for the assists!! Truly appreciated and very needed!

    From Marcia Wallace's autobiography, "Don't Look Back, we're not going that way":  "To Joe, the only producer to ever cast me as a vampire mother-in-law. All the best, Marcia Wallace. 7/2010"

story:
This campaign acts as a pre-order for Satanic Mojo #3.

Regardless of amount raised here this comic will launch as part of:
'Come To The Sabbat - Festival of Dark Arts'
Aug 17th - 23rd at APIARY STUDIOS, 458 Hackney Road, London, E2 9EG

Comic launch Thurs Aug 20th 7.00 - 11.00 PM

Come and meet the 'Satanist Cartoonists' & get your comix signed. 

The rest of the exhibition will be open for the evening and there will also be a short curators talk including a screening of the short films 'Black Acid' and 'Satanic Mojo Manifesto' both of which have been adapted as strips in the comic.

(supporters of this campaign will be included on the guest list +1) 

‘Satanic Mojo Comix’ is an anthology title in the vein of classic San Francisco underground comix like Zap, Skull, The Leather Nun or Slow Death. It is produced exclusively by initiates of the Satanist Cartoonist coven.


Issue 3 will be our biggest one so far, weighing in at a whopping 52 pages! 

Contents:

Black Acid by Laughingindio w. Jason Atomic & Johnny Deluxe (plot/script)

Lester Starbeard by Jason Atomic

Gasper The Ghoulish Ghost by Garry Leach

Friggin’ Hell Comix by Savage Pencil

Sabbath Ov Thee Broken by The Satanist Cartoonists Coven

Absolute Depravity by Dennis Franklin

Famous Satanic Names by Martin Hand

Old Enough to Bleed by Gunsho

Waiting For The Sun by Aidan Cook

Sometimes It's Necessary To Kill To Create by Billy Chainsaw

BEHOLD! THE VENUS GARUDA by Andrew Labanaris

The Joy Of Tex by Matt Valentine

Baphomet Madonna by Jason Atomic

Contains work of a graphic, erotic and satirical nature Suitable for 'OPEN MINDED ADULT INTELLECTUALS ONLY'

(work in progress final cover colours may vary)

We also have a very limited quantity of the Satanist Cartoonists art-jam posters available to a lucky few patrons 

(this image will be reproduced, albeit in at a much smaller scale, within the comic)

Artists contributing to this poster are: Garry Leach, Laughingindio, Jason Atomic, Daniel Cantrell, Krent Able, Coco Roy, Paul Arscott, Aidan Cook, Sina Sparrow, Gunsho, Rufus Dayglo, Manko, Grand Dame, Dennis Franklin, Chris Long, Jack McLean, Matt Valentine, Billy Chainsaw, Russell Taysom, Shaky Kane, Savage Pencil & Junko Mizuno.

story:
Summary

"Prussians Vs Aliens" is a humorous steampunk comic book written by Davide La Rosa, drawn by Riccardo Pieruccini and colored by Luca Salce and Mattia Zoanni.

The goal here is to give life to a new comic book series which could take the reader to a universe filled with steampunk robots and funny aliens.

In these pages, a historically revised Prussian army has to fight the menace coming from outer space. They'll be able to engage aliens with the help of a special task force, featuring six war heroes and their own huge steampunk robots: levers, pedals, chains, belts and steamy gears are going to be all over the place! 

The story is heavily inspired by Japanese anime's from the '70-'80s. If you enjoyed shows such as Mazinger, Grendizer or Daitan III or even Pacific Rim or Michael Bay's Transformers, this is going to be a real eye-candy for you! It's a huge quotes goldmine that will amuse and excite you from the beginning straight to the end.

The first chapter of the saga will be issued in 

  • two volumes
  • Colored
  • B5 format 
  • 46 pages per volume. 

At the moment, just the first volume will be available in the crowdfunding campaign. However, if the campaign grows well, generous rewards will be added along the way.


The Plot

It's 1789. French Revolution is raging in the streets of Paris. 

No one cared to notice that the Prussians were busy fighting an alien menace and saving the world. But let's step back for a minute. 

A few weeks earlier, the fat King Frederick William II was experiencing the worst awakening of his life. Rumor has it, the whole Prussian horse fleet had disappeared. It couldn't get any worse for a country whose greatest army pride are the horses! After all, what's left of a XVIII Century army if you take the horses away from them?!

Who took them away?
Who could steal all of the animals in just one night without anyone noticing?! 

Intelligence agencies didn't take too long to discover that the culprit came from the sky. The kidnappers are the ruthless aliens coming straight from the moon! 

The horses had to be retrieved ASAP, no matter what. Yes, but how?! Now, the Prussians had a special army, a secret task force of six ruthless fighters, three men and three women. The best of the best of the Prussian Kingdom's army. 

Each of these agents will drive their own robot. Will the Prussians be able to ward off the alien threat?




How you can contribute

You can buy the first volume of Prussians vs Aliens at a special price:

  • Digital copy  €5
  • Comic book € 10 
Moreover we will offer special content like the wallpaper, commissions and three awesome pins:


It will be possible be part of the comic book as a Prussian or Alien character (the armies are always looking for new soldiers) thanks to the perk FIRST PERSON.

It will possible have a breakfast with the authors and... dulcis in fundo... the ACTION FIGURE.
We will create 5 Action figures inspired from this scene:

There will be also awesome stretch goals, but this is a secret! 
So contribute now to Prussians vs Aliens and you will discover how strong are men with mustache!


Why we need these funds

We need € 6.500,00 to cover the expenses needed to produce the comic book, in particular:

  • € 3.000,00 for the 6 months of work needed to write, draw and color the book.
  • € 1.500,00 for printing the book and create the gadgets.
  • € 1.500,00 for taxes, Paypal and Indiegogo. 
  • € 500,00 for the shipment costs.
1st Strecth Goal € 8000 - TShirt - achieved
  • (ONLY FOR FUNDERS) if you have already purchased the comic book,  just add € 18 to receive the official Prussians vs Aliens TShirt


The Authors

Davide La Rosa was born in Como on June 23, 1980 (yes, Como was already there in the 80's). He did a lot of not really important things until 2001 when he attended the comic-book school "The New Heloise." Since 2002 he is co-founder of the "Bad drawn comics" magazine, which is still active, as active is his blog "Mulholland Dave", where he constantly publishes a badly drawn series of strips. In 2010 he started a collaboration with Nicola Pesce Editore and published three books since then. In 2011 he started working for "Star Comics" as a writer and publishes his own series, "Ninja nuns." He has also worked with the tv-show "Voyager" on Rai2 and for the magazine "CICAP." He does other things, too, and has 3 cats. He will die on a Wednesday.

Riccardo Pieruccini was born in Lucca in 1979. When he realized that he was in the 80's - after watching a long Mc Hammer movie - he decided to devote his body and soul to robot cartoons, which were very popular at that time, mainly because of the florid Japanese productions. The transition from anime to comics was his real initiation: reading, experimenting and hard working and training led him to a degree in painting at the Academy of Fine Arts in Florence and he became a fellow student of Simone Bianchi (Marvel), for whom he works from 2011. In 2001 he won the golden Pierlambicchi, but the passionate love for the robot world pushes him to focus on comic books. He has worked for Marvel as a supplier (Thanos series Rising, New Avengers, Original Sin), for Star Comics as a drawer (Cornelius, The Secret) and still as a drawer for Rainbow (Winx), alternating illustration works for movies (Gabriele Savatores) and advertising, and kept teaching comics drawing and sketching at Design Academy of Florence from 2007 to 2011. As of today, he still looks good, despite the fact he draws Prussians, moustache and big robots with Davide La Rosa.



After the crowdfunding

We are planning to create the second volume of Prussians vs Aliens. 

But we don't want to stop here, we want to create a series where it will be possible to read the adventure of the Prussian army.


We need your mustache

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help. In order to reach the goal, we need to share this project as much as possible: share the following pages on Facebook or Twitter, or even simply by e-mailing a friend!

  • For Italian www.prussianivsalieni.com
  • For English www.prussianivsalieni.com/english.html

All the gadget are created in collaboration with Camaloon, our bewhiskered partner:

You can find information about Prussians Vs Aliens in newspaper, blog and website
story_txt:
Summary

"Prussians Vs Aliens" is a humorous steampunk comic book written by Davide La Rosa, drawn by Riccardo Pieruccini and colored by Luca Salce and Mattia Zoanni.
The goal here is to give life to a new comic book series which could take the reader to a universe filled with steampunk robots and funny aliens.
In these pages, a historically revised Prussian army has to fight the menace coming from outer space. They'll be able to engage aliens with the help of a special task force, featuring six war heroes and their own huge steampunk robots: levers, pedals, chains, belts and steamy gears are going to be all over the place! 
The story is heavily inspired by Japanese anime's from the '70-'80s. If you enjoyed shows such as Mazinger, Grendizer or Daitan III or even Pacific Rim or Michael Bay's Transformers, this is going to be a real eye-candy for you! It's a huge quotes goldmine that will amuse and excite you from the beginning straight to the end.
The first chapter of the saga will be issued in 

two volumes
Colored
B5 format 

46 pages per volume. 


At the moment, just the first volume will be available in the crowdfunding campaign. However, if the campaign grows well, generous rewards will be added along the way.
The Plot
It's 1789. French Revolution is raging in the streets of Paris. 
No one cared to notice that the Prussians were busy fighting an alien menace and saving the world. But let's step back for a minute. 
A few weeks earlier, the fat King Frederick William II was experiencing the worst awakening of his life. Rumor has it, the whole Prussian horse fleet had disappeared. It couldn't get any worse for a country whose greatest army pride are the horses! After all, what's left of a XVIII Century army if you take the horses away from them?!Who took them away? Who could steal all of the animals in just one night without anyone noticing?! 
Intelligence agencies didn't take too long to discover that the culprit came from the sky. The kidnappers are the ruthless aliens coming straight from the moon! 
The horses had to be retrieved ASAP, no matter what. Yes, but how?! Now, the Prussians had a special army, a secret task force of six ruthless fighters, three men and three women. The best of the best of the Prussian Kingdom's army. 
Each of these agents will drive their own robot. Will the Prussians be able to ward off the alien threat?




How you can contribute
You can buy the first volume of Prussians vs Aliens at a special price:


Digital copy  €5

Comic book € 10 


Moreover we will offer special content like the wallpaper, commissions and three awesome pins:


It will be possible be part of the comic book as a Prussian or Alien character (the armies are always looking for new soldiers) thanks to the perk FIRST PERSON.

It will possible have a breakfast with the authors and... dulcis in fundo... the ACTION FIGURE.
We will create 5 Action figures inspired from this scene:


There will be also awesome stretch goals, but this is a secret! 
So contribute now to Prussians vs Aliens and you will discover how strong are men with mustache!


Why we need these funds We need € 6.500,00 to cover the expenses needed to produce the comic book, in particular:  € 3.000,00 for the 6 months of work needed to write, draw and color the book.
€ 1.500,00 for printing the book and create the gadgets.
€ 1.500,00 for taxes, Paypal and Indiegogo. 
€ 500,00 for the shipment costs.

1st Strecth Goal € 8000 - TShirt - achieved

(ONLY FOR FUNDERS) if you have already purchased the comic book,  just add € 18 to receive the official Prussians vs Aliens TShirt   


The Authors

Davide La Rosa was born in Como on June 23, 1980 (yes, Como was already there in the 80's). He did a lot of not really important things until 2001 when he attended the comic-book school "The New Heloise." Since 2002 he is co-founder of the "Bad drawn comics" magazine, which is still active, as active is his blog "Mulholland Dave", where he constantly publishes a badly drawn series of strips. In 2010 he started a collaboration with Nicola Pesce Editore and published three books since then. In 2011 he started working for "Star Comics" as a writer and publishes his own series, "Ninja nuns." He has also worked with the tv-show "Voyager" on Rai2 and for the magazine "CICAP." He does other things, too, and has 3 cats. He will die on a Wednesday.
Riccardo Pieruccini was born in Lucca in 1979. When he realized that he was in the 80's - after watching a long Mc Hammer movie - he decided to devote his body and soul to robot cartoons, which were very popular at that time, mainly because of the florid Japanese productions. The transition from anime to comics was his real initiation: reading, experimenting and hard working and training led him to a degree in painting at the Academy of Fine Arts in Florence and he became a fellow student of Simone Bianchi (Marvel), for whom he works from 2011. In 2001 he won the golden Pierlambicchi, but the passionate love for the robot world pushes him to focus on comic books. He has worked for Marvel as a supplier (Thanos series Rising, New Avengers, Original Sin), for Star Comics as a drawer (Cornelius, The Secret) and still as a drawer for Rainbow (Winx), alternating illustration works for movies (Gabriele Savatores) and advertising, and kept teaching comics drawing and sketching at Design Academy of Florence from 2007 to 2011. As of today, he still looks good, despite the fact he draws Prussians, moustache and big robots with Davide La Rosa.



After the crowdfunding We are planning to create the second volume of Prussians vs Aliens. 
But we don't want to stop here, we want to create a series where it will be possible to read the adventure of the Prussian army.




We need your mustache
 
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help. In order to reach the goal, we need to share this project as much as possible: share the following pages on Facebook or Twitter, or even simply by e-mailing a friend!
For Italian www.prussianivsalieni.com

For English www.prussianivsalieni.com/english.html



All the gadget are created in collaboration with Camaloon, our bewhiskered partner:
You can find information about Prussians Vs Aliens in newspaper, blog and website

story:
Welcome!

Hi, my name is Mike Kunkel. I'm a cartoonist.  

It is now the 20th Anniversary of my all-ages comic series"Herobear and the kid" and we are finishing up production on a very special huge hard cover book. 


For over 25 years i've worked as a cartoonist telling stories and creating characters for all-ages audiences . . . It's what i dreamed of being when i was growing up in southern California. Scribbling on homework papers, collecting comic books, and drawing my own characters and stories ever since i was a little kid. 

      I've been blessed to Design and Animate characters for Animation projects . . . and Write and Illustrate stories for Film and Books.  I've worked on Feature Movies and TV Shows for Disney, Warner Bros, Sony, Paramount Studios, Nickelodeon, and Cartoon Network. . . Launched the DC Comics All-Ages "Billy Batson and the Magic of Shazam"  comic series, as well as designing the "Swampy" character for the "Where's my Water?" Game For Disney. 

      And, my most special project has always been one very close to my heart . . .  

 . . .  "Herobear and the Kid." 

_______________________


This Campaign!

We've hit some unexpected snags here at the end of the production of the new "HEROBEAR and the Kid " HARDCOVER BOOK. . . with the tremendous increase in costs and materials . . .  it has increased in cost by almost 35%. 
The book has grown by nearly 200 pages(awesome), but there are extra tariff costs now, shipping fees have gone up, and elevated material costs that have unexpectedly hit us hard as we are trying to finish the project.(not so awesome).  


So, we're trying to work it all out and get to the final finish line of this project. 

And we could use a little bit of help. 
That's why this lil' campaign exists. 

____________________________

The Goal of this campaign.

We are hoping to raise 1k-5k or more to help with the extra unexpected costs we are encountering.

This funding will go to finishing the print production, which includes more pages and material cost increases.   And it will help to alleviate the added tariff expenses that have been added to our production.   Also, it will help with upcoming shipping costs which have increased. 

___________________________
Special PERKS.

To thank everyone for contributing to this fundraiser, we are offering a Special thank-you gifts.  The MAIN PERK is a poster print of the inside cover illustration of the hard cover book.   

 

___________________________
Add-Ons

Also, backers are able to add-on some EXTRA SPECIAL ADD-ONS toooo . . . such as a Herobear Trading Card featuring Herobear,  a special limited ink scribble Batman print.  AND you can even get an original Herobear pencil head sketch added on. 

________________________________________

Check them all out in the perks over on the side and then once you pick a perk, you can add-on the extras----->.

________________________________________

Your Amazing Help.

This is a voluntary fundraiser.  It isn't a prerequisite for original backers to get their original pledges/rewards of the Hard Cover.  But . . . every little bit helps in the production/costs and we thank you for considering this and for helping in whatever way you can.  You are all amazing and we so appreciate your time in visiting and considering this campaign. 
 

 

Risks & Challenges

We know the challenge is to raise awareness for extra funding for an existing project. We want to thank everyone for considering this campaign and are so appreciative of the encouragement.  We hope to provide an opportunity for fans to join in to help smooth the project over the finish line.

story:
fallingflower

BRAUN: Move closer to the microphone, please.

Hey. My name is Jesse. I put words in a certain order, and people sometimes like them. Sometimes they don't, too, but hopefully that changes!

I've already written a comic, Tegan and Archer (https://www.comixology.com/Tegan-and-Archer-1/digital-comic/292116). So this isn't my first rodeo! But it will be my first two part comic, as I'd like to get two issues of this new series completed. I found a fabulous artist, and he's already helped me design two of the wonderful characters you'll find in the book.

The Amazing Red Diamond is a love letter to the Golden Age of comics. The book centers on the title character, whose real name is Joseph “Lucky” Haskins. Lucky lives in a world where being a superhero has become a fad. They are the new rock stars, and you are not considered cool unless you have a cape and a nom de guerre. This makes it hard for heroes to obtain notoriety in the press, even if – like Lucky – they have actual powers. In the first two issues Lucky encounters trouble with his arch nemesis, Rush Hour, the duo Rubber and Glue, villainous team Hell's Kitchen, and a member of the Golden League, the heroine Midnight in Paris (pictured below).

    

"So what do you need from me," you ask?

FLAMBÉ: Dunno. Maybe when you hit the big leagues, you remember Flambé, eh?

So I'm looking to hire my artist to help me complete the project! I don't keep any of the raised money myself, it all goes into the project. If we make more than necessary, the comic only gets better! It is easy to say, "but shouldn't an artist work for exposure?" The answer is a resounding, "No." People deserve to be paid for their work, including artists. And I am happy to do so, I just need a little help to make that happen!

As a contributor, you'll get a copy of the comic and more than likely a copy of my last comic, Tegan and Archer.

Every hero faces adversity.

THE CHEF: Time to eighty-six the hero.
Risk to you is low. The project will happen. How QUICKLY it happens will depend entirely on how much funding is raised. If I have to go to private funding, it's just going to slow down, but it WILL happen! Just look at Tegan and Archer. It took a while, but it happened!

Send up the signal!

RED DIAMOND: Why is no one ever around to hear these things?
Just get the word out! Even if you can't help now, keep an eye out for the first issue! Or just go get Tegan and Archer!

story:
The Destiny Mountain Demon

A new horror story appears in the Destiny Mountain Demon. Our story will follow a reporter investigating the tale of two brothers being hunted by a vicious killer. Will they escape while the boys try to summon the mystical Demon of Destiny Mountain? Or will the story filled with gore end with two more murders?

Destiny Mountain Demon will be available from IndieGoGo soon in two forms. The black & white book has an art style similar to Eerie and Warren books of the bygone era of golden-age horror. A stretch goal second edition will feature color pages for those seeking a different flavored reading experience.

Support the Destiny Mountain Demon on IndieGoGo and discover the series writer Lonnie Webb lovingly presents.

Destiny Mountain Demon written and illustrated by Lonnie Webb(Fat Girl, Mister Tatters, Thru, Killing Wirth, Science is Magic) with fellow inker Emanuel Sotomayor.

Welcome, horror and thriller readers!

Perks for your approval:

  • B&W comic will be completed in a few days (long before the campaign ends) and will be immediately printed and shipped after funding is complete.
  • Digital edition in PDF format will go out at the same time as the printed edition.
  • Additional digital comics will be bundled.
  • At least one stretch goal will be offered. 1) At $1000.00 we will make the color edition. Other stretch goals may be introduced in the future, such as variant covers and poster prints.

Who is going to love this book?

  • Comic collectors seeking multiple variant covers

  • Comic readers familiar with the Eerie and Warren horror magazines

  • Vampirella and Conan readers

  • Horror readers

  • Mystery readers

Support independent comic producers

No secret to anybody, the industry beat itself down bad this year. Support the producers that are good at what they do. Many do it for the sake of making art. Likewise, Lonnie Webb has a history of delivering scifi and crime stories for readers prior to crowdfunding as a matter of principle.

Risks & Challenges

Barring a horrible occurance like a pandemic or something... This is a guaranteed delivery. The art is in production and will be print ready before the campaign starts.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help us to get the word out and make noise on your social networks about Destiny Mountain Demon.
  • Contact us to find more about the Destiny Mountain Demon!
  • Remember: the B&W comic will be completed in a few days (before the campaign ends) and will be shipped after funding is complete.
  • Digital versions will go out at the same time as the B&W.
  • Aim for that stretch goal and we will make the color comic.

story:
What is NARHWAL PRESENTS?

Disintegration Street is one of Narwhal's top 3 favorite indie books of all time, it has the potential to be an extreme indie darling and beacon of CG talent.

But it only sold 47 copies originally!

I'm offering a second chance through my own indiegogo profile to hopefully boost the book's visibility and street cred and give it a few more sales.

BRENDEN SWAN is the creator, and HE will be ordering copies and begin fulfilling immediately after the 2-week campaign ends.

My role is solely as marketer/promoter.  I guarantee fulfillment, or a full refund.

I won't be doing this with ANY other projects in the near or far future.  I only chose to do this with DisintegrationStreet because the unique qualities that it - 

a. Is a truly great book.

b. Underperformed on it's original campaign.

c. It actually fits the Narwhal brand quite well, more on this below

 

 

 

DisintegrationStreet Second Chance

Imagine the nostalgia of a great old Scooby Doo episode, the fun spooky vibe, the great characters, the well structured mystery.

Now mix that with the Japanese horror of someone like Junji Ito.

Congratulations, you've just conceptualized the genius that is Disintegrationstreet.

With art that is ALL TRADITIONALLY COLORED, it has such a beautiful unique look, I can't get over it.

It feels like one of those indie books that kind of confuses you at first, where you might ask yourself, 'wait, Is this one of the best things I've ever read? I'm not even sure what metric to try to form an opinion, yet.'  Then it slowly seeps into your subconscious and you fall in love.

The reason I mention this is because many people have said that about my book, Earthbound.  This is the main reason I really want to help Disintegration Street.  It feels in line with that Narwhal brand.  A great premiere launch for Narwhal Presents.  And it's 165 pages!

And remember, the book is already complete and has been fulfilled once already.  This campaign is short and sharp, will fulfill immediately after funding.  Brenden Swan will be handling fulfillment, which is why I'm comfortable running the campaign on my Indiegogo profile.

We are keeping it SUPER SIMPLE for clarity and ease of fulfillment.  Just the book.

Can't wait to share!

Summary

Join Charlotte as she starts her new life in the mysterious town of DisintegrationStreet, filled with the bizarre. The dead coming back to life, children being spirited away, a dead body fused into a wall, a man whose every girlfriend commits suicide, and a cult of male virgins.


Reluctant to become involved, Charlotte finds she has little choice when she is revealed to be key to solving the many mysteries of DisintegrationStreet. However, there are those that want to keep these secrets hidden. If Charlotte's not careful, she could end up as a ghost trapped in DisintegrationStreet forever. 165 pages, all colored traditionally.

story:
Beneath a World of Wonder lies the Future of Today 

E.A.R.S. (Emergency Action Response Squads) is a thrilling family adventure in which a secret organization hidden beneath the world's most famous and magical theme park must resurrect itself to save the planet.

In 1955, Xavier Milton, founder of E.A.R.S. and creator and architect of the park, sends E.A.R.S. agent Bartholomew Chavez on a mission to hide a device from their arch enemies, the evil S.H.A.D.O. organization.  It was a mission from which Chavez would never return.  Years later, a new generation of E.A.R.S agents have come under attack and are defeated, leaving the world’s last hope in the hands of children; the family members of today's captured E.A.R.S. agents.

From the jungles of the Amazon to the highest peaks of the Himalayas and all the way into Outer Space, six children must unravel a set of cryptic clues over 50 years old as they race to find the key to the mysterious “Midas Touch” and in the process save the world. 

...and there's even a Yeti.

 

The Skinny

I wrote E.A.R.S. originally as an original screenplay with visions of Pixar, Dreamworks and Sony dancing in my head, but one day recently I asked myself, "what if?"  The lack of thrilling adventure stories with original characters for today's children has sparked in me a passion to bring this project to the world, and comic books is the perfect medium wherein to make its debut.  When I was a child there were brand new properties popping up left and right.  Today however all we have are 20-30 year old revamps and reiterations of the same IPs we had as children.  E.A.R.S. is new and it's bold and fresh and smart and designed to capture the imagination of not just a new generation, but also those like myself who miss the days when adventure stories were the rule, not the exception.

 

 

 

 

 

 

E.A.R.S. is fun and has heart and will leave you both breathless and wantingmore by the time all is said and done with our initial adventure.  And you dear reader can make it happen.

 

Lend me your E.A.R.S.

With this campaign we are looking to fund the production of a full 112- page graphic novel chronicling the E.A.R.S. team's inaugural adventure.  Your generous contributions will help pay our artist and production team as well as launch the title via iTunes, Amazon, and other outlets both in print and digital.

Every little bit we receive will get us closer to realizing this wonderful tale whose message was crafted to empower children to not only believe in themselves, but also to believe they can make a difference.

In a world that is often crazy and can be a bit too much to take, who doesn't want that for their family?

We are running a simple "No Muss No Fuss" campaign for E.A.R.S. with three simple tiers.

$20 gets you a digital copy of the graphic novel, along with a digital copy of the original E.A.R.S. screenplay.  Great to read on your Apple, Android, or Amazon touchpad.

$35 gets you a Indiegogo exclusive original cover, softcover edition of E.A.R.S. signed by the writer and artist along with a digital copy of the original E.A.R.S. screenplay.

$50 gets you an Indiegogo exclusive original cover signed by the writer and artist alone with a digital copy of the original E.A.R.S. screenplay.

Each hard and soft cover print copy will be a limited edition and only available via this campaign.  Once they are done we will never print these covers again.

How's that for collectable?  Back us now if you want to make this happen!

 

 

 

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

And if you don't have the extra money to help us reach our goal, don't worry.  You can still help!  All you need to do is share this page with everyone you know, via Facebook, Twitter, and whatever social media platform you use.  Let the world know we're here and that we are aiming to make a difference in the lives of children while having tons of fun and a few explosions.

Just use some of Indiegogo's share tools to spread the word.  It only takes a second but the benefit could help us reach our goal.

And that’s all there is to it.  Thank you!

 

 

 

 

 

 

About us

Armageddon Dreamweaver Creative is the publisher of comic books "The Paranormals" and "Kurai Tenshi: The Dark Angels."  As well as contributing writing and voice elements for Sherlock Holmes Mysteries: The Case of the Innocent Man and Cowboys vs. Zombies, Armageddon Dreamweaver Creative is committed to producing thrilling genre entertainment in comic book and digital forms.
story_txt:
Beneath a World of Wonder lies the Future of Today 
E.A.R.S. (Emergency Action Response Squads) is a thrilling family adventure in which a secret organization hidden beneath the world's most famous and magical theme park must resurrect itself to save the planet.
In 1955, Xavier Milton, founder of E.A.R.S. and creator and architect of the park, sends E.A.R.S. agent Bartholomew Chavez on a mission to hide a device from their arch enemies, the evil S.H.A.D.O. organization.  It was a mission from which Chavez would never return.  Years later, a new generation of E.A.R.S agents have come under attack and are defeated, leaving the world’s last hope in the hands of children; the family members of today's captured E.A.R.S. agents.
From the jungles of the Amazon to the highest peaks of the Himalayas and all the way into Outer Space, six children must unravel a set of cryptic clues over 50 years old as they race to find the key to the mysterious “Midas Touch” and in the process save the world. 
...and there's even a Yeti.
