story:
Early Bird Incentive - first 10 backers get FREE PRINT COPIES of The End Is Totally Nigh issues #1 and #2!

YOUR VOTES WILL HELP DECIDE WHICH GRAPHIC NOVEL GETS CREATED

My name is Kara Barrett and I'm the writer/creator for this project. I recently launched the supernatural comic series, The End Is Totally Nigh at Alterna Comics.

I have two graphic novels currently in the works and I need for your help to make one of them into a reality. Both are compelling stories featuring beautiful artwork that you will love. Each contributor gets to vote for the concept they like the most!

Contribute today and when the campaign ends I'll send out a survey for votes.

No matter which book wins, you will have a beautiful, unique graphic novel and the satisfaction of supporting this indie project.

THE BOOK PITCHES

If you are a horror or a sci-fi geek like me, then I'm pretty sure you'll enjoy either of these. Here are the pitches:

Note: Both of these stories are intended for mature audiences only.

"Myth" A modern horror story (SAMPLE PAGES)

Betsy's life was wrapped up in a perfect bow. She was engaged to the man of her dreams and life was going along as planned.

But when a dark creature emerges from the ocean and finds Betsy and her fiance on the beach, things change dramatically. Betsy's life is impacted forever as she wakes up from the night of her tragic attack and discovers she has become modern day monster who needs to eat live human flesh to survive.

 VS.

"The Pleasure Craft" - A sci-fi robot thriller (SAMPLE PAGES)

It's the year 2073 and robots have become a routine part of society. Pleasure Craft, Inc. is the largest producer of robots in the world. These modern robots look and act almost perfectly human. But when one of them crashes a plane because "God" told him to do it, ex media darling Claire decides to go after to the truth. Inside the Pleasure Craft compound, she discovers something she never expected.

COOL ARTWORK

Both books will feature some great artwork. Your contribution will help pay the artists, letterer and editor. It will also go towards covering the costs of printing.

 

DID I MENTION THE REWARDS?

There will be a limited edition first run of the book and you can choose from several levels to receive yours along with posters and prints. I've also created reward tiers for:

  • Artists - Get a pinup featured in the book with your portfolio/twitter link! Great exposure for new artists (only 15 spots available)
  • Comic Lovers And Bloggers - get a signed script, exclusive previews, and more!
  • Resellers - Receive SIGNED LIMITED EDITION first printings of the book

WHERE DOES MY CONTRIBUTION GO?

That's a great question. Your contribution helps pay for:

  • 45 pages of fanstastic artwork (pencils/ink)
  • Professional editor to help with the script
  • Professional letterer
  • Professional cover art
  • Cover the cost of printing books and posters

CAMPAIGN LEVELS

$5000 - We can produce the black and white version of the winning book with color cover art

$10,500 - We can produce BOTH books in black and white (everyone gets a free poster and copy of both books)

$10K or more - Depending on the amount, we might able to produce the books in color

HOW DOES VOTING WORK?

When the goal deadline is met, we'll tally the results and send a report to everyone.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

We need all of the tweets, facebook posts and blog posts that we can get to help make this book happen. Please help us by:

  • Tweeting daily with a link to the project
  • Posting a link to facebook (just look for the share icons by the video/image area)
  • Blogging about the project

WE APPRECIATE YOUR SUPPORT!

If you would like to contact me, please feel free to message me or tweet to me online at @kbarrett.

story:
What Is This?

Thanks to everyone who helped us reach our goal! Please go to http://ldadcomic.wordpress.com if you want to get your copy of issue #1 or to learn more about the project. 


Last Ditch Attempt Detectives #1 is the first issue of a three part comic book series created by Ricky Chavez and Dan Becker. It follows Frank Cannon, a depression era private detective who is cursed with paranormal abilities.  With your help this can be the first of many projects to come! 

What We Need

The comic is finished and ready to go! If we can reach our goal  it will cover the cost of printing the first issue and we should have a little left over for promotion at a comic book convention or two. Of course the more money we raise the better we will be able to promote. This means getting to more conventions, getting booth spaces, and getting the book into the hands of more publishers and book reviewers. The more money we raise the more people we reach with our story. Reaching our goal would also help us to start production on the second issue ASAP.   

No matter how much money we raise we will be printing the book in some capacity. But if we can reach our goal we will be able to print an amount suitable for promotion and begin work on the next issue without hesitation. With the exception of the PFD(which is sent immediately) all perks will be sent out as soon as possible once the fundraising deadline has ended.  

   

Perk Details! 

$3- You will be sent a high resolution PDF of LDAD#1 immediately. Read It today! You will also be immortalized in the Thank You section of our blog. 

$10 We will mail you a physical copy of LDAD#1 once it is printed plus a sweet LDAD postcard as well as the PDF and the blog thank you.  

$20- Will get you everything above plus our first comic book project Winter City#1 a story about an unemployed young girl who befriends a suicidal turtle. LDAD#1 + Winter City#1 =54 pages of full color comic fun! 

$35- You get the blog thanks, postcard, PDF and physical copy of LDAD#1, Winter City#1, an 8x11 print of artwork. Not just a page out of the comic but a special piece done by Dan and printed up just for donors. You will also get a one of a kind Haiku just for you written by Ricky. 

$50-We'll give you A blog thanks, postcard, PDF and physical copy of LDAD#1, Winter City#1, an 8x11 special print, unique haiku PLUS: we will SIGN the comics. This is a big deal because we live in different states and Dan is always roaming the wilderness. You will also receive a one of a kind sketch from Dan based on an idea you choose. 

$75- All the $50 rewards plus Plus an awesome limited edition LDAD T-shirt. 

$100- All the $75 rewards plus an extra copy of LDAD#1 with a variant cover and signed by the creators. 

$175- All the $100 rewards plus you will also get a compilation of short stories and essays by Ricky which will include a story just for you based on a topic you choose. Dan will also draw your likeness as a ghost or ghoul to haunt Frank in issue#2. Now you are literally part of the project. 

$250-All the $175 plus an 11x17 piece of original hand-drawn full color art by Dan.

$375- All the $250 rewards plus Dan will design a tattoo for you plus we will also make an epic personalized Thank You video and send it to you on DVD and post a link to it on our blog.   
 
$550- All the $375 rewards plus Ricky will collaborate with you to design you a set of professional quality Business Cards. Ever wish you had a slick and unique business card to throw around at fancy parties? Now you will. Also you get your name and likeness portrayed as a supporting character in LDAD#2.

WOW that's a lot of stuff!   

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about our project to anyone you can! Visit http://ldadcomic.wordpress.com for more details! And Friend us on Facebook.

story:
About me and Mikenesses

I'm an illustrator living in Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada. I've been drawing comics for years (True Story, Shenanigans for Oni Press). Last October, I drew myself in the style of Bob's Burgers (one of my favorite shows). The next day, I did Home Movies, the day after that Clone High, and then Chuck Jones and Tintin and Frank Miller and it just took off from there. To date, I've drawn myself in 93 distinct styles.

I don't take any more than an hour on most of these - although a few have been a bit more complicated - and it's the most fun I've had drawing in a very long time.

This is a very personal project for me - I only draw styles from shows or artists that have influenced me, so what this has ended up becoming is a mosiac of who I am and where I come from. I didn't expect anything deep from this - I didn't really expect anything at all - but it's cool to step back and take a look at it all.

Money in, gifts out

I'm looking to raise $2200 - this would cover the cost of printing 150 books (full-color, 112 pages, 6x9) and shipping based on estimates I've received.

What you get when you pledge ranges from my eternal thanks for a $1 pledge to a full set of my books (signed) PLUS a custom color drawing of you in any cartoon style for $250!

I'm keeping the goal reasonable, but if I don't end up making the full amount, I'll still be ordering the books - just less of them. All gifts will still be honored!

The Impact

This is a pretty small goal, but it's the first time I've self-published and I think that with your help I can do it! I've gotten such a great response to this project of mine, and I'd love to be able to share it with more people.

Are you broke?

Yeah, I'm like that too sometimes. But if you like the idea, or have seen some of my work and liked it, but just don't have the funds to help out, would it be cool to help me spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr and other social media things? That would be worth so much to me. Thanks!

story:
Hello my friends!

Let me formally introduce my self! My name is Triston Milton, and I'm a muslim political/ social ficton writer from Minnesota going by the pen name BJK Milton. While i'm currently working on "The Diary of K." Series, a series which details the political schemes that will lead to a war between two powerful empires, and the major players that will lead the charge on the both sides.
I'm also a essays and short stories writer, I have always had a love for political satire and graphic novels. 

I was born and raised in Saint Paul Minnesota, and have always found a fascination with conficting with the stereotype that we place upon other's and ourselves. This idea and combined with my own personal experiences with the stereotype of being both african american and muslim has sparked and fueled my desire to write political fiction that shows and compares the stereotypes of humanity with the true person.

I write with the ideology of the 10% rule. This rule being that 10% of humanity fit into the stereotype, and 90% fight everyday to prove that stereoptype wrong. And it isn't just one race, religion or people that goes through this, its all people that face this challenge. This brings me the creative spur to write the type of free flowing, some what witty fiction that I write.

 

The Diary of K.: The Book of Gardenia

This current project that I'm working on is the first in a three part series know as the Diary of K. The Book of Gardenia is a fictional diary following Kimera, a girl who seems fixed on following in her father's footsteps. Over the course of the story, her journies and trials that will turn her from a young niave child, to a major player in the war, as well as the people who inspired, challenge, and guide her along the way.

The project has many themes that hit close to home for me, as it will for others. The idea of the political moves made within this alternate world shows  us as human beings how certain events, though small and insignificant to us, can come back to effect us in the future. It also brings light to many stereotypes and views and how these things can blind us to the wonderous possibilities. For example, in the story, Kimera's missunderstanding with various side characters bring about a closed view of them. But as her eyes begin to open up the wonderous world around her, alliances and rivalries change her into the great leader she will become. 

A third theme that hits home to me is the fact that Kimera, through her actions becomes submerged into a somewhat muslim world, where she actually learns things that shift her ideology. I personally can relate to this because prior to converting to islam, I knew absolutly nothing about it. But interactions, just like Kimera, shifted my perspective and opened doors for me, and her that were not there before. And the best part,I, like the main character Kimera, learned from them. 

What will be Achieved

Through this project I wish to do to things with it and these things can not be achieved without the aid of you. 

Open your eyes

With this project I wish to conflict various stereotypes that affect people who are like me, where ever there from. To bring this conflict and bring to the light things and information that may not be accessible to others. It is good to bring interest and desire to become informed to an audience. I wish to do this without conflicting with the audience in any way. I wish to enlighten in a way that is entertaining at the same time. With this book, along with the entire Diary of K. Series, I wish to this.

Behind the War

With the entire Diary of K. Series I wish to show the people behind the wars, and how it effects the people who maybe in the thick of it. We sometimes don't think of the effects a certain decision has on people on the outside of our own circle. With this fictional book I wish to only show the affects of character's decisions on the other people. THis is why I decided to right this as a Character Driven fictional diary. This allows me to bring various decisions closer to each other and there Affects without conflicting with the norms of society. 

The Diary of K. Book of Gardenia follows Kimera (whose reall name in the story is Kristopher Wells) from her childhood through her teen years as she becomes more submerged in the lives of others, to her adult year where she learns what it takes to be a great and loved leader. 

What We Need & What You Get

To get this project off the ground we are in need of $5000. These funds secure us a dedicated illustrator Charles Price who I've worked with prior, and his services. He has a very unique way of blending art and writing together that I've enjoyed in the past. These funds will allow us his undivided attention and time to flush out the illustration to bring the story to life infront of your eyes. If you are intrigued and would like more information on our illustrator, as well as seeing samples of his work and even seeing the sketches he has done so far, visit our mock website at 

http://www.wix.com/bjkmilton/gardenia

These funds are needed to get the project off the ground and will be used to create the following items.

6 blended color and B&W character key @ $250 per character

4 Blended color and B&W Enviroment Keys @ $300 per page

The First five comic pages of the book @ $315 per page

We are shooting for a 150 page graphic novel but these are what we need at minimum to get the project off the ground. 

The Rewards

There are four rewards that we are offering.

$10 worth of thank you! -  What if the author of a book sent you a thank you card? Well I'm not talking about a simple "Oh thank you for your contribution?" But a Thank you card with three sketches right out of the book that no one else will have access to prior to the release of the book or after. Now this collectors item will be laminated in 8 x 10 letter size for you, as well as signed by the illustrator and Author.

$25 The Concepts - When you put your hard earned dollar into something you ask yourself "Where is it going" Well for you I have the answer. When you contrabute to this project we will send you a book with  all the sketches as  well as a character description, eviroment description, and even the first five pages of the book with what many can call "Comentary" at the bottom.

$100 The special edition - When you stare at a project that you had a hand in making, word to word, picture to picture, cover to cover, you know the feeling of accomplishment. Well for those who will be are helping us the most, we feel it is only right you see the final product before anyone else, so you can feel and see the work that you had a hand in completing. And with it he would like to send you the mock cover signed and printed. 

$500 Before anyone else - For those few who we are luck and blessed to get have that will aid us in getting this project to the next level, we offer you five framed posters signed by the illustrator and the author. The Posters inculde "The First Page" before its published, the mock promotional cover, a character key posterized, a School House Portrait of the six primary characters, and a family Portrait with the main character and her family.

Also know that any contributor, no matter what the contribution will recieve access to the first five pages upon completion. THis is to raise awareness and show you where we are at.

Other Ways You Can Help

We will be placing updates on the site we made for it, as well as here on this page to let you know where we are progress wise every monday. Now with this said if you like what you see, do the neighborly thing and share with your friends and family, rather through the use of ndiegogo share tools, or simply via word of mouth. We are hoping to bring this project to the light as a means of bring light to some of the many aspects it shines on. So simple bring awareness to these things is enough for us. So let us know what you think!

And that’s all there is to it.
story_txt:
Hello my friends!
Let me formally introduce my self! My name is Triston Milton, and I'm a muslim political/ social ficton writer from Minnesota going by the pen name BJK Milton. While i'm currently working on "The Diary of K." Series, a series which details the political schemes that will lead to a war between two powerful empires, and the major players that will lead the charge on the both sides. I'm also a essays and short stories writer, I have always had a love for political satire and graphic novels. 
I was born and raised in Saint Paul Minnesota, and have always found a fascination with conficting with the stereotype that we place upon other's and ourselves. This idea and combined with my own personal experiences with the stereotype of being both african american and muslim has sparked and fueled my desire to write political fiction that shows and compares the stereotypes of humanity with the true person.
I write with the ideology of the 10% rule. This rule being that 10% of humanity fit into the stereotype, and 90% fight everyday to prove that stereoptype wrong. And it isn't just one race, religion or people that goes through this, its all people that face this challenge. This brings me the creative spur to write the type of free flowing, some what witty fiction that I write.
 
The Diary of K.: The Book of Gardenia
This current project that I'm working on is the first in a three part series know as the Diary of K. The Book of Gardenia is a fictional diary following Kimera, a girl who seems fixed on following in her father's footsteps. Over the course of the story, her journies and trials that will turn her from a young niave child, to a major player in the war, as well as the people who inspired, challenge, and guide her along the way.
The project has many themes that hit close to home for me, as it will for others. The idea of the political moves made within this alternate world shows  us as human beings how certain events, though small and insignificant to us, can come back to effect us in the future. It also brings light to many stereotypes and views and how these things can blind us to the wonderous possibilities. For example, in the story, Kimera's missunderstanding with various side characters bring about a closed view of them. But as her eyes begin to open up the wonderous world around her, alliances and rivalries change her into the great leader she will become. 
A third theme that hits home to me is the fact that Kimera, through her actions becomes submerged into a somewhat muslim world, where she actually learns things that shift her ideology. I personally can relate to this because prior to converting to islam, I knew absolutly nothing about it. But interactions, just like Kimera, shifted my perspective and opened doors for me, and her that were not there before. And the best part,I, like the main character Kimera, learned from them. 
What will be Achieved
Through this project I wish to do to things with it and these things can not be achieved without the aid of you. 
Open your eyes
With this project I wish to conflict various stereotypes that affect people who are like me, where ever there from. To bring this conflict and bring to the light things and information that may not be accessible to others. It is good to bring interest and desire to become informed to an audience. I wish to do this without conflicting with the audience in any way. I wish to enlighten in a way that is entertaining at the same time. With this book, along with the entire Diary of K. Series, I wish to this.
Behind the War
With the entire Diary of K. Series I wish to show the people behind the wars, and how it effects the people who maybe in the thick of it. We sometimes don't think of the effects a certain decision has on people on the outside of our own circle. With this fictional book I wish to only show the affects of character's decisions on the other people. THis is why I decided to right this as a Character Driven fictional diary. This allows me to bring various decisions closer to each other and there Affects without conflicting with the norms of society. 
The Diary of K. Book of Gardenia follows Kimera (whose reall name in the story is Kristopher Wells) from her childhood through her teen years as she becomes more submerged in the lives of others, to her adult year where she learns what it takes to be a great and loved leader. 


What We Need & What You Get
To get this project off the ground we are in need of $5000. These funds secure us a dedicated illustrator Charles Price who I've worked with prior, and his services. He has a very unique way of blending art and writing together that I've enjoyed in the past. These funds will allow us his undivided attention and time to flush out the illustration to bring the story to life infront of your eyes. If you are intrigued and would like more information on our illustrator, as well as seeing samples of his work and even seeing the sketches he has done so far, visit our mock website at 
http://www.wix.com/bjkmilton/gardenia
These funds are needed to get the project off the ground and will be used to create the following items.
6 blended color and B&W character key @ $250 per character
4 Blended color and B&W Enviroment Keys @ $300 per page
The First five comic pages of the book @ $315 per page
We are shooting for a 150 page graphic novel but these are what we need at minimum to get the project off the ground. 
The Rewards
There are four rewards that we are offering.
$10 worth of thank you! -  What if the author of a book sent you a thank you card? Well I'm not talking about a simple "Oh thank you for your contribution?" But a Thank you card with three sketches right out of the book that no one else will have access to prior to the release of the book or after. Now this collectors item will be laminated in 8 x 10 letter size for you, as well as signed by the illustrator and Author.
$25 The Concepts - When you put your hard earned dollar into something you ask yourself "Where is it going" Well for you I have the answer. When you contrabute to this project we will send you a book with  all the sketches as  well as a character description, eviroment description, and even the first five pages of the book with what many can call "Comentary" at the bottom.
$100 The special edition - When you stare at a project that you had a hand in making, word to word, picture to picture, cover to cover, you know the feeling of accomplishment. Well for those who will be are helping us the most, we feel it is only right you see the final product before anyone else, so you can feel and see the work that you had a hand in completing. And with it he would like to send you the mock cover signed and printed. 
$500 Before anyone else - For those few who we are luck and blessed to get have that will aid us in getting this project to the next level, we offer you five framed posters signed by the illustrator and the author. story:
My name is Preston Poulter, and I make a lot of comics

I've successfully funded and fulfilled six issues of my two different comic titles, White Lily and Guinevere and the Divinity Factory.

Here's a link to a free PDF download of the first issue of Guinevere.

As you can see, it's a beautiful book. Once you read it, I'm pretty sure you want to read issue 2.

Who is White Widow?

White Widow is the flagship super hero of the Absolute Comics line. It's a good seller for me so I commissioned 500 of my own cover of White Widow #4. Take a look.

Only 500 of these comic were printed. In addition, there are 5 metal printed covers.

Guinevere #2 Breaking Free Virgin Cover

I enjoyed that image so much that I decided to take it and modify it for my Guinevere story line. Of this cover, I'm printing a total run of 150.

The left image below is the "Chains that Bind" cover which sold out in comic form. However, that image is available as a comic sized metal print. On the right is the Paolo Pantalena cover for issue 1. 

Risks & Challenges

These books are already printed and ready for delivery. My Indiegogo campaigns typically fulfill 1 week after the campaign concludes OR LESS.

How does this comic compare?

Fans of Lady Death by Brian Pulido, Cyberfrog by Ethan Van Sciver, Gabriel Picolo's Icarus and the Sun, Mike S Miller's Lonestar: Heart of a Hero, Jon Malin's Graveyard Shift, Mitch Breitweiser's Red Rooster: Golden Age / Futurists, or Richard C Meyer's Jawbreakers: Lost Souls / G0d-K1ng or Pandemic will all be disappointed as those books are far superior to anything I will ever produce. Now, in comparison to Vestige, the book is far superior. I've seen the creativity from WarCampaign. Nuff said.

story:
NEW GOAL!!! Help us reach $8,000

Each contribution pledged will be used toward the publication of Issue #2. After consultation, we have been able to lower the goal to $8,000! We can't change the goal on Indiegogo, but we have already selected FLEX FUNDING, which means we will still use every dollar pledged.

Thanks for your support!

 

Did you miss Issue #1? Download the first 14 pages here!

 

Help us Continue the Story with Issue #2!

One year ago, 186 backers helped fund Finnian and the Seven Mountains: Issue #1. Ever since its release in August, readers keep on asking, "Where's Issue #2?"

Here it is!

We are ready to continue the journey of Finnian and Brendan, but we need your help! We plan on dedicating even more time and energy on this new chapter to create stunning visuals and an engaging story. Additionally, we want Finnian and the Seven Mountains to reach an even wider audience. We firmly believe in the power of stories to shape minds and hearts. It is our hope to give readers, both young and old alike, a story that is captivating and entertaining, while also upholding the true, good and beautiful.

 

About Issue #2

Finnian’s quest continues as he and Brendan use an ancient map to discover a mysterious island in hopes of finding a legendary sword with the extraordinary power to defeat evil and prevent the Vikings from further pillaging the land. Along the way they meet the mysterious stowaway, Merewyn, and discover there is more to their quest than they imagined. 

At the same time, a fierce Viking king, Ragnar, threatens the monastic community on the Irish island of Skellig Michael as he begins his own violent quest for the same sword. 

Who will reach the sword first? Will evil triumph or good prevail?

 

This Issue Will Introduce...

Merewyn

As Finnian and Brendan continue their travels, they will encounter new friends and foes. In Issue #2, they will meet Merewyn, a courageous young woman who has lost everything and is ready to embrace whatever adventure comes her way. 

 

Praise for Issue #1

"Let Kosloski and LaVoy take you back to the real history of the island of Irish monks we saw in The Last Jedi and then watch them layer an epic yarn on top of it." -- Matt Forbeck, The Marvel Encyclopedia, New York Times-bestselling author 

"FINNIAN AND THE SEVEN MOUNTAINS by Philip Kosloski and Michael Lavoy bring us a taste of Irish lore. And we want more." -- ComicsVerse

"Featuring mystery, high-stakes adventure, and breathtaking art, this first installment of Finnian and the Seven Mountains is sure to enchant readers, young and old alike. I can't wait to see where this saga takes us!" -- Brandon Hale,  bestselling author of Prince Martin Wins His Sword.

"This is a very good beginning to a new comic series, and I look forward to reading the rest of the series." -- Geeks Under Grace

 

Meet the Creative Team

CREATOR/WRITER - Philip Kosloski is a writer well known for his accessible articles on topics of spirituality and Church history at Aleteia.org as well as his popular non-fiction book (The Last Monks of Skellig Michael) which inspired this project.

ARTIST - Michael LaVoy is an up-and-coming artist known for his stunning Living Sparks of God coloring book for kids and for Finnian and the Seven Mountains Issue #1.

CONSULTING EDITOR - Lewis Helfand A freelance comic book writer and editor, Lewis Helfand's credits include the award-winning Mother Teresa for Campfire Comics and Nelson Mandela: The Unconquerable Soul; named graphic novel of the year at Comic-Con India.

CONSULTING EDITOR - Cody DeBos​

 

About Voyage Comics

Where legends come to life! 

We seek to inspire young and old with legendary comics and stories that captivate the hearts of all, inviting the reader to discover truth, beauty and goodness.

Funds raised during this campaign will ultimately help us continue our mission. 

It is our hope that with each issue we will get closer and closer to building a new comic book universe, filled with virtuous heroes and heroines that young people can aspire to emulate. Yet at the same time, we don't want to preach, but entertain, making the true, good and beautiful an enjoyable feast for all to enjoy!

Read more about our mission here.

This is just the beginning of something great!

 

Campaign Goal

The campaign goal to publish Issue #2 is $23,000. This means that if we do not reach that number, we will not be able to produce the comic book on schedule. HOWEVER, we are using "Flex-Funding" for this campaign, which means that if we don't meet the goal, we will begin production, albeit, at a much slower pace. We hope to devote more time and energy into this next issue and to get it in your hands much sooner than last time, but we can't do that if we don't reach our goal.

Perks

*Note, if you are interested in multiple perks or a custom combination, send us a message and we will do what we can to accommodate your request!

Map

T-Shirt

St. Michael Print

Issue #1

Yet at the same time, we don't want to preach, but entertain, making the true, good and beautiful an enjoyable feast for all to enjoy!Read more about our mission here.This is just the beginning of something great! Campaign GoalThe campaign goal to publish Issue #2 is $23,000. This means that if we do not reach that number, we will not be able to produce the comic book on schedule. HOWEVER, we are using "Flex-Funding" for this campaign, which means that if we don't meet the goal, we will begin production, albeit, at a much slower pace. We hope to devote more time and energy into this next issue and to get it in your hands much sooner than last time, but we can't do that if we don't reach our goal.Perks*Note, if you are interested in multiple perks or a custom combination, send us a message and we will do what we can to accommodate your request!MapT-ShirtSt. Michael PrintIssue #1

story:
• THE CREATORS -     Hello, my name is Sean Gabay and I'm a writer who lives in Chicago. I've written sketches that have been featured on Nerdist.com Funny or Die as well as Second City. Currently, I write webcomics such as Junk, a collection of humor comics with a rotating group of artists that can be found at Junkcomic.com, and Dave & Dave on Bentnode.com. James Whynot is an artist who draws monsters, zombies, and all other nightmarish creatures in the funny books.
  • THE BOOK - Kitties! Black metal! Comics! These are just a few things James Whynot and I love. So, earlier in the year, I decided these three things should come together. What came out of it are sixty pages of adventure!

Oslo takes place in the early 90's and tells the story of four cats who lose their home in a church burning. Homeless and alone they set out to find their owner...

....adventure ensues!

When I started writing Oslo, I wanted anyone to be able to pick it up and enjoy it. So even if you don't know anything about black metal, or even like it, there's still a really fun story here that is easy to read. 

First two pages!

story:
Who are we?

Metropolis Comix was a staple in the greater Sacramento area for nearly a decade. “Citizens of Metropolis”, thats what Chris, our beloved friend and owner would call every single one of us. What Chris created was something very special. Metropolis wasn’t a “buy & go” comic shop; it was a hangout destination, a place to escape, and most importantly a place where he made you feel welcomed and in love with the wide-realm of the graphic novel world. It felt like a home away from home.

Many of us knew Chris long before Metropolis opened in 2008. He used to work in a local comic/card shop as an employee. An employee that many of us quickly became dependent on. Quite simply, its not easy to find someone with the skillset that Chris had. He didn’t sell comics, he sold stories that fit your forte and had you coming back for more enjoyment and love for the comic world. Over the years, customers would come in on a daily basis requesting for Chris to suit their comic needs, in which his customer base today grew in the thousands. Many of us were in grade school when we first met Chris and are now in our mid twenties and thirties! 

When the sad news was announced that Metropolis was closing down, Citizens of Metropolis came storming into the store to share their memories and impacts that Chris left on their lives, and in the end we all realized how important the store was to us. With Metropolis, Chris created something far more than tangible. It’s not the store that matters, it’s everyone that was apart of it. The Metropolis community was a culture. You could walk in on a Friday night and see all walks of life. There were trading card tournaments on one end, comic “hipsters” dumpster-diving through 1990s comics on the other end, memorabilia nerds on the front table, comic collectors carrying magnified glasses to make sure Chris and his team have bagged and boarded their comics to mint standards, and young talented artist Chris Botterill would have tables set up and create art for local shoppers.

 

Unfortunately due to a series of unfortunate circumstances, Metropolis Comix closed its doors on December of 2017. Most of us took it hard, many of us took it personal, some of us wanted to do something about it, but all of us deeply want our Metropolis back. 

 

 

WHAT ARE WE GOING TO DO TO BRING OUR COMMUNITY BACK? 

Action Plan:

Well to start... we are selling a variety of art on Indiegogo! With your help, this should be our prime resource for raising funds. With the hard work of local Sacramento artists and citizens of metropolis we can rebuild metropolis once again!

  • Selling art & raising funds at SacAnime January 5th-7th!
  • Art Auction @ 18grams Coffee Shop in Elk Grove Ca  Febuary 2018 (date TBA) 
  • More guerrilla marketing to be announced!

 

 

WHAT ARE OUR FUTURE PLANS AFTER WE ME OUR GOAL?

 

UPDATE: We found a location in Elk Grove near Dutch Bros Coffee. We are expected to open by March 2018. Please Support this page to make our relocation proccess speedy and succesful!

 

 Quite simply, like many of us we all want to help bring metropolis back one way or another. Some of us are creating art for free to raise funds, some of us are buying that art to raise money, but we will be successful in this fight if we spread awareness outside our community!

 

 Under this new metropolis, management will be under the supervision of Chris, Moody, Ethan, Richard and the Metropolis team! There will be no outside partners or financial investors.

You could walk in on a Friday night and see all walks of life. There were trading card tournaments on one end, comic “hipsters” dumpster-diving through 1990s comics on the other end, memorabilia nerds on the front table, comic collectors carrying magnified glasses to make sure Chris and his team have bagged and boarded their comics to mint standards, and young talented artist Chris Botterill would have tables set up and create art for local shoppers. Unfortunately due to a series of unfortunate circumstances, Metropolis Comix closed its doors on December of 2017. Most of us took it hard, many of us took it personal, some of us wanted to do something about it, but all of us deeply want our Metropolis back.   WHAT ARE WE GOING TO DO TO BRING OUR COMMUNITY BACK? Action Plan:Well to start... we are selling a variety of art on Indiegogo! With your help, this should be our prime resource for raising funds. With the hard work of local Sacramento artists and citizens of metropolis we can rebuild metropolis once again!
Selling art & raising funds at SacAnime January 5th-7th!
Art Auction @ 18grams Coffee Shop in Elk Grove Ca  Febuary 2018 (date TBA) 
More guerrilla marketing to be announced!
  WHAT ARE OUR FUTURE PLANS AFTER WE ME OUR GOAL? UPDATE: We found a location in Elk Grove near Dutch Bros Coffee. We are expected to open by March 2018. Please Support this page to make our relocation proccess speedy and succesful!  Quite simply, like many of us we all want to help bring metropolis back one way or another. Some of us are creating art for free to raise funds, some of us are buying that art to raise money, but we will be successful in this fight if we spread awareness outside our community!  Under this new metropolis, management will be under the supervision of Chris, Moody, Ethan, Richard and the Metropolis team! There will be no outside partners or financial investors.

story:
You’ve been driving all night. An endless Ontario highway stretches out before you with nothing but the occasional burned shell of an old barn dotting the scenery. The coffee’s long since worn off. Your eyes are weary. You haven’t seen another living soul in hours. You’re practically laughing with delirium.  Suddenly, the outline of a small town crests the horizon.  Perhaps it’s a sanctuary for a weary traveler. Perhaps you can stop at a motel and get a few hours before heading on with your journey.  It beckons to you. Inviting you. Lulling you towards it. But the closer you get, the more you feel it. The chill. The stillness. But more than anything, you feel the darkness. It begins to surround you, like it can see every bad thought you’ve ever had. Uneasy, you feel maybe you shouldn’t stop after all, but you know you will anyways. A cruel wind seems to be whispering “You’re home.” And then you see the sign “WELCOME TO BLACK HOLLOW”. 

Founded in the early 1800s, something dark has plagued the town of Black Hollow since its inception, crawling its way into its darkest residents and terrorizing its most helpless. By daylight, the town is a quaint portrait of small-town Canadian life, full of wonders, good people, young love, and even a growing art scene. But in the unforgiving night, it is a place of damnation that encourages evil to flourish in the most unexpected of places.

Spanning different eras of the town’s storied individuals, the series will explore the creeping dread buried at the heart of every small community. Ancient grudges, curses, deals with the devil, and the blank-eyed stares of doppelgangers spoken of only in whispers as “the hollows”; these are but some of the many tales hidden in the shadows of Black Hollow, Ontario.

Inspired by horror anthologies past and present, Black Hollow will add a slice of small-town Canadian life to stories that wouldn’t be out of place on The Twilight Zone, Tales from The Crypt, or any of the Eerie Comics back catalogue.

story:
The Infection...

My name is Raymond Dowaliby and I am the founder of Angry Art Press and the Creator/Writer of DEAD MOON.  After founding SCARS Magazine in 2005(a Horror Entertainment Publication) I realized I needed to tell stories and what better way than through comics?  I came up with the concept of DEAD MOON and began writing...I knew what I wanted and I also knew I wanted to be part of a Killer team so I began assembling a Horror Comic Dream Team.


Assisting with the writing chores is Tom Towles(Henry Portrait Of A Serial Killer, House Of A Thousand Corpses) and Jason Craig(Freddy VS Jason VS Ash).


With the writing firmly in place, the art had to just right.  Daniel Campos(KISS 4K) is penciling the mini series while I'm proud to introduce Lee Roy Lopez on pencils for DEAD MOON: In the Beginning and Renzo supplying us with our first killer cover!.


Adam Braun(Razor) is a driving force when it comes to inks and creation!  He will be helming VAMPORIA under the Angry Art flag as well as giving life in the way of inks to DEAD MOON.


Gia Nova(Playboy, Rob Zombie's Halloween 2) dons the costume and brings Lucine to life!  Her haunting beauty and keen sense of marketing are what make this character what it is.


With your help we can achieve comic greatness!  Our only limits are our own imaginations and judging by what has come out so far the limits will be few and we will provide you with great entertainment!





DEAD MOON

Dead Moon centers around female protagonist, "Lucine." A former operative for the Armenian Resistance: a notoriously savage gun and money runner for the underground's fight against the violent  Turkish regime. Known in covert circles as "The American Fixer."

Lucine conquered an aggressive form of breast cancer as an unwitting guinea pig for a radical new form of chemotherapy developed by doctor Todesengel in Germany. Dr. Todesengel is none other than the grandson of the infamous Dr. Josef Mengele (AKA "The Angel of Death," so named for his fondness for torturous experiments inflicted on Jews during the Holocaust.) During this harrowing treatment, he also ensured that Lucine would be host for a vaccine he has been testing for decades.

Todesengel is also responsible for the creation of 90% of the world's pharmaceutical supply. Ultimately devising a plan to combine his pharmaceuticals with "The Catalyst" and contaminate the water supply in every major city. The result is a zombie apocalypse, re-animating the recently dead who in turn infect victims via blood-thirsty bites. Lucine stumbles upon a group of 6 survivors she reluctantly allows to come along in their fight to survive. What Todesengel never anticipated was Lucine ingesting his other assorted drug concoctions by way of exposure to zombie flesh.

This transforms Lucine into the first Zombie/Human hybrid and with this discovery comes power and drawbacks. She will attempt to comprehend her neo-biological origins and battle her way to a vaccine -- losing friends, family and a part of her own humanity -- along the way.

DEAD MOON: In The Beginning, introduces you to Lucine by showing how she dealt with her beginning before the harkening of the end.

What We Need The Funding For

When you fund, the monies raised will go toward paying talent and the purchase of Tee Shirts, 11X17 Posters and the printing of books for funders.  It will also help us solidify Angry Art Press as a force to be reckoned with by enabling us to promote our brand at conventions!  We want to be around to keep creating and providing sexy, scary entertainment for the masses!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make the dip into your rent money, we get it!  But you can still help!  Follow us on Facebook and Twitter and make sure you tell others to do so and with those numbers we can achieve LEGION!

http://www.facebook.com/AngryArtPress 

http://www.facebook.com/pages/Angry-Art-Press/282072845190114 

https://twitter.com/#!/DEADMOONcomic 

https://www.angryartpress.com

story:
Lance Hunter was the baddest cop alive in Los Angeles till a drug bust in a warehouse full of strange chemicals went down all wrong.


Now he’s just the baddest cop in Los Angeles.


                          SHAMBLING HEAT!


Part of the fun of going to see movies in the theater is seeing the trailers before. If you’re a geek like me (odds are good you are if you’re reading this) you experience a heady thrill seeing the POTENTIAL of a great movie. You poured over the Dark Knight Rises trailer figuring out the plot. You’re pulse quickens when Gollum is revealed in The Hobbit trailer. Maybe you even get a smidge watery eyed when the Wreck-It Ralph trailer plays (I don’t know why but I always get a tiny bit choked up during animation trailers).
Then there are the OTHER trailers.
Stuff like whatever the newest Michael Bay assault on your senses is or that movie you haven’t heard about even on the newsfeeds which looks…Meh. Or a trailer for a movie that looks so cliché ridden and by the numbers that you wouldn’t see it unless it’s in late August and you need air-conditioning for two hours.
The trailer that has the ad line “From the studio that brought you…”


The trailer that proudly announces a mid-Febuary premier.


The trailer that has Alan Rickman or Sean Bean playing the bad guy.


A trailer like “Shambling Heat”.


Shambling Heat is a one shot comic book gleefully sending up/paying homage to the big dumb high concept action movies we’re all guilty of seeing. But doing it as the trailer for the big dumb high concept action movie, MPAA rating title card, studio logos and exploding Ice cream trucks included!
The story is about tough, play by his own rules, LA supercop Det. Lance Hunter becoming a zombie. He slowly regains his humanity while he and his lady’s man, fast talking black partner Lincoln Washington try and take down evil drug lord with a high society veneer Garrison Cain. Hilarity and zombie carnage ensue.
Oh yeah, it’s also a zombie parody; two for the price of one.

                            SHAMBLING HEAT
      WHERE THE LAWLESS MEETS THE LIFELESS!

 

The first version, in glorious black and white will be hitting the Kindle right after lettering is done. The funds I'm looking for here is for the print and color version so it can go to comic stores and cons. Eventually it'll be part of a trade collection but thats another project.

story:
I ask of you. Had you ever been forced to choose between buying a comic book with remarkable artwork but no substance or a book with a decent storyline but unappealing visuals? Why settle when you can have it all? Not only are we fans who had grow tired of trends like this but we are also independent creators who had gather in an effort to create compelling story lines with stunning visuals.

Revolt Comics will bring you the next boom in the comic book industry today! With upcoming titles such as Son’s of Ael, illustrated and written by artist extraordinaire Angel G. Falto, Deadly Rose written by David Hernandez and drawn by the amazingly talented Alice V. Falto and other titles such as Outlanders, Pharaoh, Ignite Saint Malefactor and Monster, written by David G. Hernandez, we guarantee that we’ll restore your faith in comic books again.

To commemorate this special occasion we are creating a book just for those who pledge a certain amount. See the sidebar for more details.


A visual guide of what you'll be getting

A preview of Showcase #1


Some of the trading Cards we will be offerings as rewards

And some of the posters
